Reviews.Title: “The Sapphire should be your first choice in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: juzepi
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here and were happy to know that we would be picked up at the airport. At the hotel, we were greeted like visiting dignitaries; offered a welcome beverage; given a little souvenir; given a map and tourist suggestions and ushered to our room. Everything about the room said "welcome" In addition to a full minibar, there was a beautiful tea box with an assortment of teas and coffees. The buffet breakfast had enough choices to make everyone happy. They recommended a full-day tour that certainly did not disappoint. The location of the hotel could not be better. It's on a pedestrian street within walking distance to most of Istanbul's many attractions. On checking out, they arranged for transportation to the airport and gave us a box of Turkish delight and a little tea set as a gift. Like its name, it truly is a "gem" of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nice hotes”
Reviews.Author: mlgMiami
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very kind personal. Rooms are very good, the breakfast is super complete.

Reviews.Title: “great location + great service=great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dmiller148
Reviews.Content: Great Service: I stayed here in January of 2012. January is not a very busy tourist time in Istanbul, so we had plenty of terrific service everywhere we went in the city. The hotel was had the best service of all though. The staff was always very friendly and offered lots of tips for places to go and things to do while there. They were even good at answering strange and difficult questions, (i.e. "What is a Turkish bath?" "Are all Turkish baths co-ed?" "Americans tend to have modest sensibilities... will we be comfortable at a Turkish bath?") They had a good breakfast in the morning-- great to get you prepared for the rest of your day site-seeing. The rooms were cozy (read "small"-but that is typical in the historic district), but had plenty of storage and I had a great view from my balcony-style windows. Great location: The area surrounding the hotel is very historic and you can walk to many of the most visited sites in the city. Hagia Sofia, Topkopi Palace, the Basilica Cistern, and the Blue Mosque were about a five to ten minute walk and there was a lot to see on the way; the Grand Bazaar was only about another 5 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Peyiapanther
Reviews.Content: There were 32 of us staying in the hotel from 12th to 15th March this year. We are all amateur photographers and the location was superb. Firstly the staff were very attentive, they couldn't do enough to ensure we enjoyed our stay. The rooms are not large but excellent as they had everything we needed including tea and coffee making facilities, which can be unusual in Turkey. The location for us with our requirements was excellent, lots on our doorstep, plus the tram just a few metres away. Around the hotel were good eating facilities and we found that the prices here were excellent, including the wine. The hotel is located on a pedestrian only street therefore if you have difficulty in getting around it is perhaps not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Carey-Grant
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great location for touring the old city, Staff were very attentive and enthusiastic, took initiative to make sure guests were looked after and seemed happy in their work. The breakfast buffet was more than pleasing with something for everyone unless all you wanted was bacon eggs and white toast (though you could come close). The room was admittedly small but clean comfortable and quiet at night. I could hear street noises on the front side room but they were well muted by the closed window. Shuttle pick up at airport was appreciated (I advise you take your time reading the shuttle notices with guest names on them, there are hundreds). Galata Bridge, Topkapi, Haiga Sophia and Blue Mosque are all so close a taxi or public transit are more bother than their worth. Recommend the Tea Terraces at the very back of Gulhane Park (adjacent Topkapi) for a special way to end you day while staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TSV
Reviews.Content: I had higher expectations of the Sapphire hotel, as I had read the reviews on Tripadvisor. Don't get me wrong - the hotel is ok, but not fabulous. It is located close to the sights in the old city and has some good restaurants near by. The staff is friendly and helpful and speaks good english. Rooms are clean and adequate. But the walls are paper thin, so I had the "pleasure" of hearing everything they were talking about in the room next to mine as they returned to their room late at night. Breakfast buffet was large, but there was no fresh fruit, except for oranges and apples, that you had to peel yourself. So all in all I'm satisfied - but not overwhelmed. For the price, though, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kinoto
Reviews.Content: We loved the treatment of the hotel staff very friendly and will help in everything. The breakfast is very complete and very natural. The rooms quite comfortable. This in a place of many restaurants, bars. Easy access to everything. Go back to the hotel. The most ugly is the decor a bit old. Istanbul is magnificent

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Hotel Sapphire”
Reviews.Author: marywro
Reviews.Content: I have been to Istanbul before and had a nice time but this trip was outstanding, and I believe that is due in large part to the Hotel Sapphire. First, it is the warm & friendly greeting every time you come and go. (btw, the hotel is on a pedestrian street so make sure your taxi/driver calls the hotel who will send someone to help with the luggage). And then there are the rooms which are lovely...I know some may think they are small but I didn't think so...I've been in much smaller in many other cities (Athens, London, etc). I loved the old wood floors, the regal crown molding, the rooms were inviting and comfortable. (they also have a heated swimming pool though we didn't use it --too busy running around). The location was outstanding...a block or so from the tram, many wonderful sidewalk cafes/restaurants to chose from nearby, & walking distance to the Spice Market. All that would have prompted me to give the Hotel my highest rating but I also had some trouble with an airline reservation and Ali and the manager, Engin, worked tirelessly to sort it out. Engin Eysen in particular, kept going up the chain to get this issue resolved...it was unbelievable --I had been afraid I would be stranded. My husband and I look forward to coming back to both Istanbul and the Hotel Sapphire. The whole experience created wonderful memories of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: KPG81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 days and had a wonderful experience. Rooms are a bit on the small side but have everything you need and are very clean. The location is perfect for exploring Istanbul - central but not noisy. The best part of the hotel is the wonderful staff who help with everything! From suggesting tours, carrying luggage, offering tea or coffee after a long day of touring or providing suggestions for dinner - they help. Breakfast was always interesting and tasty. Thanks so much to Ali for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A good value hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RPDSPD
Reviews.Content: We have visited Istanbul on several occasions, staying generally in the area of Sultanamet, but it was our first time to stay at this hotel and we were not disappointed. We were met by some very welcoming staff at reception, offered a welcome drink and were quickly shown to our room. I had particularly asked for a quiet room and this was situated on the 4th floor at the end of the corridor, which turned out to be fine - though unfortunately on our first night we had to deal with very noisy guests next door who arrived back to their room at 3:00am! Nevertheless the beds were very comfortable and otherwise we slept well. Breakfast was good, with a large variety to choose from, but it was busy so it's best to arrive fairly early - by 9:00am on one morning some guests were queuing for tables. We didn't use the sauna / swimming facilities as they were closed on Sat / Sun, but we were impressed with all the staff, especially the bellboys and Denis who we met at reception. Sapphire was a charming hotel, ideally located and very reasonably priced in comparison with other hotels we have stayed in over the years. We will definitely check if there is availability on our future visits to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Donny S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely located: close to all major attractions in old city and just a few minutes walk away from a tram station. I stayed at this hotel twice and got two different rooms but all were clean and nicely appointed. The hotel has a swimming pool in the basement but I did not have the chance to try it. What made the hotel outstanding was the staff. All staff members (Onur, in particular) were nice and accomodating. They wanted to make sure that I had all the information that I needed. One thing that I will always remember is the surprise gifts they gave on check out. So nice and was really unexpected.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Tatilde
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, friendly hotel in a very good location. Substantial breakfast included. We made use of the swimming pool and sauna, which were both good. Our last day in Istanbul was wet, so we sat in the hotel until it was time to leave. The staff supplied us with coffee, which was a nice touch. Also received a gift from the hotel on departure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: geero
Reviews.Content: What you see and read about this hotel on TA is what you get. The location is great, very close to the Gulhane tram stop and within easy walking distance to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Spice Market, Ferry Docks and a 5 minuite tram ride to the Grand Bazaar. The room was just as depicted on TA and the hotel's web site. The breakfast is more than continental. There is a wide variety of fruits, pastries, vegetables, breads, cold cuts, eggs, coffee,tea and juices. What makes this hotel stand out is the staff. They are excellent! From the moment you arrive ( you receive an orientation about the hotel and Istanbul) a welcome drink and a Turkish Delight. They answer all questions and offer suggestions of things to do and see. The cleaning staff and porters are always pleasant and greet you with smiles and a "Hello". The complimentary airport pickup was excellent. I recommend this hotel to anyone who is travelling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The best location”
Reviews.Author: Minatas
Reviews.Content: The hotel Sapphire is on a street with only foot traffic, a real rarity in Istanbul.The location of the hotel was perfect near Topkapi. It was so easy to walk to all the main sights i.e. Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque etc. All the staff were warm and very friendly. Our room was very clean and comfortable with plenty of tea and coffee. We enjoyed the breakfast, there was plenty of choice and something for all tastes. The pick-up from and to the airport was great. We would stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Istanbul for whatever reason.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like HOME!”
Reviews.Author: Reno1987
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a central location and was very easy to reach by the metro. Its a 2 minute walk from the Gulhane metro station, so getting around is very convenient too. On reaching the hotel, we were put at relative ease by Dennis (the receptionist). He walked us through what to expect during our trip, while he explained we were treated to some Turkish tea and the Turkish Delight. I must say, he made a terrific first impression. He gave us all the information we could have asked for and made things as simple as he could. The rooms were'nt disappointing either. We stayed in a triple room for 2 nights and it was a very cozy stay. We had very prompt room service, the room are well kept, and the toilets (although small) were also very clean. The breakfast was served from 07-10am, and was very good too. It served as a perfect stimulant for a long day of activity. The hotel is located within walking distance from all the important attractions, like the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Top Kapi, Basilica Cistern and many others. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody going there, you wont be disappointed. Its warm and welcoming hotel, i would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great locale; slightly noisy”
Reviews.Author: sjalbertson
Reviews.Content: Great location and walking distance to most large attractions in the old city. The tram is just down the street and only 1 Turkish Lira per person per trip without buying a pass. This is a great way to head over to the Asian side and also to zip around the city - consult your travel guides for the simple 1 or 2 lines that run. Hotel is reachable by foot only - our shuttle bus parked around the corner and helped us with our bags to the hotel. The hotel arranged a FREE shuttle FROM the airport only - we had to pay about 20 Euro to take a 5am van back to the airport. There is a top rated restaurant, Pasazade just kiddy corner across the street from the hotel - excellent and a higly recommended Trip Advisor restaurant. We loved it and wished we had found it at the beginning of our trip rather than the end. Our room was the basic, standard room and tightly held 3 twin beds and a cramped but suffient bathroom with a little tile work problem (perhaps an earthquake shook some tiles loose?) and we heard the plumbing from our neighbors above and to the side every time they flushed, ran the shower, or sink; we could also hear our neighbors scooting around and things from the street - but it wasn't really all that distruptive; a sensitive sleeper may benefit from earplugs. It wasn't anything I wouldn't expect from a refurbished building of this era. Overall the hotel staff was super friendly, welcoming, nice, and helpful and i would stay here again and recommend this hotel to friends. We received some Turkish Delight and beverages (go for the hot apple tea...it's an Istanbul staple or some chery juice) on our arrive while the hotel staff gave us some pointers about staying in the city. We also received a nice parting gift upon our leaving of the hotel to remember them by. Overall - nice visit; good hotel; absolutely would recommend this hotel to family and friends and would come back myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Timmy_Hughes
Reviews.Content: The location, the helpfulness of the staff and the facilities itself make for a fantastic hotel. Superb quality for the price makes it a must for visitors to this great city. So close to the tram line (not close enough to hear from inside though). Walking distance to all important sites in the Old City. Great breakfast, Great Health Suite downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful hotel and superb staff”
Reviews.Author: lindamc161
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel could not be more helpful. As this was our first visit to Istanbul it was good to be able to ask about directions to the main attractions. We also received help with using the excellent public transport network. Reception staff used the internet to book our seats on our return flights and printed off boarding cards. They were superb and could not have been more helpful. Our room was clean, comfortable with more than enough space for our 7 day stay. Breakfast was a lot more substantial than expected. In fact the whole hotel experience was better than expected. A roof terrace with excellent views of this beautifu city. Good size indoor swimming pool. Located in a superb area for all attractions, good resturants and transport. I can recomment this excellent value for money hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sapphire”
Reviews.Author: MickoClonmel_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel within walking distance of all Istanbul's attractions. Room was small but spotlessly clean and cleaned every day. Staff were polite and helpful. On arrival and departure received a gift from the hotel. Free internet in reception and reception printed off my boarding cards for flight home free of charge. Would return to this hotel and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Anomis A
Reviews.Content: We fell in love with this hotel as soon as we walked in. Receptionist and other all-male staff welcomed us with a fresh juice and turkish specialty desserts, while working on our check-in. Our room was beautiful, clean and very quiet (as all the rooms in this hotel). It was lovely to find a selection of teas and coffee in an oriental box on the table. Room and bathroom were very modern but you could stil feel the middle east atmosphere here. Breakfast buffet had a great selection, the staff was very helpful with providing us with any information. Location of this hotel is perfect, not on a main noisy street with the trams, but a block away, hidden between the other hotels. We would love to return back in the future, and definately would stay at Sapphire again!

Reviews.Title: “Prime location”
Reviews.Author: Robin H
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sapphire is situated in the perfect location for your trip to Istanbul. The hotel is within walking distance to all the tourist hotspots. Hotel staff were very helpful and willing to assist with any request. The rooms are well appointed and suitably clean. Our overall impression was very good with the location certainly being the selling point. Situated in a picturesque cobbled lane which doesn't allow cars. Good quality reasonable restaurants line this lane outside the hotel which means only a brief stroll to your room after a lazy dinner. The hotel offers excellent value for money but don't expect too much from the breakfast which is fairly ordinary but consistent with all the other hotels we experienced in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeandLisha
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in perfect walking distance from the Blue Mosque and surrounding sites. The hotel itself is a bit dated but the rooms are great: cleaned daily and have stocked minifridge and coffee/tea. The breakfast buffet has lots of choices and does the trick in the morning. There are TONS of restaurants nearby and easy access to the train system. The hotel has a pool (but was fairly cold), sauna and they had just put in a Turkish Bath. Front desk staff are very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend this hotel for sigthtseeing Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Anders E
Reviews.Content: Our vacation in Istanbul and Hotel Sapphire has been so nice. Hotel Sapphire has the best staff, personal service and the greatest breakfast buffet we ever met! We really recommend Hotel Sapphire!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: mrinalika
Reviews.Content: We stayed in sapphire for 5 days and have nothing but pleasant memories and wonderful things to say about the place. Although the rooms are a little small , Sapphire does gives you the perfect combination of a convenient location at a great price with fantastic Services. Courteous and friendly staff helps the first timers with planning their trips and give valuable suggestions. Not to miss the sumptuous breakfast layout. A great place to come back to each evening after a tiring day out. Ali the front desk manager is a great guy to reach out to help you plan your stay. We would highly recommend the hotel to people looking to stay close to the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: girltravelingforfun
Reviews.Content: For the price, this hotel was excellent. The location was perfect for exploring Old Town. Every morning they had an incredible, huge breakfast buffet, perfect for starting the day. The pool and sauna downstairs was also a nice touch. The staff were very friendly and spoke good English (not entirely common in Istanbul). I booked a single room, which was not large, but as I do not spend tons of time in the room, it was not an issue. It was furnished nicely and the bed was comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet hotel with super price”
Reviews.Author: Juraj B
Reviews.Content: Good Location, very quiet area, breakfast super, swim.pool fine and good temperature (29-30Â°), personal very kindly, when taxi driver will call to the hotel reception (show him tel.number) - no problem find hotel

Reviews.Title: “great stuff, great value”
Reviews.Author: Brendan r
Reviews.Content: there are so nice guys at the reception,so helpful they can inform u everything about istanbul ,like concierge.i had very nice 2 city tours.(thank you guys) hotel has agreat location and so clean. higly recommended ;)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Our Instanbul Stay”
Reviews.Author: MRP2012
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sapphire from Jan 14 thru Jan 20, 2012. This hotel was recommended by my brother who had stayed there earlier. I am so glad he did. The most important requirement for a traveller is the comfort and security that he must feel when staying overseas, and we certainly felt assured in Sapphire. It did help that we were introduced to Mr Engin Evsen, the GM/owner of the hotel. He was always available to advise us of our daily intended tours/walkabouts. Strong plus points : free wifi with excellent connectivity, nourishing and refreshing breakfast, very friendly front desk and service staff who also provided lots of advice and friendship, and a comfortable lounge-bar for night caps. Location was superb - close to tourist attractions, the tram station and our travel agent, Overseas Travel Agency. The standard room we stayed in was very clean and well appointed with a safe, electric kettle with coffee and tea satchets, minibar and wall-mounted flat screen TV. The standard room will suit a couple well. Other facilities that impressed and surprised us included a subterranean pool and sauna/steam and massage rooms in the basement. We look forward to another visit to Istanbul and a stay in Sapphire again during summer, when the weather is warmer. Muruga R Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: happytrails500
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Safir and, although the rooms are quite small, the beds are comfortable, room was very clean and the location could not be better. The hotel staff were very welcoming and obviously wanted guests to enjoy the hotel and the city. They were responsive by email in advance of our arrival in arranging transportation from the airport--the only problem we had was a significant delay with that transport, but we did not blame the hotel. Overall, it was a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Turkish Experience”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sapphire has a real Turkish feel to it and we were really impressed with the style and quality of the room decorations. Think gold cornices, inlaid timbers doors and dresser. Completely different to the run of the mill chain hotels. We loved it. The room was quite small, which is fine for two, but if you are planning for a party it will be too small. There is an incredible array available on the breakfast buffet, both Western and Turkish, hot and cold. It was a high point of each day. Sapphire is in a quaint lane way in the heart of the tourist area. We walked to all of the tourist areas and were very comfortable strolling around to select a restaurant for dinner each evening, though one of our favourites was straight across the lane. We made good use of the free wifi and really appreciated the free pickup from the airport. My wife is very sensitive to cigarette smoke, but there was no problem here. I guess it depends which room you get and who was in there last. The staff are all really helpful - no request is too difficult and they all have good English.

Reviews.Title: “Good tourist location”
Reviews.Author: Mido2003
Reviews.Content: We booked for four days from the 10th to the 14th of january after reading some review bothe From booking.com and trip advisor.It was not as I expected.rooms are a little too small.and the towels Are too old.I think they can afford to put a new one specially that turkey is known for it's Good quality towels.also the rooms are heated by the AC system which is too noisy.also it hard to take a shower because the shwer room is too cold.the good think about the hotel is the location which is in the heart of most tourist site also to the tramway station is very near(sirkeci Station). the front desk service is very professional and very helpful if you need any advise just don't hesitate to ask them.Beds are comfortable but a bit small.the best way to get from the airport to the hotel is the tramway to sirkeci station which is very near to the hotel course if u r not carrying a heavy suitcase

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly located hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Boulder-USA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really in the center of everything, but on a quaint narrow street that adds to the ambiance. Our room was very clean and the staff were extremely gracious. We'll take a hotel like this any day over the more grandiose western style hotels.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: carmen n
Reviews.Content: It was a nice stay at this hotel. The staff hospitality is great. We really enjoyed it! Everything from the welcome, transfer to airport and presentation of all the places that could be visited in Istanbul was very good! We hope to return soon to Istanbul and choose this hotel again.The location is great walking distance to main sight, also we lik.e SPA, especially the swimming pool Thank you again for all!

Reviews.Title: “Just Location ! Nothing More !”
Reviews.Author: ADL777
Reviews.Content: Saphire Hotel is a budget hotel with average service with a good location. We didnt expect more but we expected at least a clean bed. The linen was not clean ! Only the location was perfect. Dont ask the staff about restaurant recommendations. I think they are getting commission !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: swmi_edi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and can't recommend it enough. It has a great location from where you can walk to all the main sights of Istanbul, very helpful staff, beautifully decorated rooms, excellent sauna/jacuzzi/swimming pool and great amenities. The only disappointment we had was with the breakfast. Everything looked so tired and the taste was at least not appealing to western taste. We had turkish breakfast in other hotels and it was a lot nicer. But this is just a small point as the food is incredibly cheap in Turkey so its easy enough to have breakfast somewhere else. Would stay here again when we are in Istanbul and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Execllence Is The Word To Describe This Great Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vetri R
Reviews.Content: I had a very great time in the hotel. The staff performed wonderful and efficient Service overall. I have no complains. The employees including the General Manager, Duty Manager, House Keeping, Floor/Room Service staff and the Chefs were great in what they did and were very professional and helpful in their approach of Service. The room, food, cleanliness and the service provided were that of a very high quality. I have no regrets in staying there and recommend other future guests who want to stay in the hotel. In fact I have recommended it to my brother who will be visiting Istanbul in January. I am planning to return hopefully next year to Istanbul with the family and this hotel will be my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Sapphire...... a little gem.”
Reviews.Author: Buellrider
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here on a weekend break and although hard to find was very satisfied with my choice. Ambience - Great atmosphere, ottoman style with quaint touches, I liked the parabolic ceiling in the reception area. Welcome - Very warm and efficient booking in procedure. Room - 414 Superior room. Not bad at all, not realy large enough for two although a twin but comfortable and clean with a flat screen TV, Safe, minibar and efficient heating/aircon. Staff - Friendly, helpfull and accomodating. I thought the gift of a tea set and Turkish delight on checkout was a lovely touch. Other Points - I never used the sauna or pool but I checked them out and it looked good down there. Grumbles - Only one. The breakfast buffet, although large with lots of choice held nothing that could interest me and to be honest Im not hard to please, a lot of it just didnt seem apetising. Value - Good. I paid 49 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Believe everything you read!”
Reviews.Author: Linda-Karen
Reviews.Content: It really is as good as many of the reviewers write. Friendly staff, excellent service and in the middle of all of the buz. Absolutely recommend this hotel and will come back on next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: captainbb
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the hotel we were greeted by a very friendly helpful staff. Whilst booking into our room we were treated to complimentary cherry juice and Turkish delights! The receptionist was extremely helpful and explained the surrounding sights of Sultahammet and the local area around Istanbul. The rooms were of a good size but future bookers beware there are a limited amount of double beds but don't be downhearted as in our case the singles were quite easily pushed together. The beds were extremely comfortable. Rooms were clean and came with safe,mini bar, satellite TV, tea coffee facilities and a good hairdryer. The staff have an excellent level of English which was helpful as I relied on Google translate in another. The hotel is surrounded by street restaurants, walking distance of the blue mosque and the grand bazaar which houses over 4000 stalls !! If your brave enough to try the public transport the hotel is a 2min walk from a tram stop. We stayed over on a Friday & Saturday night which came to â‚¬110 total . If i am to be picky the breakfast room which is located at basement level could do a refurb but thats me being picky. The breakfast buffet consisted of cereals, breads, jams, cheeses,fruit, hot and cold meats, juice tea and coffee. Upon checking out we received a gift of Turkish tea and Turkish delights to take home . Every guest did . Its fair to say we shall return if fortunes allow

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: Iatraveler123
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Sapphire pre-cruise. The location is the best as are the desk attendants. They were so helpful in every way. We stayed 3 people in a room and I had concerns about that, but the room was of ample size and we had no problems. We feel the Sapphire is the best value in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: PragmaticCinderella
Reviews.Content: Just back from week end in Istanbul. Stayed at Sapphire hotel and was not dissapointed! Located in historical center (walking distance to Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi palace), but quite big hotel and in very easy to find location (in comparison with lots of small hotels over the Blue Mosque). At the same time 3 min by walk to Galata bridge with ferries. After making reservation hotel contacted us the same day and we got free shutlle from airport even in the middle of night! Also we got few compliments from hotel! small but it was really nice! Rooms are not big but really OK! breakfast was sufficient in terms of variaties! The only issue was in room - sound isolation and we really heard how our neighbors take a shower. but judging my expirience in old city its really everywhere! Room was very clean! So for the next trip i will choose the same hotel and really recommend it to all!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Bohz
Reviews.Content: But the breakfast could need additional choices Very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Denitsa T
Reviews.Content: I am from Bulgaria. I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel. It's a very nice place, with excellent position in the middle of the historical center. I recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and customer service is a gem in the rough here”
Reviews.Author: sasiki1
Reviews.Content: The host and customer service here go above and beyond. The location is top notch, close to the tram and 10-15 minute walk to all the tourist hot spots. If you want to explore the night life on friday and saturday go to taksim square. It should only cost you between 12-15 lire. I definitely would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Bamboozuld
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sapphire is a wonderful place to stay in Istanbul. The location is very central. It's located within walking distance from all the sites in Sultanahmet (Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace, etc). And it's a couple of minutes walk from the tram station (Gulhane station) if you wish to go to Taksim for shopping and nightlife. The tram ride does not take more than 10 min. The cab ride back from Taksim at night (the tram stops running after midnight) is usually about 15 Turkish Lira (approx. 8 USD). The hotel itself is very clean and the staff is very friendly and professional. They are always there to answer any questions about the attractions and how to get to them. You can walk everywhere in Sultanahmet without getting lost. Just follow the tram lines. The free continental breakfast has good variey. The rooms are available at an affordable price which is a big plus (I was travelling alone) . The hotel is highly recommeded!

Reviews.Title: “Service, Style and Great Food”
Reviews.Author: Dave M
Reviews.Content: Perfect loaction on walking street one block from Topkapi Palace. Easy walk to all sights of Sultanahmet incl Blue Mosque, Haiga Sophia, Bazaar and spice market. Engin and his staff are the most helpful, polite and friendly people I have found anywhere in my travels. Great breakfast buffet. Very helpful to arrange tours travel ad transpotatation. The stay at Hotel Saphir was one of the most pleasant we have experienced anywhere in the world. I have never felt so welcomed by hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect Location”
Reviews.Author: donnapersino
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location. Walking distance to tram, sightseeing and restuarants. The staff was so helpful, even walked us to one of our attractions. They can't do enought for you. The street this hotel is on is line with restaurants -- all of them wonderful. The prices at the resturants are lower than the main street and the tourist areas. It is a little older, but very clean. Rooms are on the small side, but there's so much to do and see that you shouldn't be in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel on a quaint street”
Reviews.Author: SanPoo
Reviews.Content: Was very happy with our stay and the service at Safir. They allowed us an early check in and late check out. Arranged a taxi last minute for our airport drop. The rooms are a bit small, but comfortable for a couple. We spent almost 2 weeks in Turkey, so we had gotten used to small rooms by the time we got to Istanbul, which was the last leg of our holiday. The location is excellent with very easy access to the tram station, the major monuments and the Bosphorus. Would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “7 night @ Sapphire, I will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: CorneKSAandRSA
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location - 5 minute walk to Gulhane tram station which connects to all major attractions and Ataturk airport. Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi palace etc etc 10-15mins walk from hotel. Many restaurants and bars are situated around the hotel. The rooms are clean and comfortable, breakfast buffet is great and hotel offers airport pickup. The staff are friendly, speak English, they are helpful and knowledgeable on Istanbul attractions. I highly recommend Hotel Sapphire!

Reviews.Title: “A real Safir!”
Reviews.Author: Nidos
Reviews.Content: Everything was just great - e-mail conversation, arrival ("welcome drink"), staying (stuff was really friendly and helpful), rooms (clean and convenient), bed (slept like in our home bed), location (close to important sights), breakfast (everybody have talked about that :-), good-bye gifts etc. We promised that we'll definitely stay in Safir next time when we are in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cordoba1963
Reviews.Content: Location cannot be any better as it is within a short walk of the main sites. Very friendly and cheerful staff. A good size, warm and clean triple bedroom. The breakfast is beyound any description or expectation. In summery, an exceptional hotel to match an exceptional city.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: PrzemysÅ‚aw O
Reviews.Content: Affordable, clean. perfect location, very nice staff, great breakfast, gifts. All you can imagine. Walking distance from the most important monuments. Nice bars and restaurants in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally suited for sightseeing near Blue Mosque, cisterns etc.”
Reviews.Author: lizandianp
Reviews.Content: Lots of character, beds and furniture liberally decorated with lots of gold.Comfortable beds. tea making tray. Flat screen TV. Free internet access.Pool and sauna.Adequate lifts.Some street noise in front rooms. Food not surprisingly Turkish but there is an excellent inexpensive restaurant right opposite called Harem. Lots of small shops in area for water, alcohol etc. Both the Aya Sofia and blue Mosque in one direction and the Railway station and Galata bridge in the other are less than ten minutes walk. There is also a good tram line at the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: winemama88
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure this hotel was, staff was excellent and so friendly. Hotel is located just minutes from the rail that will get you all over town, and within walking distance of everything. We could not have asked for anything more. The room was clean and breakfast was very good. All the e-mails we sent with questions were answered quickly. We would stay there anytime. We always felt safe there

Reviews.Title: “Superior location”
Reviews.Author: Cyrus g
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in an excellent location. It looks great from outside, and you are immediately served with a very friendly staff. The room was very tastefully done and all necessities (i.e. tea, coffee, tissue, complimentary water, water boiler, nice toiletries, hair dryer, WiFi) provided complimentary. The breakfast was very nice, and staff in restaurant were extremely attentive and nice. Excellent restaurants, coffee shops, Tram, historic sites and whatever else you need at your walking distance. We got couple of gifts (Turkish sweets, and an Apple tea set), when we were checking out. Our complaints are: 1 - We reserved a double bed, but they could only give us a room with three single beds, so we had to put two of the single beds together to make a double bed, which ruined the decor. 2 - In our room we could hear the sound of the automatic lobby door all night long, which was a big bother. 3 - the rooms were on the smaller side for comparable hotels in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Ter35
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of the balance of the reviews on here and was not disappointed. 2 things stand out. First the location is perfect for a tourist in that it is 5 or so mins walk from Topkapi Palace, Aya Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Basilica Cistern, the Galata Bridge, 10 to the Spice Bazaar and the Grand Bazaar and around 15 mins to the Suleymaniye Mosque. Also, it is very close to a tram stop, which is cheap to use (2 Lira flate rate per trip) and that line will take you to within 5 mins walk of the Dolhambace Palace and the Theodosian Walls (at Topkapi - not to be confused with the Palace). The hotel is on a narrow bustling street lined with cafes, restaurants and other hotels which means there is buzz, but also your room may be overlooking it. It is traffic free but there is music (not loud, not late and definitely not disco type music) and the noise of busy bustle so you may want ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. Second, the staff are outstandingly pleasant, efficient, helpful and impartial. For example, I heard someone asking if they could change money at the hotel. The staff said that, of course they could, but they charge 3% commission and the person could get a better rate at a place around the corner. When I arrived, the 2 wall lights in my room were not working and I mentioned it at reception. Someone came back with me in the lift to sort the problem (one bulb gone and one fitting loose that needed jiggling) immediately. All advice on directions, things to do etc etc was very helpful and cheerfully given. Even before I arrived e-mails were responded to inside a day. These 2 things alone warrant a recommendation, and I would (probably will) go back. I had a single room which was fine for me. I don't know if other rooms are bigger but this would have been cramped for 2. The big bed (2 full sized singles pushed together) had plenty of room one side but was only a few inches from the wall and window the other side, (I do wish, however, that they would always use sheets that are big so that the bottom one tucks in on the sides and at the bottom. They were changed frequently, however) Flat screen satellite TV (instructions as to how to work it would have helped: I never worked it out, but didn't care). Bathroom was fine if you like showers (good power shower and hot water) - the bath was small to bathe it and the sealant against the wall was a bit scruffy. Mini-bar and fridge and safe box in the room. My room was hot and the air conditioning only seemed to blow hot, but it was early November so opening a window during the day was fine. Very clean. (See above for comments about overlooking the small street outside). Free wi-fi is provided and this worked well. Overall, for me, the room was fine but not brilliant. Breakfast was a large buffet and was also fine. The lobby/lounge area is comfortable and a nice area to read/chat or use a computer. There is a bar just off it, so you can have a drink but it's not buzzy, just a place to get a drink from. Lots of buzzy places right outside the door though. I think the hotel has a restaurant but I didn't use it and did not see anyone else doing so. The front desk recommended a restaurant 50m away (Ozler) which was so good that I happily ate there most evenings. (I'd definitely recommend it). Another example of good advice from the front desk. There are dozens of restauants within 3 mins walk. The hotel has a pool and sauna in the basement but I didn't go down there so can't comment. The hotel organises a free pick up from the airport, which worked fine. They arranged a private transfer back to the airport (50 lira/20 Euro) which developed mechanical problems en route and did most of the journey in 2nd gear but that's hardly the hotel's fault! Overall, the reviews on here led me to this hotel from the vast and bewildering number in Istanbul. I'm glad it did and I'd definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: VickiMc1
Reviews.Content: From the perfect location to the best front desk staff to the most comfy beds in the world to a delicious breakfast buffet, you won't find a better hotel in Istanbul than Hotel Sapphire! We stayed here before leaving on a 12-day Mediterranean cruise and it still ranks as one of the favorite parts of our vacation. I spent a long time looking for the perfect hotel at the perfect price and I can save you that trouble--STAY AT HOTEL SAPPHIRE!

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull exeperiance”
Reviews.Author: Sami A
Reviews.Content: My experiance in sapphire hotel was so wonderfull i stayed three nights on Oct 26 2011 ,I was happy to book in this hotel due to reviews here and after staying i was so happy . It is a great memory for me and my wife especially the treatment we had and felt like welcomed as in a freinds home . I thank all the staff especially dear Deniz who was wonderfull and carrying person to care and advice in every thing like a freind he help me alot with his advices and good tips for shoping and dealing with others. really a hotel like this is a must to stay in if you are in Istanbul , not to forget to mention the gret location near to all historical sites.

Reviews.Title: “excellent expirience!”
Reviews.Author: blablabla30
Reviews.Content: an excellent location for everything, walking distance to all main attraction, nice restaurants nearby, nice rooms, nice bathrooms, extremly clean rooms...and the best part are the boys at the reception!!! They are allways smiling, they give you good advices, they are allways ready to help you with everything. If I were an owner of this hotel I would give them 2 pays a month, because they are making this hotel a 5 star hotel with conciearge!!! Specially Onur! I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jane G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Sapphire for 6 nights and it was one of the most memorable hotels stays of my 5 week trip. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Onur who was on the front desk was always happy to help us with our queries of where to eat, where to locate public transport and help us with any of our questions! This is our second stay here in two years and it definatly won't be our last. It was sad to be leaving. Thank you to all the lovely, warm and hospitable staff, especially Onur at reception.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: emerald1919
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, great helpful, friendly staff. Clean rooms, compact, but well decorated. huge buffet breakfast, lovely atmosphere. would definately reccomend staying there in istanbul. Was recommended it myself by someone else and an glad i stayed there. really rally really good value for money considering location

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Sarahb_DubaiNZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, hotel is in great location for exploring the Old City and right on the tram line for exploring further. Rooms were clean and comfortable enough but was significantly less value for money considering we paid the same per night in Cappadoccia, however those are just standard big city prices I think. Service was good, reception staff really friendly and when we asked if we could stay another night it wasn't a problem. Was really easy booking online also and arranging airport pickup, with consistently really prompt email replies to all our queries. Staff also gave us a small turkish delight and turkish apple tea gift on our departure which was a nice touch. Do agree with a couple of other comments about the hotel parrot needing some TLC / entertainment though as it has very little feathers left due to boredom.

Reviews.Title: “Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pirata21
Reviews.Content: We just finished a one day stay at the Hotel Sapphire after a cruise. Should have stayed longer. The staff could not have been nicer. They kept our baggage after we arrived early and helped us get a very nice and affordable ride to the airport. The location is perfect for a visit in Istanbul. We ate at highly rated Paszerade restaurant which is almost across the street. Just a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent end to a trip to Turkey.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisWG75
Reviews.Content: Istanbul was the last stop on a tour I was taking of Turkey. I booked the hotel directly through their website and had a confirmation email within 18 hours of my booking. The hotel itself is centrally located in the tourist section of the Old City area of Istanbul (on a pedestrian only street). There are lots of shops and restaurants within a 5 min walk, the tram is a <5 min walk away, and several of the historic sites are within a 5-15 min walk from the hotel. The lobby was clean and spacious as well as the rooms. There was a fridge/mini bar, large bathroom, cable tv (with about 8 English speaking channels), and central heating. I checked in very early (8am) so I didn't expect them to have a room ready but they were able to hold my bags. Everyone at check in was helpful and friendly. They offered a free shuttle back to the airport but when I went to ask about it upon checkout, they didn't have a record of it. I attribute that to a mix up perhaps of what room I was in (at 8am they told me I was in 105, but when I came back later they changed that to 102). This wasn't a big deal as I preferred to take the tram back to the airport anyway which was easy enough to do. Upon checkout they sent me home w/ a little gift which I was so surprised and happy with. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheDukeCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in old town Istanbul. Walking distance to most of the sights, a block from the tram. Hotel policy was free pickup from the airport with 3 nights stay. Only stayed 2 nights but they picked me up anyway. Nice room, great breakfast and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “thank you for everything”
Reviews.Author: Ilham M
Reviews.Content: your hotel is very comfortable for every guest. meeting at airport and all kind of service was very beautiful. i will advise all my friends to stay in your hotel when they come to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value”
Reviews.Author: gflowereliane
Reviews.Content: This hotel costs 1/3 of what my tour company paid for a larger place farther from the tourist areas...and had everything I wanted and more! MUCH better customer service, an equally comfortable room, wi-fi that actually worked, and a way better location. And I think my air conditioning was the first I'd found in six Turkey hotels (all much more expensive than this one) that actually worked! When I walked into the hotel I never even made it to the desk. A staff member came out, invited me to sit down on a couch, had apple tea and a piece of lokoum delivered to the coffee table in front of me, and then brought out a little stool to sit on and lots of information about the area (not realizing I had already been here a few days, just stayed elsewhere). He answered questions, advised me on a tasty restaurant across the street, and was generally attentive, friendly, and informative. The staff seems overall very young--college-age, maybe--but this did not mean they didn't know what they were doing. The breakfast buffet was comparable in size to the one I'd had at the much more expensive hotel, with more variety. I did discover, staying two nights and eating two breakfasts, that freshness was not up to my standards; some rolls were hardened, some salad items looked their age, and the cheese was obviously making its second appearance at the buffet--you can always tell with cheese, it gets translucent and hard around the edges. The yogurt also looked SO lumpy that I decided against trying it. But what was fresh, was good. Other travelers have remarked how much they enjoyed the parrot in the first-floor sitting area. He is a delightful fellow, but obviously unhappy as he is pulling out all his feathers. Anyone who knows birds at all can't help but feel sad upon seeing him. This guy needs a home with attentive family members, or a staff member who can give him the attention he needs over the course of years; obviously the intermittent attention of travelers as they get on and off the elevator is not enough for his needs. One more thing: it is just plain chintzy to provide unlabeled bottles of shampoo that have been used and refilled multiple times (there was crusted shampoo on the outsides of them). Either provide fresh, new toiletries or don't provide them at all. There is a discount market around the corner from the hotel where someone who REALLY needs toiletries can buy them for next to nothing. I know it sounds like I had a lot of problems with this hotel. Really, I pick on it because it is otherwise so great, and a few little improvements would make it the best value in town. The location is fabulous, the staff terrific, and the price can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: wexable4u
Reviews.Content: We were greeted at Ataturk by a friendly shuttle driver at midnight who took us to the Sapphire. We booked three days here, and I am so glad we did. The room was small but okay for a short stay. I asked for a quiet room at the back of the hotel-I am a VERY light sleeper-and was given room 505. A wonderful room. No view to speak of, but quiet as requested. We couldn't even hear the minarets in the morning. The service was exemplary. Everyone was friendly and helpful, and most of the staff has a good knowledge of English. Breakfast was very good, with enough variety for everyone. I especially enjoyed the yogurt. It is plain, but mix it with the fresh honey or other flavors offered, and it is a real treat. We walked everywhere. It is close to all the major sights in Sultanahmet. We only used public transportation once, on a rainy day when walking was a poor option. I would rate the Sapphire 5 stars, except for the smallness of the room, and the cramped eating quarters in the breakfast area. So give it a 4.5, and give the staff a 5.5! Michael W. Florida

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jasonmshamp
Reviews.Content: I spent 9 days in a single room at Hotel Safir and am unbelievably happy with my experience. The staff is sweet and accommodating. Location is close to major monuments, as well as public transportation. My room was much bigger than I anticipated. The interior is simple and clean. The backside of the hotel allows you to experience the call to pray from a great vantage point. I will most definitely stay at Hotel Safir on my return visits to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “very hospitable”
Reviews.Author: Ling L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and were amazed by the staffs hospitality and warm welcome. The buffet breakfast was wonderful in comparison to most hotels in Turkey and the rooms were very spacious (even had a bath). The hotel was reasonably priced and in comparison to another hotel we stayed at in Istanbul (similar price) it was a hundred times better. I would defiantly recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: 50pluscouple
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights at the end of Sept, ending 17 days in Turkey. We could not have been more pleased with the Safir and their attentive staff, as so many others have said. We found the staff so friendly and helpful. We loved the ambiance of the pedestrian only street in front of the hotel, lovely to come back to at the end of a crazy Istanbul day. We stayed in Room 603, the window opened to a fantastic view of the Bosphorus Strait, with Asia just across the waters. When we arrived in our room the first day and opened that window, we knew this was just the way to end a magical holiday and the Sapphire did not disappoint. Good sized, very clean room, housekeeping done early in the day, we appreciated everything about the hotel. There is a great variety at breakfast, you are located close to all the old city sites and Galata bridge to walk over for great shopping and people watching in Taksim. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: GVfan
Reviews.Content: After staying one night in another Istanbul hotel earlier in our trip we booked the Sapphire for our last four nights. Not only was the Sapphire a much better price and location than the more famous hotel, but it was more comfortable in every way. The very nice and helpful staff greets you with a cool glass of cherry juice and a Turkish delight. The elevator (the former Istanbul hotel we experienced was a 4 floor walk up) wisked us to our very clean, spacious, quiet and comfortable room with its abundant hot water, excellent shower and its own air conditioning with thermostat. WiFi works dependably and if you chose to watch TV there are many stations to chose from. The included breakfast was an array of food that would satisfy any taste - sweet or savory, carnivore or vegetarian. The dining area invited guests to mingle (although private tables were always available); we were pleased to have breakfast and conversation with a couple from Germany. The staff at the front desk, the maids and the dining staff were all very cordial. The location was excellent with an easy walk for a wide array of local dining opportunities or to go further afield using the nearby trolley stop with its convenient token vending machine. Also easy walks were the Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and the most spectacular Mosque of Sulliman the Magnificant.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive hotel with brilliant service”
Reviews.Author: vanmunchen
Reviews.Content: I concur with so many of the positive reviews here which praise the Sapphire hotel. It is a comfortable, pleasing hotel with exceptionably efficient, friendly and attentive staff. The attractive spacious lobby has a large luxurious lounge to one side where the talkative hotel parrot keeps guests entered. Another room off the lobby leads into a quiet, relaxing bar. On arrival I found myself in a twin bedded room but as I had expected a double bed I asked if I could change rooms and this was done quickly and efficiently. The air conditioned room included a well stocked mini-bar and room safe and tea/coffee-making facilities. Windows looked out onto a courtyard and could be opened. The flat screen TV with cable receiver box provided the largest number of channels I have ever come across â€“ many hundreds - although few were in English. The bathroom contained a bath tub with shower, although for some reason it was necessary to request a bath plug from reception (to encourage people to save water by encouraging showering perhaps?). I did request a plug but it never arrived, so if I return to Istanbul I must remember to bring one with me! Breakfast is served in the basement area where an extremely wide range of buffet items was available. I confess that many of these foods were unfamiliar to me but there were also more standard items such as scrambled egg and ham to suit my basic English taste! My only irritation was that only flavoured teas (no English Breakfast tea) were available - it seems that it is more common in Turkey to drink flavoured tea. A floor down from the basement led to a swimming pool and sauna. The hotel location is an area where there are dozens of hotels and restaurants (you have to run a gauntlet of restaurant staff trying to drag you into each restaurant you pass) and all the main tourist â€œmust seeâ€� sights in Sultanahmet such as Ayasofia and the Blue Mosque are just minutes away. The hotel picked us up at the airport free of charge and for a reasonable cost took us back. Their gift of a Turkish tea set and Turkish delights to each of us on departure was a very pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ggrobbo
Reviews.Content: We had a seven night stay at the Hotel Sapphire last week and we were absolutely delighted. We had originally wanted to stay here for eight nights, however the Sapphire was fully booked on the first night of our stay in Istanbul so we had to stay in the Hotel Azur further along the road, however I was so glad that standard of the Sapphire was 100 times better than the Azur, despite there being very little difference in price. We were welcomed at the Sapphire with a welcome drink and then were taken through the hotel facilities by the kind and friendly staff. We were a party of three (one Scot and two Germans) however this was no problem as the staff were able to communicate fluently in both English and German. The room we had was smaller than a general hotel room, however this had been expected as the hotel is located in the old town, however the room was clean, the bed was very comfortable and we had a great view over the Bosporus and Topkapi palace. Breakfast offered a great selection, with plenty of seating. Our towels were changed every day and couldn't fault the standard of the cleaning staff, who were constantly busy in the hotel. We stayed at the Sapphire on the recommendation of a family member and I am so glad that we did stay here. The hotel is located very centrally with a two minute walk to the tram stop and 10 minute walk to Sultanahmet Square, Haghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. The Grand Bazaar and Spice Bazaar were easily walkable in 15 minutes. A gem of a hotel with great staff in a great location. Book here and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “You couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaHawk
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the sister hotel to the Sapphire from Canada only to find that we had booked with a scam on-line booking company and we had no reservation and the hotel was full. However, the manager, for both hotels, came immediately, and promised to help us out. Our room at the Sapphire was great with a balcony overlooking a pedestrian road. It was spotlessly clean with a good bathroom.There was some noise from the restaurants below at night, but it did not disturb us. The hotel staff were very helpful with any requests and our experience there was a wonderful introduction to Turkish hospitality. The Sapphire is very well located and we walked to most places and took the tram to others. I can highly recommend this hotel. You will not be disappointed. Thanks to the staff and Manager for giving us such a great introduction to Turkey. Warning : Check out your on-line booking company. There is a list of fake online bookings sites at www.scamwarners.com

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful reception from staff on arrival and departure”
Reviews.Author: geaney
Reviews.Content: The staff in this hotel are fabulous. I booked this hotel directly and they could not have been more efficient with my booking. They organised a taxi to collect us from the airport and return us to airport which made our short stay in Istanbul run very smoothly. On arrival to the hotel we were made feel most welcome which was very nice. The hotel is in a great location. It was excellent value. Comfortable clean bedroom with a variety of teas and coffee available in room and a free safe. What a nice surprise to get really nice gifts on departure after staying for only one night! Thank you to all. AVOID the restaurant directly opposite this hotel. We were charged a lot of money for our worst meal in Turkey!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: jazzybestie
Reviews.Content: Straight after booking this hotel I received an email from the hotel confirming the booking and arranging the airport transfer. On arrival at the hotel the staff were courteous and helpful, slight issue with the room - we booked a double and got a twin - the staff were helpful however and we were moved to a double room the following day. Decent variety at breakfast with lots of Turkish items. Hotel location is right in the centre of the old city, short walk from Aya Sofia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and the Archeology Museum. It's also conviently placed near to a tram stop. Generally good value for money, rooms and pool are a little on the small side, but the rest of hotel makes up for this. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kitkat28876
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing experience at Hotel Sapphire. It's in a great location, the front desk staff are very friendly and helpful, there is a parrot in the lobby named John-o, and the breakfast spread is GIANT (and I don't know what one of the other reviewers meant by saying it was "Turkish." There are tons of types of food including rolls/bread, muesli, and scrambled eggs). We could even see the Golden Horn from our window. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Nomad422
Reviews.Content: Immediately after making the booking, received an email from the staff arranging airport pickup. The reception desk staff were courteous and helpful. Breakfast was Turkish, but quite a spread with lots of vegetarian options. The hotel is very close to two tram stops and a 5 minute walk from Aya Sophia. Room was on the small side, but generally clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: nakuni
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel thanks to tripadvisor and it was exactly what we thought it would be. All positive comments are well deserved and there's not much that I could add. It's located right in the in tourist area, within a walking distance to the main sites of interest, easy to reach by the tram. The service is consistent and helpful. I won't comment on the design and the decor, we knew about it from the photos, i guess it can be classified as a modern reading of the classic ottoman style. Actually passing through the lobby made us smile every time. The rooms albeit small have all amenities and the bed is nice and comfortable, the bathroom functional with a strong shower. The breakfast is amazing, with a great choice of colors and flavors. We enjoyed it so much, after indulging in breakfast we were able to skip lunch the two days of our stay. Next time in Istanbul I won't hesitate to go back to Sefir.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal location”
Reviews.Author: rhyshedges
Reviews.Content: If met by hotel car or travel by taxi - no problem. If walking from the railway station (3 mins) be aware the building numbering is irregular and the sign says "Safir". This is the only negative comment I have to make. Staff are helpful, rooms good and the location on a pedestrianised street of restaurants is within 5 mins walk of the Blue Mosque. The spread for the breakfast buffet is the largest I have ever seen and unlike some hotels if you come down at the last minute you still get the full spread.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: tarocks1
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful four night stay at Hotel Sapphire in early September. The staff is wonderful and goes out of there way to help you in any way possible. They organized our airport transfers and booked a Bosphorus cruise for us. The location is perfect for seeing the sights in the old city and also convenient if you plan on heading to the new European side in a cab or on the train. Excellent value for the price. Would certainly recommend to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “ottoman style, cosy hotel, in a good location”
Reviews.Author: acece
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, and gives you impression about the greatest empire Ottoman. Rooms are clean but little bit small. Breakfast is good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Lived upto its reputation”
Reviews.Author: AnuP2D
Reviews.Content: Great location....close to most places in the old city. Staff was pretty helpful. The breakfast buffet was mind-blowing! Tons of choices to pick from, even for vegetarians. The room was small, but adequate. A small nit was that basic stuff like first aid kits were missing from the room. And I quite wish they would free the caged bird in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: flowergal80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last november and this review is long overdue... the location is great (just don't get lured into buying a carpet if you never planned on it from many of the carpet stores surrounding the area), the value was also great , and the service was great as well. The free breakfast was so delicious!! It's not the four seasons and it doesn't claim to be... but if you want clean accommodations, good location and value... this place does the job. We stayed 5 nights in istanbul and it was still not enough time to explore this great city!! we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “A gem at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: kingatchgook
Reviews.Content: We had an opportunity to stay at 4 different Istanbul hotels on our recent trip to Turkey. Of the 4, our favorite was the Hotel Sapphire. The room was nice, clean, and comfortable; the breakfast was scrumptious, and the staff bent over backwards to please you. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, frendly atmosphere, good place!”
Reviews.Author: Martin V
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really worthy it! Apart of great position in the old part of town with easy access to its historical treasures, this hotel offers you good quality service.The stuff makes you feel relaxed - welcome. Rooms are clean, and offer alot of space. Breakfast rich and tastefull. Free transport from and to the airport. It was good choice to stay in Sapphire hotel, it really was good! You pay less for what you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: J0sher
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for visiting the main sights on foot and the area is very pleasant with cobbled streets and lots of nice restaurants nearby. The room was a tad small but pleasant and perfectly OK for a couple for a few nights. The staff were exceptional. Nothing is too much trouble for them to make your stay perfect, although they are unobtrusive and not at all in your face. I would defy famous 5-star hotels I have experienced, including the Oriental in Bangkok, to do a better job in making guests feel welcome and important to them. The front desk offer sensible advice about tours without any heavy selling and book for you within seconds. The breakfast buffet offered a good variety of different types of food. The hotel is reasonably priced and excellent value for money. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel :-)))”
Reviews.Author: Mpampis
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Sapphire from 12-15 august 2011 and it was a great pleasure for me :-)))...i have been in 21 cities from 14 countries but first time i found so good hospitality! All the stuff it was very friendly and they did the best for my pleasure, the hotel is exactly in the center, very near to Ayasofia and blue Mosque and in the other major attractions, is very clean and with very beautiful rooms and a very rich breakfast.Is by far the best hotel i ever stayed and i propose this hotel with closed eyes :-)))

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mulanja
Reviews.Content: I have spent one night in Sapphire during my business trip to Istanbul. Although its a small hotel it has everything a traveler will need to have a pleasent stay without any worries. The location is very central, close to many historical attractions and to the public transport, surrounded by a variety of restaurants, shops and cafes. The staff was very friendly and helpful concerning the best walking roots and the transport. I enjoyed my short but pleasant stay, the price to service realtion was met perfectly. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “A truly fantastic hotel experience!!”
Reviews.Author: ksa104
Reviews.Content: I would absolutely stay at the Hotel Sapphire again in the future, and I have no hesitation to recommend it to others! I had a truly fantastic experience! The Hotel Sapphire offers clean and comfortable guestrooms, a generous breakfast buffet, a convenient location in Sultanahmet, and highly professional and helpful staff. There are numerous restaurants available right outside the hotel, and there is even a small market next door to buy water/snacks (it also sells wine and liquor!). When we checked out, the reception gifted us with a box of Turkish delights and a Turkish tea set, which was a very pleasant surprise! I am so pleased with my experience at this hotel; I look forward to my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “A litlle gem!”
Reviews.Author: Lasouris
Reviews.Content: We were enroute to start a cruise and looked for an overnight hotel. We saw good reviews on Tripadvisor, and were inspired to book. What we hadn't realised was that this hotel is actually situated in a pedestrian area, but was close enough to the road to not be a problem, and actually added to the charm of the place. This hotel is lovely! The reception staff were so friendly when they greeted us, and gave us a real welcome. The room was smallish, but quite adequate, but very clean and nicely presented. Breakfast was delightful, with a great choice from the buffet. Something for everyone. With the hotel being so centrally situated, we were able to go out and explore the central area on foot, visiting the Topkapi palace and Blue mosque, which were no distance away. All in all, a little gem in a big, bustling city.

Reviews.Title: “The best you can find at that price!”
Reviews.Author: eliver72
Reviews.Content: No doubt at all! At that price there's no chance to find a better hotel to stay in Istanbul. The service is really outstanding, my congratulations to the guys who work there. The room is clean, the breakfast very good; the hotel right in the heart of the old city, Sultanhamet, a stone's throw away from the most important monuments of the city. The first day, we arrived in the morning at 10.30 am and they offered us the breakfast; later we saw they offered a drink to other tourist. When we left the hotel they also offered us a present (very appreciated). By the way, free of charge you have swimming pool, turkish bath, jacuzzi. We didn't try it, but just to let you know. Enjoy your vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: Wasseem47
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with how fast staff get back to you; I have travelled to different countries and have stayed at many 5-star hotels, but has not experienced such a fast or rather "winky" response. The staff are very friendly and the rooms are very clean. The location of the hotel is very convenient to many attractions. At the next tram station - SultanAhmet - you have four main attractions: The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and the Bascilica. Plenty of restaurants are right outside the hotel door. The Bosphorous and the Spice Bazaar are within 5 minutes of walking distance. Rooms are a little small but this seems to be typical of hotels at this old part of Istanbul. Of course we were not traveling to stay at the hotel! We had an overall fantastic experience at Sapphire and Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: snowboardingbec222
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location on a pedestrian walkway so no cars. The hotel is close to restaurants, bars and a short walk to major sights. Very friendly staff who speak English if needed. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Lennie_Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: What a truly wonderful hotel this is in this beautiful and wonderful city. Upon arrival you are greeted with drinks and turkisch delight and a very friendly and thorough information talk by one of the people of the reception. They even tell you when different places are closed. The hotel is situated in the middle of everything: you can walk to the Topkapi, Aya Sofia, Blue Mosk, Sulemani Mosk, Galatbridge, New Mosk, Spice and grand Bazar. The tram stops 2 min. walk from the hotel. The rooms are very comfartable, as is the breakfast. Reception area is pleasant: if you sit at the computer they offer you tea, the parrot will great you every time you pass by. After a busy day of walking and side seeing, they will great you and are interested to hear about your day and offer you suggestions for (dinner) the evening. Any question or problem they will effortless try to solve for you. This is more than a hotel, you are really treated as a VIP. Treat yourself to this wonderful hotel since it is very reasonably priced!

Reviews.Title: “Great Istanbul choice!”
Reviews.Author: MOF3
Reviews.Content: This is my third time in Istanbul annd first time staying at the Sapphire. The locacation of this Hotel, between all the Byzantine and Ottoman sites and the Galata bridge cant be beat. The room was nice and clean; super friendly and helpful staff; good breakfast buffet; and affordable prices. The only potential downside is no rooftop terrace for breakfast. But, with two 12 year olds, having a pool more than made up for this. If I come back, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, excellent hotel, excellent price.”
Reviews.Author: Rigober2
Reviews.Content: An excellent location, correct facilities, the staff is always available to solve any problem and fullfill your needs. Breakfast is very good in quality and quantity. Because of the hotel itself, the staff and the location we hightly recommend this hotel. We have travelled around the world and we have found some five stars hotels worse than this. If you go to Istambul, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Best quality/price ratio!”
Reviews.Author: albi_1975
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, they helped us a lot, not only in the organization of events and information, but also in the first aid assistance for a small incident we had outside the hotel. Rooms are spacious and very clean, and all the furniture are in traditional style. In less than 5 minutes by walk you are in Sultanahmet Square or to Galata Bridge, so the location is ideal. The ratio quality/price is insuperable, we would definitively recommend this Hotel to everyone is going to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Bilal_SAID
Reviews.Content: Despite the fact that Istanbul is a great city to visit, our stay, my wife and me, in this hotel for five days was great for many reasons, especially: The warm reception, The honest and continuously smiling and available staff, The possibility of spending 2 hours of swimming/sauna at any time from 10a.M. to 10p.M. The nice daily breakfast, The low price according to all these services, And above all, the surprising symbolic gift at the end..

Reviews.Title: “Truly a gem in the heart of old Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: tdandrea333
Reviews.Content: Truly a gem in the heart of old Istanbul. Location (on quiet pedestrianised street) could not be better for seeing the main historic sites (with tram for visiting the rest of the city only two blocks away). Rooms compact but well appointed and maintained, entirely fit for purpose with good wi-fi and several English language tv channels. Breakfast ample with great array of fresh fruit and veg. Excellent basement swimming pool and sauna. Best of all is the unbelievable, no request unwelcome, service from the entire staff. Prepare to be treated like a family member: the genuinely warm and friendly availability of the reception staff defies description (I was aided during my 9 day stay in numberless ways) -- and puts most European hotels, including at the high end, to shame. What a pleasure to experience such a well-run and value for money show: all credit to the unfailingly helpful hotel manager Engin Evsen, who lavished time and attention on me during my stay, for this princely operation. Bravo! -- I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Lucii
