Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in the most perfect position. The staff are all absolutely charming particularly the reception staff. Their advice was really helpful. The room was very comfortable and had everything we needed. If ever we return to Istanbul we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Happytravel91
Reviews.Content: I'd very much like to commend all the nice things that this hotel has provided me during my stay, but after reading others' reviews I found that it's really hard not to repeat what others have said. So in the spirit of repeating others: breakfast, cleanliness, location, staff..........GREAT, GREAT, GREAT, GREAT!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: frepie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice: it is situated in the centre near most of the historical sites. The personnel is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is very good - just what you need to start the day of sightseeing. The rooms are nice and clean. There is also a pool in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Jay-in-UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights mid July and were more than please with what we found. We arrived after 11pm tired and weary but front desk was still fully operational and very quickly found our reservation and had us up in our room in next to no time. Room was clean , good air conditioning and very adequate bathroom. With value hotels there is always the risk that corner will be cut but this was not the case with the Sapphire. The staff were always helpful, cheerful and attentive, the room was fine and the breakfasts were entirely adequate for the room price. The location is good if you want to stay in Sultanhamet. It' s on a quiet side street within easy walking distance of all the main attractions and the tram stop is just down at the end of the street. All in all, a good value hotel that ticks most of the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back for sure”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra19_7
Reviews.Content: everything was perfect, from the hotel staff to the comfort of the rooms. everyone was very firnedly and helfull. the location is perfect as it is situated close to the center, the bazaar and all the other attractions. the breakfast buffet was nice also, with a lot of options. for sure we will choose this hotel again for our next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a super location”
Reviews.Author: Angie-Bruce
Reviews.Content: What really made this hotel for us was the friendly and helpful attitude of the staff. It's in a really central location for walking to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi palace, grand bazaar, trams etc. There are lots of shops and restaurants nearby. The one we liked best was Ozlers on the next corner along which also has a roof terrace with comfy cushions to sit on. When we arrived, at check in, the receptionist sat down with us and gave us a drink and some Turkish delight while explaining what we could visit in the surrounding area. Istanbul was a lot more hilly than I expected and the pavements are quite uneven so I would recommend a good pair of walking sandals to get about in comfort. The room we had was on the small side but perfectly adequate. The breakfast buffet had a huge selection however a lot of it I found quite unusual such as cold cooked vegetables. There was also a selection of meats and cheeses as well as cereal, bread and cake. When we checked out we were given a gift of apple tea with glasses and Turkish delight which was a really nice gesture. We had a really enjoyable time and if we ever go back to Istanbul we would not hesitate to return to the Sapphire.

Reviews.Title: “A right choice”
Reviews.Author: AyyadAyyad
Reviews.Content: Good location. About 10 minutes walk to Hagia Sofia. 10 minutes walk to Yani mosque and spice bazar. Nice coffee shops and restaurants across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Adventuregirl986
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were wonderful when we arrived and helped us immediatley with what to do in Istanbul. The drainage in our room gave off a funny smell and we thought that the breakfast was full of leftover food (i.e. not fresh). however, overally the hotel was pretty nice. Our room was nice and quiet, although the sheets kept falling of the bed because they were not fitted.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice room and great service”
Reviews.Author: Reddzone
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the heart of Sultanahmet and was very close to Topkapi Palace, Aya Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Basilica Cistern. The room was rather small but very clean and nicely appointed. The hotel staff are wonderful--they really go out of their way to help. There is a computer in the lobby, free wifi even in rooms, and complementary breakfast each morning. They even picked me up from the airport and drove me to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to indulge yourself!”
Reviews.Author: cami_alex
Reviews.Content: First, I would like to thank all the staff from the hotel (Thank you, Ali, Deniz and all the others!). Sapphire was such a great experience: perfectly located, on a quiet cosy little street (but with all the restaurants and cafes nearby, 5 minutes walk from Aya Sofia and 8-10 minutes walk to Blue Mosque and Basilica Cisterna) it was the perfect spot to live in Istanbul. The rooms are not very large, but there is plenty of space to move around (keep in mind that the hotel is in the old part of Istanbul); the beautiful decorations and the soft jazzy music (also the parrot) take you back in time. Breakfast is an incredible experience (one can find there everything -from honeycomb to cheese and grilled vegetables) and allthe staff is ready to serve you (always smiling, always with a kind word to say) also, they provide free transport from the airport!!! So...enjoy, enjoy, enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, I highly recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: HelenW59
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location in a quiet pedestrian-only street less than 1km from the Aya Sofya and Blue Mosque, and less than 2km from the Grand and Spice Bazaars. There are a large number of cafes and restaurants in the area and a laundrymat about 50m away (7 TL per kg). Our room was large enough for us and our luggage with room to move around in. The bathroom was a good size with wonderful water pressure in the shower. The room has a safe and a bar fridge in it. The buffet breakfast had a good range of foods and had cornflakes and a toaster! The staff were really friendly and helpful, and we appreciated the free pick up from Ataturk airport at midnight. There is a swimming pool in the basement but we didn't use it. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Everything About it!”
Reviews.Author: OneHappyTraveler45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Sapphire in June 2011. We were already impressed by the responsiveness of the staff notably Mr. Engin Evsen who was very prompt in all our reservation needs. When we arrived, we were greeted like family by Mr. Ali who offered us a Turkish delight and cherry juice. He gave us a briefing about the hotel as well as the city. The rooms were well decorated and very clean. Service was exceptional. The complimentary breakfast was outstanding. The location is within walking distance to all important sites including Aya Sofya, Blue mosque, Topkapi Palace/Museum, and the Grand Bazaar. We enjoyed the talking parrot they had in the lobby that copied what you said. As you come out of the hotel the street is full of traditional restaurants with mouthwatering menus. The staff of this hotel went out of their way in their hospitality. They provided us with a ride back to the airport, even after we had checked in to another hotel for our last night's stay due to unavailability of room at Sapphire. At the end of our stay we received small gifts from the hotel manager. If we come back to Istanbul we will definitely come to Hotel Sapphire.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tyne48
Reviews.Content: I HIGHLY recommend the Hotel Sapphire (Safir) for your trip to Istanbul. The location could not be better and the hotel itself is beautiful. The staff of Hotel Sapphire are exceptionally friendly and helpful, and they went out of their way to make my stay as comfortable as possible. It is this high standard of customer service that makes this hotel stand out from the crowd. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “We love it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_Addict_3_10
Reviews.Content: Perfect staff (Ali was especially helpful), perfect location, great breakfast, good price.

Reviews.Title: “Sapphire is my new Istanbul hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvaclare
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to Istanbul a few times each year and this was my first time staying at Sapphire. The hotel I usually stay at around the corner was booked up, so I decided to give this hotel a try. I am so glad I did! I was greeted with a welcome drink and Turkish delight. Since I am very familiar with the city, I was not given the newcomer information. The location is perfect for visiting all the famous places in the old part of town and is only two blocks from the tramline. There was a computer in the lobby for guests to use as well as free wi-fi available in my room. Breakfast was nice and there were more choices than I needed. One thing I did miss that my usual hotel in the area offers is a roof top terrace. I was told it was closed due to an angry momma seagull taking up residency on the roof. There was a pool available in the basement as well as a sauna. I was not able to use it due to my schedule. The room was nicely decorated and the bedding used was very soft and luxurious. One thing I would change about the bathrooms is to have a step available for shorter guests to get into the bath/shower. I am 5â€™5â€� and found it difficult stepping up and into the shower. It was raining my last afternoon there but was given loan of an umbrella to use since I had not brought one with me (weatherchannel.com had given me a false home of sunny skies). The staff gave me two presents when checking out which was very nice. Even though I had scheduled an airport shuttle bus from another hotel, one of the staff helped me with my luggage (in the rain) to the other hotel which was a few blocks away. I was very impressed with my stay at Sapphire and have now found a new place to stay while in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, awesome price...”
Reviews.Author: virgil08
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here and had a great time. The rooms were small, yet comfortable, with reasonable air conditioning, The breakfast buffet was nothing to write home about, but it had enough choices for everyone to find something to eat. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They gave us a five minute run down of what to see in the city, as well as helped me with dinner reservations and transportation ideas. The location was almost ideal. The hotel is a two minute walk to the tram line, as well as five minutes from Topkapi, Aya Sofia, and the Blue Mosque. The tram line is very important, as there's not a lot of quality restaurants or bars in the immediate area, but a $1 tram ride away is Beyoglu with a huge selection. All in all, the price and friendliness of the staff make this hotel a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “THIS SAPPHIRE IS TRULY A GEM”
Reviews.Author: JoeyH01
Reviews.Content: The warm welcome from the front desk sets the tone for a great stay at this boutique property. The rooms are comfortable and spotless. The location is excellent. I particularly liked the proximity to the tram, which I used to also link to the metro subway and water taxis. You can go almost anywhere in Istanbul beginning with the tram just a block or so away. Plenty of nice cafes within two or three blocks. The rates are very reasonable. I would gladly book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay!”
Reviews.Author: Guy5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located within walking distance of all the major attractions. Furthermore, it is situated on a street that is closed to automobiles. Very quiet street full of nice restaurants. The personnel is charming, always willing to go the extra mile to satisfy the guests. Clean rooms with very comfortable beds. We will go back to this fascinating city and will certainly stay again at Hotel Sapphire. Great quality, great value.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelmed by the hospitality, location, and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tatribeca
Reviews.Content: My sister and I visited Istanbul for the first time at the beginning of July 2011. I had selected Hotel Sapphire based solely on the rave reviews from tripadvisor. The rate was very affordable, and the reviews were outstanding. I can honestly say that all the reviews are completely true! Greeted at the airport with an efficient, friendly shuttle driver, we were welcomed to Hotel Sapphire by fresh Turkish Delight and juices at check-in. We arrived late on a Thursday evening, and a member of the staff personally escorted us to the ATM and pointed out his favorite baklava store. He then walked us to a restaurant around the corner and spoke to the host and waiter to make sure we would be taken care of. We were amazed and felt so excited about our trip from this auspicious beginning! Staff was helpful in all our requests, and the hotel is perfectly located in the Old City within walking distance to all the historical sights. We got restaurant suggestions, a jogging route, and tips on how to use public transportation and deal with cab drivers. Cannot recommend the hotel and the staff more highly. We loved Istanbul and when (not if) we come back, Hotel Sapphire will always be our home base!

Reviews.Title: “EXCEEDED OUR EXPECTATIONS! We'll definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: rosario308
Reviews.Content: Excellent Service; great location, close to everything, delicious breakfast buffet; free wifi; clean rooms. Met us at airport on our 2 trips there. Although the hotel was not on the taxi drop off; we never had to carry the luggage bec the driver or the hotel staff took care of them.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, IDEAL LOCATION, HIGHLY RECOMENDED!”
Reviews.Author: Traveldoc86
Reviews.Content: I am stÄ±ll stayÄ±ng at thÄ±s hotel and am on the free computer they offer Ä±n the lobby at the moment. From the moment my grÄ±lfrÄ±end and Ä± arrÄ±ved we were smÄ±lÄ±ng. The staff cannot do enough to make you feel comfortable and welcome. They exude a genuÄ±ne warmth and Ä±mmedÄ±ately put us at ease wÄ±th a welcome cocktaÄ±l and turkÄ±sh delÄ±ght Ä±n the lounge whÄ±le they prepared our room. The desk manager DennÄ±s and the bellboy Musa were especÄ±ally helpful. Another very frÄ±endly desk manager named AlÄ± pulled out a map and spent ten mÄ±nutes gÄ±vÄ±ng us a great lÄ±st of places to see and thÄ±ngs to do. The hotel Ä±s located on a quÄ±et pedestrÄ±an street lÄ±ned wÄ±th restaurants. Its rÄ±ght Ä±n the heart of old Ä±stanbul, wÄ±thÄ±n a 5 mÄ±nute walk from the palace and the blue mosque. Our room Ä±s spotlessly clean and very well decorated. I dÄ±dnt expect the luxurÄ±ous decor and was pleasantly surprÄ±sed as we got a 60 eur per nÄ±ght rate on bookÄ±ng.com. We really couldn't ask for a better base from whÄ±ch to explore the cÄ±ty. The staff here are some of the most genuÄ±nely frÄ±endly Ä±'ve met at any hotel Ä±n the world. ThÄ±s place Ä±s fantastÄ±c - the staff, locatÄ±on and prÄ±ce are all perfect. Thanks to everyone at the SapphÄ±re for workÄ±ng so hard to gÄ±ve us an amazÄ±ng experÄ±ence Ä±n thÄ±s fantastÄ±c cÄ±ty!

Reviews.Title: “Book with confidence”
Reviews.Author: revmonty
Reviews.Content: Have to agree with everything everyone else has said about this hotel. If you want to go somewhere knowing that you are going to have a great stay at a great price then you can book the Hotel Sapphire with confidence. Everyone was so helpful. Will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Exccellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LCNF
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Sapphire Hotel in early June. This hotel offers excellent accommodation, and value for money, the customer service is also excellent, nothing is too much trouble. We were made to feel very welcome and staff were there to offer any advice regarding trips and areas to visit. The standard of cleanliness is also very good. The hotel is situated in a lovely street with good restaurants to try. We would definately go back to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “For value for money, great service, and excellent location, you can't beat Hotel Sapphire.”
Reviews.Author: donnalee1195
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel from the reviews on Trip Advisor which highlighted the great service and location. It is important to appreciate that this is a modest, older hotel. The highlights for us were the outstanding service and the location. First, if you stay two nights there is free pick up from Ataturk Airport which is very welcome after traveling. Arriving at the hotel we were offered cherry juice and turkish delight on registering. The desk staff were always friendly and very helpful (pirinting boarding passes, etc.) and at least one at all times had excellent English. There is also a free computer in the lobby for guests use as well as free Wifi in the rooms. As mentioned in other reviews, you are within 10-15 minutes walking of the major sights. In addition, if you have mobility issues, you are within a 2 minute walk of the tram which takes you to the sights. The hotel is surrounded by restaurants, we had tasty food at modest prices in all the restaurants we tried, however I woud highlight Pasazade just across the street from the hotel. The food was outstanding, not your typical kebab house, service was serious and the prices were only slighlty more than most of the other restaurants in the area. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant or try the swimming pool so can't comment on these features. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely choose the Hotel Sapphire on another trip to Istanbul. but the rooms are very clean with a Turkish flavor to the decor. The bathrooms are older but again very clean and adequate. Breakfast is a large typical Turkish buffet in the basement dining room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff. We felt at home. Would certainly go back.”
Reviews.Author: RajuSuneja
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to Turkey and one of the best thing that I did here is staying at this wonderful hotel. 5 min walk to all major sites like Blue Mosque, hajisofya, topkapi palace, Bislika Cistren, Grand bazar & Spice market. My children liked the most .... talking funny parrot Jonny. Free one way airport transfer, Excellent Breakfast. All the staff were very friendly and they do not hesitate helping you with what ever they could. Furthermore, the rooms were very quite and the cleaning service was exellent. I stayed for 3 days and it was the best days. Thanks for the special attention to Deniz, the guy on front desk. See you soon.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel. This was our second visit.”
Reviews.Author: Jean D
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend here in 2010 and visited again in 2011. The hotel is central for sightseeing, eating and drinking and excellent value for money. Our room was clean and bright with an excellent view. The hotel arranged for us to be met at Ataturk Airport (no extra charge), and the staff were friendly & helpful throughout our stay. We will recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, Great Location, Great Large Buffet Breakfast, Perfect for 2-3 days Istanbul Highlights Tour”
Reviews.Author: GuapoBumsies
Reviews.Content: Try to get a Superior room if you can since their bathrooms appear to be slightly more comfortable. Staff and manager are all incredible - a level of customer service and caring I haven't seen in so long! Clean rooms, modern furniture, great a/c everything worked and they made the stay very comfortable if anything didn't. Great location close to key Istanbul tourist sites and 2 tram change if you want to avoid taking a taxi from the a/p to this hotel. Also goes by Hotel Safir locally which may help the locals guide you there once your at the main train station (very close), buses, trams, bosphorus river cruise all steps away. Highly recommend this one!

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: frenchtraveller59
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel based on location and we were not disappointed: it is very near to local monuments and attraction and is on a pedestrian area. Rooms are small indeed, our was barely large enough to go around the beds, however I know that most of the hotels of this area have very small rooms. So if you look for space and extra comfort you want to look for accommodation in other areas, but if you are happy with a reasonably priced, cozy hotel with very helpful staff, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “When in Istanbul, Nowhere Except Sapphire Hotel! Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Milad86
Reviews.Content: We were in Hotel Sapphire ( Hotel Safir ) in Istanbul from 9June -- 13June. Our room was 201..The ONLY bad thing was, that our room was adjacent to the stairs. and when the Cleaners come to clean other rooms in the morning we were hearing their steps ..although it disturbed us a little, but it was not that bad.. The hotel is EXCELLENT! The Service is Amazing, and the Reception and Staff are Wonderful ..... Really great service,Great friendly staff, great welcome! Rooms are a little small, but Cozy, and very lovely. nice Decorated and very Clean rooms with everything you need! BreakFast is another magic from Hotel Sapphire! very nice and complete breakFast. FREE indoor Pool and Sauna in the hotel, entertained us a lot , howEver the Chloride in the water was TOO much...it hurt me and my eyes! hope the manager do something about this! Totally, it is more than Excellent! I'll be definitely choose Hotel Safir again! the Money you pay, is nothing when compared to service and advantages of the hotel. Its Location is also the BEST! 2min. Walk to Gulhane Tramway Station. /// 4min walk to Sirkeci Station //// 11min. Walk to the Galata Bridge // 13min. Walk to AyyaSofia & SultanAhmet & Topkapi. located in a very very nice and beautiful street.

Reviews.Title: “Great "Welcome to Istanbul" Beginning”
Reviews.Author: NCBigMc
Reviews.Content: We arrived three days before meeting our Rick Steve's tour group. "Mary Sunshine" did our legwork and selected Hotel Sapphire for our three couples and she hit the mark! The greeting and informative briefing were really appreciated. The location allowed us to walk to all the Old Town attractions and public transportation was just around the corner which allowed us to venture into the New City easily. The staff and great breakfast buffet made us sad to have to move onto our prearranged tour hotel, then they tossed in a parting gift, which will be part of our Turkey display, to make it even tougher. If we go back to Istanbul, Hotel Sapphire would be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast and location”
Reviews.Author: MarySunshineMaryland
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sapphire is located in the old city. It is a good location because it is on a pedestrian street. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. The breakfast was fantastic - the best we had in our 3 weeks in Turkey. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and location!”
Reviews.Author: LoraGaige
Reviews.Content: At checkin, they brought us orange juice and turkish delights. The front desk is extremely friendly and helpful. They were there to help with any request. The location is prime in the old town and close to the blue mosque. Plenty of restuarants and shops nearby. The room as perfectly setup before we got there and room was cold with ac and just comfortable and clean overall. You can get to the hotel in about an hour by taking the metro to the tram and it's a quick, easy walk to the hotel. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kouli3
Reviews.Content: we've been there for 4 nights first part of our honeymoon...........perfect location , close to the tram way , all historical sites,restaurants and cafes, as you can find very close all u may need from grocery stores to money exchange even repair your broken camera :S Staff is very nice and welcoming ..they will help you to get around the city alone and advise tours. breakfast time is calm , food is diversified and a cute breakfast area and soft music. rooms are tidy and clean with all facilities and hot water tub and towels. they would provide you with anything you need at anytime. near hotel you will easily find good place to dine or have a Nargile or a cafe and take the tram to any place u want. In conclusion, nothing spoiled our stay and we were sad to leave .we felt returning at home every night.by the way this hotel is a great value for money .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: heathermcl
Reviews.Content: The reviews were true. Stayed there mid May and it was better than we had anticipated for the price, the position was excellent and staff were so pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: eslaydon
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sapphire was fantastic - great location, sweet and helpful staff, and comfy room. Would recommend it to anyone looking for an affordable place in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in pedestrianised area”
Reviews.Author: pillhill
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night en route back home. Very welcoming reception staff - got the feeling that they would go out of their way to help guests. Room on 2nd floor - 2 single beds but very comfortable. Bathroom clean and everything worked. Room is smallish so if carrying large amount of luggage it could be awkward - we had 2 large suitcases which were OK. Nice breakfast spread - only there for a quick cuppa as we had to get to the airport. It's easy to walk from tram stop at Gulhane - about 6 minutes or less. We went to airport by tram/metro - door to door about 60 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Stickybunpete
Reviews.Content: Not only did the establishment offer comfortable and clean rooms but the staff and breakfasts were fantastic as well! The perfect position and ease of access to everything, coupled with what I have already mentioned, make this highly recommended to anybody wishing to visit Istanbul - I know that I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great central location in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: LUVKCS
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location at a good price. Located in sultanahmet area, close to all the historic sights like the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, underground cistern, grand bizaar, and hippodrome. Close walk to the tramway, which is a quick and easy way to get to the new city (taksim square area). The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Assisted with airport transfers (free pick up if you stay 2 nights), but you have to pay for drop-off. Best thing at the hotel is their amazing breakfast buffet â€“ a massive assortment of eggs, cheese, yogurt, vegetables, jams, and pastries. Delicious! and they greet you with cherry juice and Turkish delights.

Reviews.Title: “100% Perfect”
Reviews.Author: lale1996
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely brilliant. Really made to feel at home. Breakfast was good - variety of lots of different items. We were upgraded to a Superior Room with no extra charge. Staff were very helpful and spoke impeccable English. Great swimming pool, jacuzzi & sauna. Excellent location - thoroughly recommend. Near to various restaurant all which were good.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Graj77
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect for sight seeing - all the important sites were within 10 mins walk. The staff were very helpful and nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were clean, quiet and comfortable and were kept very tidy by the staff. Pl note that if you are going to spend a lot of time in the bedroom - then they are too small. Huge choice of restaurants within 10 mins; from less than Â£5 per head to upwards of Â£30. The more alcohol you drank the more costly. Non alcoholoc drinks god value - esp frshly squeezed orange. Giri

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in great position”
Reviews.Author: go'connor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Safir for four nights from May 8th to 12th. I had been emailing the hotel for many months prior to planning our trip to various parts of the world and had always got a fast and friendly response. When we arrived we found the reception staff to be so helpful; it was quite early in the morning so our room wasn't ready but they gave us a cup of tea while we waited. When we got to our room I was pleasantly surprised to find it quite spacious (at least by the standard of hotel rooms in the old city) and light and airy. This was a pleasant surprise and I found the hallways quite dark and dingy. (Only need a bit of a facefilt - new, lighter carpet perhaps?) They provide a hotel safe which was the only one we found in our travels that worked really well. There were tea and coffee facilities, bathrobes, and nice adequate towlls. But the clincher was the lovely bedding - very comfortable mattresses and lovely white doonas. When we left, again early in the morning, they gave us sandqiches, plus two lovely gifts to take with us - a set with apple tea and tea glasses, and some turkish delight. Very nice thought. The hotel was in a superb position with many restaurants virtually on the doorstep, and good shopping nearby. We found the hotel staff exceptionally helpful with good english, and the room rate was very reasonable, at 80 euros per night. The only negative I can say about the place is that on our first night there the people in the next room must have been watching a very funny video, because there was a sudden burst of laughter quite late in the night, which continued for about 10 minutes or so. Then all was quiet. Then the only noise we heard from adjoining rooms was minimal. In an expensive hotel that may be unacceptable, but for this rate, how can one complain. Incidentally, I have stayed at 5 star hotels where there is a lot more noise coming through the walls, so apart from that first night, it is not really a complaint. Just a bit of a shock. Nice hotel, with nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, OK place to stay - might want to avoid if you are v.fussy”
Reviews.Author: stephenandkatie
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant 3 night stay at this hotel, although I think a four star rating and some of the other reviews are a bit generous in their assessment. The location of the hotel was very good and just a short (5 min) stroll to the main historic sites. The staff were very friendly and gave some helpful advice on the main sites opening/closing times and recommended a good hammam that allowed couples to go in together (I think just next to Suleymaniye mosque). As with other reviewers, we were subject to a bit of a sell to get us to join some organised trips when we checked in - this will suit some, but we found it a bit tiresome. Breakfast was OK, but focused on quantity more than quality. The room was nice and well appointed, but there were a number of 'gremlins' that I think would have annoyed others more fussy than us - for example there was no hot water one evening (it seemed to have run out), towels weren't always changed and the air conditioning made a strange beeping noise (when off). These problems were mentioned to the service desk and to varying degrees sorted out. The bed was, however, v.comfortable and we slept very well. Overall, I would stay here again as it was OK and a better price than others in the location, but might be tempted to explore other options if they were more competitive on price. A few tips: (i) Worth getting to the palace early as gets very busy from mid-morning and so you get stuck repeatedly queueing to see the more popular bits. (ii) No probs catching taxis, but many seemed to have trouble finding the hotel (possibly in truth, possibly just going for a bigger fare). Best to ensure they are clear they know where they are going before you set off. (iii) Some OK restaurants (Olive and Pasazade) and bars near to the hotel, but v.touristy. Definitely worth making the effort to go over to the Beyoglu district, as this is where the Turkish are and the atmosphere and choices much better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chrischris50
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed there for 4 nights at early may! The location of the hotel is really great as it is in walking distance from all the major attractions of Istanbul! The rooms are a bit small but very comfortable! The breakfast buffet is enormous but you will have problems tasting everything as there are a lot of Turkish dishes which are really heavy for an untrained stomach! Clean towels were provided every day! The only mistake in my opinion was that the bed sheets were never changed through our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JRBayliss
Reviews.Content: Lovely staff & great location, entertaining Parrot. Close to all the local attractions, we walked to most places & used the tram only once. Great base & good local restaurants & bars to relax & unwind. F1 Fan - Walk 5/10 mins to the Blue Mosque to catch the track organised shuttle buses, very cheap 5.25 Lira each way (journey time around 1h 30m).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: al_advisor82
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location, just few meters from Hagya Sofia, Excellent Service, Very good Breakfast. Everyday cleaning. A bit small rooms with a very big bathroom though! Located in a pedestrians street, just next to many great restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Best location, clean, friendly, free wifi!”
Reviews.Author: Jlove0230
Reviews.Content: Perfect for those Spending a few days in Istanbul, because of the proximity to all the major sites. Staff is warm and welcoming, rooms are clean and modern, hotel has free wifi. Location could not be better

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at The Sapphire”
Reviews.Author: Hollypooch
Reviews.Content: What more can I say from my previous review of the Sapphire? The standards of the hotel were just a good. The rooms had been refurbished and our's was excellent - we were told it was the best room - on the top floor with a view of the topkapi Palace and grounds. Amazing considering how built up the city is. The staff were just as warm and welcoming - and great fun!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: LittleMissKrafty
Reviews.Content: After being in Turkey for a 10 day tour we arrived at the Sapphire exhausted and in need of some relaxation, and the Sapphire did not disappoint! The rooms are beautiful and the mattresses are super thick and amazingly comfortable. Location couldn't be better for exploring Istanbul with a tram stop right around the corner and the major sights a short walk away. The breakfast selection was huge and we walked away feeling very full every morning. The staff are brilliant and very helpful, and the room was excellent value for money compared to some hotels we had stayed at previously in Istanbul. We loved it here and would not hesitate to come back again or recommend it anyone who is going to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Di222
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first 2 nights in Istanbul. First night just 2 of us and the second night our adult daughter joined us. The staff organised a room upgrade for her to join us and the charge was only small. They moved our luggage and welcomed our daughter like a long lost friend. Just so nice. The rooms were small, but well laid out. Tea & coffee in the rooms too. Small, but functional bathroom with lots of hot water. Breakfast was a huge buffet with lots to select from. Indoor pool is a bonus! The farewell was personal and a parting gift such a nice touch. Ali and Denis are wonderful on the front desk and more than happy to help out and give you tips on local things to see, do and eat. Not the cheapest hotel, but such a nice place to stay it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent !!!”
Reviews.Author: tarody
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, we have the best time in Istanbul. This hotel is near most atractions. And the price for a room with breakfast was very good. PS: Thank you for the present on day of departure, very nice of you.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, excellent location, breakfast and service”
Reviews.Author: Blakeway
Reviews.Content: Fly into Ataturk airport NOT Sabiha Gokcen to get reasonable transfer to the hotel. Scam - hundreds of shoe polishers on pavements. If one seems to drop a brush then ignore it. A trick to get you to use him then charge crazy rate. I gave him 2 lira (50p) and told him to beat it! Hotel - try to link up with other guests for taxi to airport. I suggested the hotel should post daily, guests looking to share for the following day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: PAGLondon_England
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend stay at The Sapphire. The hotel is within walking distance of all the main sights, the staff are charming and helpful and the breakfast contains a selection to please everyone. Tea and coffee is supplied in the room and the beds were blissfully comfortable. I would have no hesitation in recommending The Sapphire for a weekend break or longer. While there do pay a visit to the resturant on the corner, Pasazade, serving delicious Ottoman cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel,Excellent servises”
Reviews.Author: ntinaki83
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in a convenient location, with so much helpful staff made our sort trip to istanbul unforgettable... We ll be back sometime as for the others.. please don't miss it.. It worths ;))

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a gem.”
Reviews.Author: Molson0401
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay at Hotel Sapphire in Istanbul couldn't have been nicer. The room was large, spotless, free tea/coffee in room, outstanding buffet breakfast with everything imaginable available. The staff was so friendly. When we had to leave early one morning, they provided sandwiches for our trip since we could not have the breakfast. I hearily recommend this hotel at its convenient central location. We walked to Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Underground Cistern and the quaint little side streets with no problem. Mary Lou Olson, Minneapolis, Minnesota

Reviews.Title: “excellent location; friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: constantius888
Reviews.Content: very conveniently located in the Old City, easy walking distance to Sultan Ahmet, Ayia Sofia, Grand Bazaar, and many other sites; we were well looked after by friendly and helpful staff, and enjoyed the use of the swimming pool and bath facilities

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robbieburn
Reviews.Content: Hotel located in an idea area for the sights and transport. Room slightly small but we were advised on this. Staff great and exceedingly helpful, price even better if I were returning to Istanbul this would be my first option. We can only comment on the breakfast which was full and comprehensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, excellent staff, great breakfast, memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorNewDelhi
Reviews.Content: We, an elderly couple from India, though much traveled, took a chance by booking the hotel on the internet. It turned out to be an excellent choice on all counts. We would recommend the hotel with confidence to anyone looking for hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further!”
Reviews.Author: Andre1948
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sapphire has everything leisure travelers need. It offers first-class service, starting with a free transfer from the airport (much appreciated late at night)! The staff is incredibly professional and helpful. Employees were generous with their time, suggesting special outings, even confiding the names of their favorite restaurants.. Rooms are charming and immaculate; the authentic Turkish breakfast buffet is unbelievable. Situated in a quiet corner of the Old City yet close to important sites and local transport, Hotel Sapphire is the perfect place to stay in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “A terrific hotel. Wonderful staff, great location, fine breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: LANewsboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sapphire for three days in mid-March, 2011, and found it to be one of the nicest travel experiences we've had in ages. The staff was very helpful with every question we had about the city, transport, etc. The room was very nice, very clean. The breakfast is one of the best we've ever seen--buffet has to be 30 feet long and it contains everything you'd want--and then some! We will stay there again, and thanks to everyone at the Sapphire for making our March trip to Istanbul so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly place”
Reviews.Author: soulbean
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my trip to Hotel Sapphire. All of the staff were fantastic. Spent much time in their sauna and small but charming swimming pool (facilities that should open at 8am rather than 10am though). The breakfast was buffet, you'll find something you like and it was a bit nippy at night because they relied on the air conditioner to heat the room up but other guests didn't mind. There's internet in the lobby and always a staff member on hand for you. Would definitely go back. Very clean too.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: loobyBucks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic value for money in an excellent position close to all historical sights, metro and ferries with very helpful staff. The buffet breakfast was very good. The bedrooms rooms slightly small but this is reflected in the price the spa was nice although pool a bit on the cold side with lots of towels lying around. Would recommend as this is on the whole an excellent choice for those not wanting to spend a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mhussaini
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity of staying at both Prince Hotel & Hotel Sapphire. In comparision with both the places, Hotel Sapphire beats Prince any time of the day. Prince was way too noisy and had really dark ally's to walk at night. Room was not so clean either and had the wallpaper scraping out, where as Sapphire, just made the last leg of our trip awesome. Just few meters away, Sapphire was at the perfect location for tourist. Streets filled with tourist late at nite or early morning hours (2:00 am), All the places at walking distance, Comfortable rooms and extremely friendly staff... I would choose this place anytime of the day and would love to stay there once again. Thanks Hotel Sapphire & its staff for the lovely hospitality - Mahmood.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Okie_in_Europe
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Sapphire Hotel from March 5th until the 11th of 2011. We really enjoyed it. The staff was incredibly friendly and very helpful. They made us feel right at home during our stay. The location canâ€™t be beat as itâ€™s within easy walking distance to all of the major sites in the historic district. Itâ€™s on a side pedestrian street so you donâ€™t have to worry about the noise from traffic. You get the occasional sound of a local mosque calling folks to worship, but to me, it just added a nice exotic feel of being in Istanbul. The room that we stayed in was very nice and clean as was the hotel in general. The beds, pillows, and blankets were very nice, clean, and comfortable. The room included cable TV with a wide variety of channels in lots of different languages and also free Wifi which was very nice to keep up with e-mails and Facebook. The family and I did use the indoor pool to relax in after wandering around the sites and markets of Istanbul. The breakfast bar was large and varied and included some local specialties like dates and local cheeses. The hotel staff also helped us arrange a trip out to Troy and Gallipoli. There are plenty of restaurants within a 10 minute walk of the hotel fitting all budgets, and they did include fast food options like McDonalds and Dominos if you have picky kids like we do. Weâ€™ve traveled a lot throughout Europe, and the room costs were very reasonable especially considering the service and amenities that the hotel provided. My family and I really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Sapphire, and weâ€™ll stay there again when we make it back to Istanbul. Many thanks to the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: iringa_KJ
Reviews.Content: Saphhire Hotel was good all round value, its location by one of the tram stops - 2-3 mins away meant easy access to all connecting points and to the airport. Travelling on the tram is cheap and easy to deal with. Hotel is not far from Topkapi Palace and the other historic - religious sites like the Blue Mosque or Aya Sofia and places like the Egyptian Bazaar and the main Grand Bazaar are within a reasonable walking distance. Useful bars and restaurants nearby or one can explore further afield. Hotel staff are all friendly and helpful. They look after you and take care of you. During my stay, it was COLD in Istanbul ... their warm swimming pool and sauna really helped.

Reviews.Title: “Minutes from aya sophia, mosque, topkapi, bazar; fine rooms, breakfast, pool”
Reviews.Author: Marjang
Reviews.Content: Start:: a free shuttle from Ataturk airport. Then: a very warm welcome, and a friendly service every day. The rooms are not very large (no problem, we didn't come to Istanbul to stay in the rooms), but they are clean & comfortable. There's a small swimming pool, even a sauna in the cellar; a breakfast that feeds you for a whole day. The hotel lies in a neighbourhood with lots of restaurants for the night. The place where Bosporus tours start is also 5 minutes walk, as is the central station. One has to pay for the shuttle back to Ataturk, but they get you a good deal, so it's cheap anyway. Considering the price: great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with good price.”
Reviews.Author: PIRET_11
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay with a perfect location. You can go to many places by walking. Good breakfast and spa facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, great rooms, great breakfast and awsome spa facilities.”
Reviews.Author: benrhys
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in 4 & 5 star hotels all over the world for city breaks and this hotel was up there with the best, the pictures on the website do not do it justice. It was a great place to relax with a perfect location from where you can see the whole city from. Would recomend it to any one thnking of a luxury break to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: kathleen139
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was situated in a superb location for exploring the old city and with good access for local transport. The free airport pick up arranged by the Hotel was a real bonus, we arrived at 9.05pm at the Airport after a 4 hour flight and it was brilliant to be greeted and transported to our hotel, it removed a lot of stress as this was our first visit to Istanbul. The Hotel had all the facilities we wanted, very clean, good food(breakfast), swimming pool and sauna(needed after long days sightseeing) and a traditional charm that is sometimes lacking in city hotels. As for the staff I can not praise them enough, they supported our stay with helpful information and with a hospitality that ranks with the best and was a major factor in making the break one of the most memorable breaks we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfortable hotel with helpful staff in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tgqld1
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in historic center with good helpful stuff, average size rooms are very clean. It is easy walking distance to all of the mainattractions and the Trams for places further away.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sapphire - Truly a Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: Herc_DriverGrant_FL
Reviews.Content: This hotel came highly recommended on Trip Advisor. We are adding kudos to previous reviews. Overall 4 star rating because the rooms, while perfectly adequate for the 2 of us, may be a bit cramped for travelers with lots of baggage. Also, the call to prayers, some as early as 0700, can detract from your experience due to the excellent location. All important sights are within easy walking distance, except the Grand Bazaar, which is about a mile away. The reception we received was wonderful! EVERYONE behind the front desk is trained to sit down with guests upon checkin to give a 5 minute briefing, complete with maps. All employees were very friendly, even though some maids did not speak English. A call to the front desk about operation of the TV brought a young man to the room in about 3 minutes. Problem solved! LOTS of inexpensive sidewalk fast food places are nearby; as is a convenience store where you can purchase anything from bottled water to juice to fruit & snacks at reasonable prices. The hotel serves a fantastic buffet breakfast, included in the price. On the 30' long table are typical Mediterranean breakfast fare, along with scrambled eggs, meat, juices, bread & rolls of every type, as well as some excellent cheeses. If you go away hungry - you have a big problem!!! They do not serve lunch or dinner, so you are not a captive audience. Rather, right outside, you will find about 10 restaurants in the IMMEDIATE vicinity. We do not vouch for any of them since we ate mostly sidewalk food & fruit during our 5 day stay. We booked our 5 days with a popular website for 60 euro per night. Prior to the Sapphire, we spent 12 days on an Affordable Turkey tour with a budget agency - FANTASTIC! We departed Istanbul for Athens and a 27 day Trans Atlantic cruise back to Fort Lauderdale with some WONDERFUL memories of a very special experience. We are a couple celebrating our 45th Anniversary, aged 71 & 66. The Sapphire is EXCELLENT value for the $$!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Trish095
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you are looking for. The location is great. It is walking distance to all the popular tourist sites and to great restaurants. The hotel is very comfortable and clean and the staff are extremely helpful, polite and friendly. The breakfast is one of the best I have experienced. I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Real Gem (pardon the pun)”
Reviews.Author: W0rld_Is_My_Oyster
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Istanbul with 2 friends in September, having heard about Hotel Sapphire through Tripadvisor. The hotel met and exceeded all expectations - the staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was in top condition, v. clean if slightly small. For the price tag I would highly recommend the hotel, especially given its central location. Anyone staying in the Sultanahmet district of Istanbul who wants easy access to all the historic sites as well as the Bosphorus should stay here. The manager even gave us a parting gift of a Turkish tea set, glasses and all! In all, a brilliant little place

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for good price”
Reviews.Author: Hannale
Reviews.Content: Its very good located in historic center small hotel with good helpful stuff, small rooms are very clean and there is a pool, sauna and hamam wich is very good after all day walking. Its not luxury but its exactly what I needed. I has strongly recomended this hotel and absolutly will stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and really kind service”
Reviews.Author: SMVMadrid
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel according to TripAdvisor rating and I have to say that it was a good decision. The location of the hotel is really good, it's really close to the most famous spots of Istanbul: Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar and even Eminonu harbor (where you can take the ships to Bosforus cruises). It is also in the way of the tram that takes you to Dolmabache Palace... The front desk people are really kind and they even gave us a present when we checked out. Indeed, they made our stay even better because they helped a lot when we asked them about anything and even they were very helpful when I needed to print my boarding cards. Another good thing is that the hotel offers free shuttle from airport to hotel (not the other way around). The room was 75â‚¬/night, which is more than reasonable for the quality of the hotel. So, I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to spend a nice time in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - really special christmas break”
Reviews.Author: thebaroness
Reviews.Content: This looked good on the booking site but we were so impressed when we arrived after a stressful journey. Complimentary fruit cocktail and turkish delight as we checked in. Room was cosy, well furnished and comfy bed and peace and quiet added to the luxury. Very good buffet breakfast, plentiful, fresh , proper table linen and china with well chosen background music for atmosphere that was never invasive. The reception parrot chats when you pass him by, the cosy luxury reception area is ideal to sit in and take coffee, write postcards, read your book. Deniz on the recpetion was so helpful, telling us the best way to get anywhere, approx cost of cabs, tram stops etc. He even phoned a shop where we wanted to buy a tv to warn them of our arrival. All in all this hotel is so good i am already planning the return visit. Just as we felt it could not get better, when we checked out we were given a small christmas /new years present. One of the best alternative christmas breaks i have had. Don't miss this one, its a jewel.

Reviews.Title: “First Visit to Istanbul - Perfect stay at the Sapphire Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ThomasTraveller89
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading other reviews on Tripadviser, so glad I did as it really is a gem set in the old city. The staff, hotel and rooms are great, don't be put off by reviews saying the rooms are small as they are of a good size for two people. I can only concur with all the praise heaped on this hotel by previous reviews and would certainly recommend it to anyone wanting to visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: saxophonegirl78
Reviews.Content: I actually found and chose Sapphire based on the reviews on the site- they're all true! I stayed here with my husband on our honeymoon last week and was so impressed with the level of hospitality, breakfast options, cleanliness, friendliness, and comfort of the room. They truly treated us well, and we had an excellent stay. The free breakfast was beyond my wildest expectations- best olives and yogurt I have ever tasted in my life! There are many many other awesome eating options, too- we stayed for 5 nights and did not get bored with breakfast at all- we looked forward to it every morning. The beds were really comfortable. The location is really fantastic, too. We had an amazing experience and would recommend this hotel highly without any hesitation. They really took good care of us, and even arranged for reliable transport to the airport. Thanks, Hotel Sapphire!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but NOT 4 star”
Reviews.Author: phlashba
Reviews.Content: I would say this hotel is very good for people accustomed to 2 and 3 star properties. Don't get me wrong --- it is perfectly nice -- but it's a budget hotel. Staff is excellent and could not have been more helpful but in-room amenities lacking and overall condition rather tatty. I would still recommend it but I do think it is a little overrated here on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jo_In_Dubai
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I have been to Istanbul, and I selected the hotel based on TripAdvisor's reviews, and boy where they not wrong! For a solo travel, with limit time (trip was only for 5 days), this was an amazing experience, and the hotel staff were super friendly, very informative, and provided insightful informations on where to go and what to do. Clean hotel, perfectly located and reasonably priced. It's located close to the main attractions, with walking distance and easy access to the local tram. The charge included breakfast, which was pretty simple and very authentic. You get the basic, scrambled eggs/sausage/cheese, and some Turkish breakfast as well. Free wireless connection make it a very easy location to still stay in touch with friends. Since the hotel is located in an area with plenty of restaurants & budget hotels, you can be a bit intimidated by the restaurant staff as they will be extra pushy in getting passersby to try their restaurant, but don't that stop you ... they are just being friendly :P In an overall, highly recommended hotel if your main concern is budget, distance, and easy access to everything in Istanbul. I was greeted with a gift, and was bid farewell with a gift as well. Made me feel very special :)

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Value in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mabawa
Reviews.Content: If you plan to stay in Istanbul's "Old City," (Sultan Ahmet, Aya Sofiya, Topkapi, etc.), this is THE HOTEL! I have been travelling to Istanbul for almost 40 years and I still can't believe I only just discovered this place. Location is perfect. And in a country known for its hospitality, the staff is incredibly accommodating. Pool and sauna are geat. Rooms are actually roomy for this area and the breakfast buffet is as good as any anywhere! I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star service from the front desk team”
Reviews.Author: Winnie49294201
Reviews.Content: Like quite a few hotels in this area The Sapphire is a comforatble, professionally run and very well priced hotel in a great location, What set this hotel apart for me was the exceptional front desk service we received not only during our stay but well after we had gone. They assisted us with an insurance claim for a camera we lost near the Blue Mosque well after we had left Turkey. PS They have a a great indoor pool and sauna

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: UWSider
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay was so good:professionalism of staff, immaculate upkeep, good wi-fi, terrific breakfast, comfortable room. Perhaps some modernization would be attractive, but this comment should not deflect on our totally satisfied stay. And the location was perfect--yes, perfect! Airport pickup was smoothe and cordial, all the highlights of historic Istanbul are so close.

Reviews.Title: “I can honestly say we very much enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: jamay135
Reviews.Content: The staffs were very friendly and were able to help us with all of our enquiries such as (transportations, shopping, places to visit etc.). They gave us a very warm welcome and a brief introduction to the area including options for tours and not forgetting Turkish delight upon arrival. The breakfast spread was large with lots good choices, the rooms were clean and comfortable I was bit concern with some of the reviews with regards to the room size however it was the right size for two people. I would stay at this hotel again without hesitation. Not only was the hotel an excellent value for money which includes transportation from the airport and daily breakfast and free Wi-Fi. It is in an excellent location for tourists. The hotel was within walking distance from almost anything we wanted to see (St Sofia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Spice/Grand Bazaar etc.). It was also close to a large selection of places to eat and shopping. I can honestly say we very much enjoyed our stay and I have recommended to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beaten, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: shannon02283
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sapphire is in the best location in Istanbul. We walked everywhere during our stay. We stayed 7 nights in total, and had trips to other areas in Turkey in between. It was no problem for them to store our bags. We were in 3 different rooms and all of them were a good size, although the carpets were a little worn in some areas. Bathrooms were good also. We had an issue with getting FIBA tickets sent to Australia (we left before they arrived) and Mr Evsen was so helpful with providing their address for them to be forwarded on and then looking out for them and contacting us when they arrived- 2 days before the game! Thankyou so much!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PegofSalem
Reviews.Content: I would stay at this hotel again without hesitation. Not only was the hotel an excellent value (transportation from the airport and daily breakfast and free Wi-Fi included) it is in an excellent location for tourists. Personally, I prefer to stay at a hotel that is within walking distance from almost anything I want to see and it was (Aja Sofia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, etc.). It was also close to a large selection of places to eat and shopping. The staff was very friendly and was able to help us with all of our requests (taxis, laundry, etc.). They gave us a very warm welcome, a brief introduction to the area including options for tours (no pressure), juice and Turkish delight upon arrival. The breakfast spread was large with lots good choices, the rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff was very friendly. They also gave us gifts on our departure (make sure you have room to carry them when you leave) which was very thoughtful. I loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Explorer2201
Reviews.Content: Staff was helpful and friendly. Rooms were tiny but clean and well-arranged. In the hall the carpeting was partially torn up, baseboards were missing, and old cupboards were tied shut with string -- We assumed they were about to recarpet. We stayed 8 nights and could walk to everything we wanted to see. When we wanted to go farther afield, we took the nearby tram. The pool and sauna were nice. The huge breakfast was amazing at first, but we tired of the sameness after 3-4 days. Assuming the hallway redecoration is complete, we'd recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget. We paid 69 euro per night. On the negative side, there are restaurants up and down the street -- apparently all for tourists, all all equipped with aggressive touts who will use any tactic to get you inside. It was like running a gauntlet to leave the hotel in the evening until we discovered shortcuts. We had good humor about it, though, and it wasn't much of a negative. On our last night, late in November, we couldn't get the room cool without opening windows and the loud music from the street didn't stop until 2 PM. Other than those minor negatives, we loved the place and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Remarkably friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScepticDane
Reviews.Content: Well, I can't say anything that hasn't been said before. Great location, superfriendly staff, good breakfast buffet. The only tiny thing if any to speak against it was the smallish size of the King size bed, but this can hardly count as a fault in the crammed Sultanahmet area of the city. We were very satisifed

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Autum_G
Reviews.Content: The service at the Sapphire was EXCELLENT! We were made to feel very important and comfortable throughout our whole visit! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Istanbul and be near the city!! The location was perfect for us to walk around and see the sites, take the tram, and come back to refresh at the hotel without alot of hassle! We loved our stay and will be staying here again on future visits to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Great service in quaint hotel...”
Reviews.Author: water4trips
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience in this hotel mostly due to the amazing service. All of the staff went to great lengths to make us feel welcome and comfortable. The location is great for seeing historical sites within easy walking distance. There are many restraunts in the neighborhood. The rooms were small for a family but classy. The hotel was very clean. Our stay was very pleasant and we plan to stay at this hotel next time we are in the city.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: inezjonckheere
Reviews.Content: Great hotel,nothing was too much trouble for their staff,they did really everything to please us !! Pool had warm water,sauna excellent after a daytrip,lots of nice restaurants in area (Pasazade at the left was the best of Istanbul!) and 10' walk of all the great attractions. We had 5d lovely weather,it was a perfect citytrip,and very cheap :25â‚¬ pp /d!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel in a fantastic location with incredible staff”
Reviews.Author: BagLadyAtl
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the hotel over a long weekend. The hotel arranged transportation from the airport to the hotel. A one way transfer was included in our rate of around $90 per night. The value could not have been better as it included a buffet breakfast with many Turkish food delights along with your typical fare. The hotel staff went out of their way to ensure we had a wonderful stay. They arranged a tour for us along with a trip to a local Haman (Turkish Bath). Since the hotel is on a pedestrian only street a staff member always walked with us to ensure we got in the correct taxi. The hotel is within walking distance to all the main sites. The location is just fantastic. We'll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but beware”
Reviews.Author: hamishhow
Reviews.Content: Nice city centre hotel in a good location, but beware if you get a room on the first or second floors above the entrance. Very noisy door and very squeaky hotel sign (when windy) will definitely keep you awake. Food is average.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: andrea20101974
Reviews.Content: Good positioning of the hotel! The rooms are small but functional. For breakfast there where a lot of choices. Very friendly staff, helpful with hints about what and when to visit. They did whatever they could to make our stay the best possible.They proved to be good quality people even after our stay, as I forgot a lot of items in my room and they were kind enough to send them back to me by post. We also enjoyed the swimming pool, small but perfect for a rainy day :).

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel in a GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: SpirosK81
Reviews.Content: Nothing much to say. The hotel was clean, the staff were helpful and spoke very good English, they even had a very affordable ride-to-airport-with-private-driver service. I am very pleased. Plus, the location is GREAT, right next to TopKapi and Aya Sofia in the old city. The ONLY downside is its greatest asset: the location. It is in the old city, where bars and restaurants abound. I was in a fairly high floor, so I did not have a problem at all, BUT maybe travellers in lower floors might have a problem sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent situation for sight seeing and friendly helpful service from front desk.”
Reviews.Author: alex1972_40
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent choice. Selected from Trip Advisor. The hotel was well placed within minutes of the tram and all major attractions. Set in a quiet side road. All the staff were friendly and helpful and could not have been more attentive. Our stay included Bed and Breakfast (which was an extensive buffet with plenty to suit everyones taste). The room was a good size and the ensuite facilities were all that we required. The room service was faultless including tea/coffee making facilities and a fridge. The room safe was also free. We will certainly return to this hotel and have already recommended it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to be”
Reviews.Author: Bocio
Reviews.Content: Not luxurious but well located. Friendly staff. If you're looking for a place to sleep comfortably will be the best option. Good bath. Many restaurants in the area, just 2 blocks from the tram.

Reviews.Title: “Little to add- plenty to reiterate”
Reviews.Author: hnswst
Reviews.Content: We didn't get off to the best of starts as our flight was delayed and there was an enormous queue for visas. So there was some confusion and a bit of waiting to get the transport arranged by the hotel. However, they sorted it out, and from the moment we arrived in the Sapphire we had nothing but excellent service. The room was small (but there were 3 of us in it) and is not unusual for the neighbourhood. The location is brilliant, and there's plenty of places to eat locally - we liked Pasazade (same street, left as you leave the hotel), Imbat in the Orient Express Hotel (one block north, street where the tram runs) and Hamdi in EminÃ¶nÃ¼. Angus (aged 6) says the best things about the hotel were the parrot and the swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Nothing to add to other reviews Plus.....value, breakfast, position, friendly and helpful Minus....annoyingly small sheets that untuck overnight (a bit trivial, I know!) Do try the restaurant ahead/left out of lobby "Pasazade". A gem amongst the other "restaurants"

Reviews.Title: “Comfy place to stay in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: bleu1128
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel in the middle of the night to escape from the noisy Cheers Hostel. The friendly night staff took us in and made us feel at home. The room was roomy. The bathroom was huge compared to what we have been used to in Turkey. The location is fantastic as it is walking distance to all the sights in Old Istanbul. The buffet breakfast in the morning was great and had a good variety. Considering what we had paid for the hostel, this hotel seemed underpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at great location. You are...”
Reviews.Author: ErnestoH
Reviews.Content: Great service at great location. You are walking distance of main landmarks. Staff is super helpful. Rooms are smaller than you would like because it's an old building but I think its well priced and you get justfiable value

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: claudia186338
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last night of our trip, when we returned to Istanbul before flying back home. This hotel is amazing quality, the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful and attentive and the breakfast buffet was just so abundant and wonderful - so many delights! It is located in Sultanahmet and close to all the the major sites. Rooms are very new and clean - they even gave us a choice between two, on two different floors when we arrived. We stayed in similar hotels in Istanbul in the same area that were a lot more pricey! Definitely good value. If I had to be really pedantic and find something to complain about it would be the fact that the amazing lovely pool has a bit too much chlorine - it made all my silver go black! (including rings I had never taken off in 10 years obviously having swum in many pools in the meantime - it had never happened! - Take all jewellery off before you go in! This is a wonderful hotel - perfect choice if you want to be based in Sultanahmet close to all the attractions!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great! Super breakfast, very nice and helpful staff, and best location!”
Reviews.Author: scheisser
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Istanbul was wonderful. The staff answered all the questions my husband had (and he had many!!). They helped us with restaurant reservations and gave good advice when we needed it. The location is great. We could walk to all the main sights and enjoy tea right around the corner sitting on those inviting sofas. We were very happy with our choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: TomkarAdelaide
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a street with pedestrian access only so you have to walk a short distance with your luggage. On arrival, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is in need of a refurbishment as it's looking pretty tired. Our superior room was small. The bed wasn't quite a double as our feet were hanging over the end. The pillows were very hard and lumpy and the sheets and blanklet just covered the top of the bed. It was quiet as long as we kept our window shut. The bathtub was raised making getting out of it somewhat hazardous. As far as walking distance to many of the tourist attractions, this hotel was perfect. The tram is at the end of the street which was extremely convenient. There are numerous cafes and restaurants on the same street but watch out for the extremely pushy restauranteurs eager to lure you in. It was worthwhile going up to the rooftop terrace at the Ozler restaurant on the corner in the evening - quite the experience! Would we go back, probably not as I would only rate this hotel as 3 star but if it's location you want, it's a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city stay”
Reviews.Author: rodandann
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sapphire Hotel / Safir Otel for 3 nights at the end of a tour of Turkey. The staff were friendly, efficient and helpful. Our room was very comfortable although slightly small, which is to be expected in the old part of Istanbul. It is centrally situated for easy access to all the top tourist spots, and the efficient tram system is just around the corner. Facilities include a well maintained indoor pool, juccuzi, and sauna. Finally the breakfasts were superb - easily the best we had during our 19 day Turkey experience.

Reviews.Title: “WONDER HOTEL, WONDERFUL STAFF, WONDERFUL LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Tillyfloss_9
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and 22 year old son stayed here for 3 nights recently. We picked it solely on the very good reviews and were not disappointed. On arrival we were greeted in reception with complimentary drinks and turkish delight. We were shown to our room which was bigger than expected after reading previous reviews. We slept like babies in a spotless room. Nothing is too much trouble for any member of the lovely staff. Breakfast was superb everyday, with an array of fruit, cereals, cheeses, meets, honey still on the honeycomb, I could go on. They offer free transfers from hotel to and from Ataturk airport. There just is no end to their hospitality. We were even given a gift when we left. I think on reflection, one of the reasons this hotel is so great, is that it was obvious that, from the cleaners, waiters, right up to management level, all the staff enjoyed working there, which gives the whole place a very positive glow.

Reviews.Title: “really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller0636
Reviews.Content: Everything was lovely about this hotel. We knew that the room was going to be small but it was really nice so was the bathroom. The breakfast selection was impressive and good quality. The reception staff were very helpful - they put themselves out to research our queries on the internet. The location couldn't be better for all of the sites. Reception, restaurant and swimming pool all tastefully decorated. There is a restaurant diagonally opposite to the left which has a roof top restaurant with stunning views at night. The food here was good as well. We will definitely be recommending this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Like having a best friend in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Pelicanbird
Reviews.Content: What is it like to go to a foreign city and find that you have a friend who will help you in every way possible? If you stay at the Hotel Sapphire, you will find out. Due to a reservation mix up with another hotel, my husband and I ended up at the Hotel Sapphire at the last minute at the end of September. In addition to giving us a warm welcome, the manager personally helped us to sort out the reservation mix up with the other hotel and to obtain a refund, spending at least an hour of his time assisting us with this problem. The amount of concern he expressed and the attention he paid to our issue (even more concerned than we were!) was truly amazing and very much appreciated. We were also very pleasantly surprised to find that we were offered complimentary transportation to the airport and farewell gifts upon leaving. From start to finish we felt like honored guests. In addition to the helpfulness and thoughtfulness of all of the manager and other staff, other features that impressed us included the breakfast buffet, which was an abundant assortment of local and international dishes. Also, the location in the old city is convenient to all of the major sites and the hotel is sited on a pretty street with lots of enjoyable restaurants. Although our room was small by American standards, it was a typical European size and contained all of the amenities that we could want, including effective air conditioning, endless hot water, a mini bar, safe, and television. Sometimes mix ups work out for the best and ending up at the Hotel Sapphire was certainly one of those times for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great staff”
Reviews.Author: ehvini
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for two nights in September after coming off a cruise. What a great way to end our vacation. The hotel is located on a charming side street (it was tricky to find, but we had several locals point us in the right direction.) We were greeted warmly on arrival, and escorted to our room by a bellman. Loved the parrot in the lobby! Great location to reach all the notable tourist sights, Blue Mosque, bazaars, etc. We opted for the cab to the airport which they arranged for us, and upon our departure they gifted us with a tea set and Turkish Delight. The hospitality of the hotel and the Turkish people were amazing. My husband and I got lost again coming back from the bazaar, and an elderly Turkish man who could not speak any English noticed us looking at our map. He came over and looked at it and then pointed us in the right direction. He also followed us around the corner to make sure we took the right street and directed us further. We had a great experience in Istanbul and would definitely return. Oh and yes..the breakfast is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Suited us perfectly”
Reviews.Author: Polly-Dlevkas
Reviews.Content: A really well run and hospitable hotel whe endeavoured to help us in every possible way. 'Sir', they said, 'this is your home while you are in Istanbul'. The rooms represent excellent value for money, the breakfasts are amazing and the position close to a tramstop in Sultanahmet is so convenient. We have stayed at another well-known franchise hotel very nearby which was more expensive and not so good. We shall stay at the Sapphire again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for visiting Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: andreealisievici
Reviews.Content: This was not the only hotel we stayed in Istanbul, so the comparison points it out even more. The location is great, you can reach all major attractions from the old center within minutes. If you get a room facing the back of the hotel it's also very quiet, and you don't get to hear the payer calls that much (at 6 in the morning and you can hear them basically everywhere, so beware :) ). The room is not big, but I think that applies for every hotel in Sultanahmet. In any case, there are hotels with smaller rooms, so I wouldn't consider this a major downside.
