It's nice that you have tea and coffee in your room though. The staff was one of the best I've met, very helpful and polite. I haven't tried the pool, but it seems a nice touch in that crowded area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place: We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Filosofo2
Reviews.Content: Free pick up from airport upon arrival (value of 40 lira) Free fruit juice and Turkish delight upon arrival, and the lad carried our suitcases to the room. He also took them out to the car when we left. Clean, modern, charming hotel with free WiFi, free swimming pool and sauna (we didn't see the sauna and we didn't have time to actually use the pool, but it looked lovely), free electronic safe in the room (set your own combination). There are even bathrobes: luxury! The hotel has a desktop PC in the lobby with broadband access for free use of guests. They'll even letyou print out your boarding passes FOC, if you ask them. Kettle and supply of coffee and tea sachets in the room. Room quite spacious. Minibar/fridge for keeping your own drinks cool. Prices for minibar not too expensive, compared with outside. Flat screen satellite TV. Loads of channels, although just news channels in English. Bed firm but comfortable, changed every day. Friendly, professional, enthusiastic, cheeerful, helpful staff. French doors open up to enjoy fresh air in the evening. Extremely efficient double glazing kept noise out. Air conditioning very good and easy to use. I've read some of the negative reviews and considered some of the "negative" points of this hotel. No, there is no on-street parking. That is becasue it is situated in the old quarter of the city and the cobbled streets don't accommodate more than one car's width. We also requested a double bed but were offered a twin bed room on arrival. We asked if it would be possible to change and it was dealt with immediately and cheerfully. Note that many hotels across Europe and the Middle East routinely offer twin beds. It is only English-speaking countries, it seems, which prefer double beds! This hotel cannot guarantee a double bed but sorted us out no problem anyway. Location is fantastic; 5 minute's stroll from all the ancient attractions, etc. Street outside front of hotel taken up with restaurant tables where people dine and lunch, rather than rowdy outdoor pub/bar tables, as in some other streets. Only quibbles were: 1 Rooftop terrace nowhere near ready for use, although it is great vantage point for taking pictures of the city. 2 Housekeeping didn't replace tea and coffee supplies as we used them. But the willing, can-do attitude of the staff and all the other positive points of the hotel make these minor quibbles. They certainly didn't spoil our holiday one bit. I'm sure we could have mentioned the tea and coffee and they would have fixed it, but we couldn't be bothered: we were too busy enjoying ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice, helfull and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Beirutkate
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend this hotel because of the location, service, and affordable prices. In one word , got everything needed to enjoy the trip to Istanbul.I will surely go back there once more and already recommended it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Globalnomad18
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Istanbul and since we have young children, we knew we wanted a "clean, decently priced hotel, close to the major sights and with a swimming pool." After hours of looking up hotels, we booked a triple room at Hotel sapphire. Our booking was a little complicated as Istanbul was our base as we travelled around. So it was 3 stays at Hotel sapphire, requiring 3 separate bookings. I was quite concerned if there would be a mix up, as the hotel only had 4 triple rooms and July is quite a busy month for them. At first glance, the hotel seemed small and unassuming. The decor, quaintly old world. The rooms were clean but quite small. With three beds and several suitcases, ours was filled to capacity. The hotel is located on a small cobblestoned street, overlooking another hotel and several restaurants. But at the far end of the street, you could see a mosque with towering minarets to remind you that you were in Istanbul. The proximity to the major sights (just a 15 minute walk) , to a number of restaurants and souvenir shops was perfect for us. The breakfast provided by the hotel was large and sumptuous. After a day's sightseeing, the children could swim while I browsed around the shops in the vicinty. The children thoroughly enjoyed the parrot in the reception and the swimming pool. It was a 2 minute walk to the nearest tram stop and we used the tram to the get to the Grand Bazaar, which was 3 stops away. Just about everything was easily accessible. The staff need a special mention, especially Mr. Engin. They were highly efficient and friendly. Every request was taken care of with a smile. Absolutely no request was declined and you were always made to feel welcome. All three of our stays went by smoothly. A few hours after leaving Turkey we realised I had left behind my jewellery case in the room. It contained some jewellery I was very sentimental about and the pendrive with all our pictures from the month spent in Europe. Needless to say, I was miserable. We requested the hotel to help us but the chances of recovering lost jewellery seemed very slim to me. When they reverted that they had found nothing in the room, it wasn't a surprise. However, a week later, I received an email from the hotel that they had found the jewellery case. They had obviously continued to look for it. I received it with every single piece of jewellery intact and the pendrive with all our pictures. Next time I go to istanbul, I am definitely staying there again. It is a decent, well maintained, moderately priced hotel in a great location, with efficient, friendly and HONEST staff. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CultureSeeker_9
Reviews.Content: Read many reviews about this hotel on TripAdvisor before I booked and was not disappointed. The location is perfect being only 10 minutes walk from the main tourist sites and the ferry port. The hotel is in a quiet pedestrianised street, with other small hotels and some very good restaurants including the Harem Restaurant just across from the hotel. Prices here are very reasonable and food very good. Cheaper than in Sultanahmet which can be pricey. The hotel picked us up free of charge at the airport when we arrived which was really good and arranged a taxi to take us back which cost 40 Lira (very reasonable). The hotel has a couple of pc's for use by the guests and wifi. The rooms are on the small side but very comfortable and have everything you need and are very clean, with good aircon. There is a small swiming pool in the basement which is good to relax and cool down after a long day sightseeing. The best thing about the hotel are the very friendly staff who are always willing to help and answer any questions or book restaurants etc if you need. I would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Istanbul which is a very interesting vibrant and friendly city.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: Hollypooch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and found it perfect in every way. The location is ideal for visiting all the places of interest in Sultanahmet area, for restaurants and cafes, and for accessing trams and ferries to visit other parts of Istanbul. Our room was very comfortable and well appointed, and due to the hotel being on a pedestrianised street, it was surprisingly peaceful especially considering that it is in the busy centre of Sultanahmet. The whole of hotel was very clean and the hotel services were very well organised. The transport from and to the airport (from being included in the price) was much appreciated. Breakfast was buffet style and was very generous, varied and constantly replenished. We didn't use the pool, sauna or Turkish Bath facilities but looked at them and these facilities were surprisingly large for a hotel in this particular city centre. All the staff were extremely helpful, friendly and courteous to us. We especially appreciated the diligent assistance of Reception staff in helping us to organise a visit to the Florence Nightingale museum in Selimiye Barracks (which, due to military security, was no easy thing accomplish!). We intend to visit Istanbul yet again (there is still so much to see and do) and will certainly want to stay at the Sapphire again. I can't believe that 2 of the previous reviewers (smbst99 [25/08/2010] of New York and pmui [19/08/2010] of Hong Kong) had stayed at the same hotel as us - this is the second time we have been to Istanbul and unless you stay well out of the centre, which we did previously, I don't think we could have found a better hotel with such value for money. We can definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ITS THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: f_georgakopoulou
Reviews.Content: Its a very nice hitel. We stay for a week. The stuff was very helpfull. The breakfast was excellent and the location. Also ti is near the most monuments and the value worth. I want to give my regards to Mr Vural.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ABKL
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on other reviews on Tripadvisor, and we were delighted. We were collected at the airport in the evening and our journey to the hotel took approx 30 mins. Our driver spoke little english but tried his best to point out certain things to us. We were welcomed at reception most enthusiastically by a very friendly, happy young man who could not have done anymore for us. We were given a welcome drink, maps, telephone numbers & advice on things to see & do etc. We were escorted to our room, it was a fairly small room (triple) but not unexpected as we had been told about this when we booked. The room was perfectly adequate, as was the bathroom. Breakfast was a treat - an excellent selection and we did 'over-indulge' most mornings. We found all the staff to be helpful, friendly and always polite. This was our first trip to Istanbul but will not be our last. It was Ramadam when we visted but this did not affect anything, maybe the restaurants were a little busier in the evening when we ate but this enhanced the experience rather than hinder it. Upon leaving we were presented with gifts of Turkish Apple Tea and Turkish Delight, we all thought this was a very nice & thoughtful touch. I have been in contact with the hotel since to thank them and say what a lovely time we had and received a charming & prompt response.

Reviews.Title: “Not fabulous, but unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: smbst99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little old and worn so when we first arrived we were a little turned off. As my husband put it, all that was missing was the outline of the body in the hallway... BUT it turned out to be perfect for our touring of the city. We were within walking distance of ALL of the major sites and right on the tram line if it was a rainy day or you didn't want to walk. very easy to get over to beyoglu as well. If you have a short period of time and want to see a lot, you should stay here. Our hotel room itself was clean and quiet. good water pressure. Wireless internet was a little spotty at times. didn't love the breakfast. It is a small hotel so the staff recognize you and are very helpful. there is a pool in the basement but don't choose this hotel based on that

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: arimfc
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, good breakfast and free sauna and pool facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, good location and average services”
Reviews.Author: pmui
Reviews.Content: Rooms are particularly small, 1st room they gave me is a twin and even on my own I found it very small, I have to put my suitcase on the second bed to walk to toilet. Second room is a king and a bit larger. Services were okay, though they are not very good in giving directions, of course anyone know how to take a taxi why need them to tell me. Definitely do NOT go for the tour company they recommend, you get much cheaper and better ones at the local tourist info. They cut the locations you get to go to, make lots of racist jokes, cannot answer much cultural/historical questions about the places and simply unfriendly in general. Later I found that the same boss own that tour company. So in general, other reviews are a bit generous (reason why I pick this one) and a bit overprice for the whole experience but very close to the attraction points.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and great breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: rogan_falla
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff were knowledgable, helpful and courteous. The room was beautifully cleaned daily with fresh linen daily. Quiet room in central location within walking distance of most historic sites. Very good breakfast menu. Tea and coffee making facilities in room and efficient air conditioning. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Instabul”
Reviews.Author: ifbourg
Reviews.Content: The hotel takes place in a very convenient location. It is clean providing with good facilities (eg free WIFI, free computer terminals, pool and sauna).Rooms are small but functional. (maybe it is to be expected to get small rooms in the old part of town ). The staff is very outgoing and helpful. Concerning the breakfast, it is ok but in my opinion it could be better.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, perfectly situated!”
Reviews.Author: George_Cantstanza
Reviews.Content: They give you a drink and turkish delights while you're checking in, and a box of turkish delights along with a gift pack of turkish apple tea when you leave..... and in between the hotel staff are always friendly, courteous, polite and very helpful. The rooms are great, bathrooms spotless and you have everything you need in the hotel, including free wifi plus computers in the lounge for your use if you haven't brought your laptop. The hotel is situated perfectly - just a short walk from many of the major sights and in a pedestrianised area with plenty of good restaurants and bars, but not noisy or boisterous at night. Hotels like this are what tripadvisor are for - before tripadvisor you might've got a recommendation from a friend or two, but their stay might have been some time before, or there might be a difference in quality of rooms within the same hotel.... or you'd pay the money for a 5 star hotel (and even then often be disappointed!). Now you can check out dozens of reviews (or in the case of Sapphire, hundreds of reviews) and be failrly sure that even for well under 100 euros a night you're going to get an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Decent if Touristy Location and a Pool!”
Reviews.Author: MisterEtraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a tourist dominated area a few short blocks from GÃ¼lhane Park and Topkapi Palace. The hotel is situated on a pedestrian-only street lined with more hotels, restaurants and shops that cater almost exclusively to tourists. The unique quality of the 'Hotel Safir' is the small pool and sauna in the basement. One floor above is the breakfast/dining room that serves up an extensive buffet every morning that caters to European and Middle East tastes; no pancakes, omelettes or breakfast sausage. The rooms will need renovating in the next few years but for now they are more than adequate. Where the hotel fails is with the housekeeping standards and linen. The bed linen is worn and the towels nearly threadbare. In the 6 nights I was there I used items from the coffee/tea basket and from the mini-fridge; neither was re-stocked during my stay. Typical of a hotel in Turkey, native English speakers are not the majority of their patrons and the satellite TV in the rooms reflect that - hundreds of channels and about 4 news channels in English. The lobby is grand and beautiful as you can tell by the pictures. Unfortunately, it's under utilized by the hotel; relegated to serving as a large sitting area instead of being used as a lounge and snack area. Following the nearby tram line rails leads you, in just several minutes, to the ferry docks in one direction and the Hagia Sofia/Blue Mosque in the other.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service, and value”
Reviews.Author: kmn4
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are very friendly and accommodating, and the cold drink and Turkish delight on check-in were a welcome treat. The room was very nice - beds are comfortable, bathrooms well-appointed, and the in-room coffee and tea service was a nice bonus. From the hotel, it is about a ten to fifteen-minute walk to the sights of Sultanahmet Square (Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, the Cisterns) in one direction, a fifteen-minute walk to the Grand Bazaar in another direction, and a 30-minute walk to the New District via the Galata Bridge. The breakfast buffet included in the price of the room was amazing - having spent three weeks in Gonen prior to my arrival, I can honestly say that the buffet is representative of what the Turks actually eat for breakfast (breads, olives, meats, etc.). Perhaps it is not what most Westerners expect, but it is very good! I would gladly stay here again should I have the opportunity to visit Istanbul in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, friendly hotel, would go back.”
Reviews.Author: Gawaine
Reviews.Content: The staff were a class act! Did everything to make our stay as pleasant as possible. Even to upgrade our room to a double without us asking. Vural needs to be made Concierge! Also, I haven't forgot Johnno the parrot. Great character.The hotel itself was more luxurious than we expected with the room tastefully decorated and with all the mod cons i.e. huge stand in shower, ice-cool air conditioning, cable, fridge. Location was also close to all the main attractions which made life convenient and in fact it was also remarkably quiet for its location. If there were any niggles it would have to be that the Swimming and Sauna facilities were always too busy to use and the breakfast could have been a bit more agreeable. Certain things were overdone a bit because they are done in bulk. Grey eggs. Bitter Tea.That sort of thing.These are small problems but this is why we awarded the hotel 4 stars rather than five. Can be easily fixed. Overall though the hotel is fantastic and great value for money. We will stay there again next time we are in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in top location”
Reviews.Author: gecko24
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel due to TA recoms and its central location to the old city and cannot praise it more highly. From the welcoming drink and helpful info to tired travellers to the efficient checkout everything is handled in a warm and proficient manner by the friendly staff. With 3 of us travelling together we had a triple room with 3 single beds-it was spacious (more so than some of the doubles I believe), and included tea and coffee making facilities (very much appreciated), a bar fridge (useful for keeping our milk and water etc cold) and a small balcony overlooking the street. It was very quiet at night and the beds were firm but comfortable. The hotel includes a buffet breakfast with sufficient western style food to keep a teenager happy as well as the meats and salad choices common to the Med and eastern diets. Other facilities include free wi-fi, free pc's in the lounges (once you fathom the keyboards), a subterranean swimming pool, a restaurant (didn't try but the blackboard set course menu looked reasonable compared to tourist traps outside), and free airport pick up if you stay 3 nights or longer (which was wonderful!) The hotel is in a perfect location to walk to everywhere from the Galata Bridge and docks at Eminonu to the Aya Sofya surrounds and Topkapi Palace to the Grand Bazaar. We would definately stay here again on any return trips to Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value and friendly place to stay in heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ynp-10
Reviews.Content: we stayed here 5 nights in total and had very helpful, friendly service and advice throughout . The hotel is in a great location, very clean and rooms very comfortable. Excellent value too! We enjoyed our sightseeing citybreak there very much!

Reviews.Title: “Service, service, service”
Reviews.Author: Euro_hopper19
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service consistently merits this hotel 5 stars. Chaotic groups of weary travelers are welcomed, comfortably seated while waiting organized and dispatched to their rooms in minutes. When facing distinct simultaneous demands from tourists, the front desk personnelâ€™s professional calm makes each supplicant feel that their concerns matter. For us a non-functioning cable box was replaced within 20 minutes, and taxi drivers requested by the front desk appeared in five minutes. Breakfasts are abundant, with both traditional European and Mediterranean foods available. After having stayed at the hotel for five days, the front desk helpfully pointed out that since we were familiar with the tram system, we didnâ€™t need a more expensive taxiâ€”but could easily reach our destination by tram. At night the hotel is easy to locate by the string of sapphire blue lights near the entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: alineoklahoma
Reviews.Content: The location was very good, the rooms were clean, the breakfast buffet was interesting and tasty. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only problem we encountered was our driver was looking for Hotel Sapphire and the name is spelled Safir on the hotel. I would definitely like to come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: allstarsprog
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, really central, walking distance all round the old town. Good restaurants right outside the hotel. Staff all really friendly and helpful. Free internet in the reception. Large buffet breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Return!”
Reviews.Author: TxGrl
Reviews.Content: This hotel did not disappoint. Upon arriving, after our free pick-up from the airport, we received a welcoming drink & a piece of Turkish delight as the staff checked us in & provided us with a map of the city to get us oriented. They could not have been friendlier or more welcoming! We were taken to our room, which had two twin beds instead of one queen (which I had requested via email), but I asked if it were possible to get another room & we were immediately moved without hesitation. The room was clean & nicely decorated. The bed was comfortable, but don't be surprised with the sparse bedding! (This seemed to be the case everywhere we stayed in Turkey, though. I don't think they place emphasis on "luxurious" bedding like we do in the U.S.) The bathroom was great & the shower always had hot water. (The hair dryer was interesting, though. It got so hot that I couldn't finish drying my hair without using a towel to hold it because it was burning my hand!) I also loved how you could open the windows - we slept with them open at night, & it was fairly quiet facing the back of the hotel. The daily call to prayer at about 4:45am was an early wake-up call, but you can always fall back asleep or bring earplugs! And if you have not yet read about the breakfast...wow. We have never seen such a breakfast buffet in our lives! Granted, I still have no idea what some of the items were, but everything we tried was excellent. A great start to each day! And whenever you want Turkish tea throughout the day or after a long day out on the town, just ask. It is complimentary! The location of the hotel was also perfect - you could literally walk everywhere. There is a city rail system that we used once to get to Taksim Square - it is easy to use, but it can get really crowded & it does not seem to have much a/c so we only used it once & preferred to walk everywhere else! The only annoyance about the location is that it is surrounded by restaurants & they are relentless in wanting you to stop in or just take a quick look at the menu. Be polite but firm in your "no thank you" or else you will spend all of your time looking at menus instead of sightseeing! Overall, the price we paid for this hotel compared to the services we received was unbelievable. We thoroughly enjoyed every minute of our stay here, & we cannot wait to return! Istanbul is an amazing city, so enhance your visit by staying at this hotel. We even received a parting gift as we left!

Reviews.Title: “this hotel got everything right”
Reviews.Author: jlg196541
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a charming little find, tucked away in the centre of it all. The staff were all really friendly and helpful. They did whatever they could to make our stay the best possible. The rooms were clean and well maintained, tea facilities in the room and good air con. The hotel is near all the big attractions like Topkapi Palace, the Bazar and the Blue Mosque. We travelled round Europe and stayed in a few hotels over the last couple of weeks and this was my favourite. For the money, I would definitly recommend it. The breakfast was good. The swimming pool was nice and clean. For the money, you really can't fault this hotel, it has a wonderful atmosphere and I look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding service and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Jalou06
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in Istanbul for two nights as our purpose was to visit Gallipoli and then embark on a Greek Island cruise. On arrival at the hotel, we were greeted with welcome drinks and delicious turkish delight. The front desk went to great lengths to orientate us using a map and answering our many questions. The hotel was spotlessly clean and our room comfortable and nicely furnished. The room was not large because it is an older hotel but we knew this as Engin, from the Sapphire Hotel, made us aware of this when we first asked for a booking. We left for Gallipoli in the early hours of the morning and the front desk staff were very quick to organise breakfast for us and then contact the tour company when it seemed like they were taking a long time to arrive. We did not have much time so we were pleased that the position of the hotel was well situated for sightseeing and train transport. Being near the harbour, it was also easy to access our cruise. The area around the hotel was delightful and we fell in love with Istanbul. We were sorry that our stay was so short and hope to return sometime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT FOR US!”
Reviews.Author: kitkerr
Reviews.Content: Given that we only had a short time in Istanbul, the hotel was perfectly located centrally to everything we needed to see, and to transport. Located on an exquisite cobbled lane, close to bars and restaurants too, yet not noisy - so we had a great night's sleep. The staff were genuinely, friendly and helpful, breakfast was superb too! The rooms are small, but comfortable and the hotel has a gorgeous indoor pool!!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: globaldutch
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, good and friendly staff, great breakfast. Small rooms but equiped with all modern comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: mondragon
Reviews.Content: I will not insist about all the advantages and about all the good things that this hotel is offering because everybody before me was telling all the story and I will mention only one bad thing wich I was facing: -I don't think that the bathroom was cleaned before our arriving in the hotel because I found remnants of excrement into the toilet bowl and also one hair in the bath tube. btw the parrot from the reception is very funny.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been happier”
Reviews.Author: mpdman
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent. Staff was over-the-top friendly and professional. Room was clean. Breakfast was expansive. Transport from airport was included. I had an early flight out, and these guys even made me a sandwich as the breakfast buffet was not opened yet. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: PB57
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple stayed for four nights in early June. I concur with other reviewers that this hotel is excellent value for money. The rooms are clean and it is well located to all sights. Importantly the staff are all extremely friendly. Due to the proximity to restaurants it can get a little noisy outside at night but this is no big deal. I would stay again and would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantasticly friendly staff in an awesome location”
Reviews.Author: TaaneJ
Reviews.Content: To be handed a free ice cold drink upon arrival in stiffling heat, given a wee trinket and shown to a very comfortable air conditoned room with great facilities (tea and coffee - rare in Europe!) just blew our minds! In all the hotels we've stayed in around the world we've never encountered this level of service. Staying so close to great restaurants and bars not to mention some of the key sites in Istanbul was brilliant and made life very easy for us. The included breakfast included a vast variety of foods - and while not all of it was to our taste, there was no excuse to leave hungry and we certainly felt well set for the day ahead. After 3 wonderful days in this beautiful city we checked out and as we prepared to leave my wife was given presents - a lovely tea set and a box of turkish delight - something else we have never encountered before. We have already told friends about this hotel and are planning to head back there to stay as soon as we can!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money”
Reviews.Author: 56PS
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after looking on this website and found it exactly as I expected. The accommodation was a good standard and the staff were excellent. The breakfast was typical of what I would expect in Turkey and the cooked breakfast was disappointing. However, the selection was vast. The hotel is tucked round a back sidestreet and not easy to find if you're in a taxi because the streets at the back aren't really for cars. But compared to other Hotels this is great value plus the local cafes and restaurants outside create a fab outdoor dining experience. Paul, Neston , UK

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, service, good value for the money, will go back there.”
Reviews.Author: eye4usecurity
Reviews.Content: One of the many hotels in that area, but the only one with a swimming pool aswell, which after a day walking thru the fantastic views, is a lust to relax before going out for dinner. The service and friendliness of the staff, goes beyond expectation! The breakfast is outstanding, there is so much to choose from, therefor they should explain what is what! So less food would be waisted, cause people can choose more selectively. The beds ( boxsprings) could be a little softer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: pajob
Reviews.Content: We are 2 Couples and we stayed 6 days in this hotel Staff were the most helpful we have ever experienced in any hotel ever! The hotel is excellently located for the major attractions in Istanbul, and is surrounded by restaurants, with bars and shops in nearby streets. The rooms are better than we expected for an old town hotel, they were clean and perfectly formed. Breakfast was also better than expected for a 3 star hotel. What really made this hotel a pleasure was undoubtably the staff - other hotels would do well to learn from the example this hotel and it's employees have set! The local restraunteurs can hassle you to come into their establishments - we recommend going a bit further afield to the Sir Evi restaurant a 10 minute walk, or a short tram ride. Located down a small street off Divanyolu Street. After passing the Sultanahmet Mosque on your left, turn right at the macdonalds and Sir Evi is about 50 yards. Clay pot Testi Kebap was really good. In the street where the hotel is located, to the left is a new hotel and bar, the sultania. We had a couple of "Light" meals here, Chicken and Beef wraps - both fantastic value at about Â£3.50 to Â£4.00 - again what made this bar was the bar manager, Husseyn, nothing was too much trouble, and he was a really efficient and pleasant guy, and definitly no hassle. Well done Husseyn, you helped make our holiday one to remember Many Thanks, John, Pat, Geoff & Bev

Reviews.Title: “A real Ottoman treat with genuine Turkish hospitality”
Reviews.Author: AntiquesOnTour
Reviews.Content: Loved the Sapphire Hotel, location, staff & parrot. Comfy, spotlessly clean, room with great facilities & bountiful breakfast. A wonderful introduction to Istanbul & Turkey. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again & recommend to others. Good location to all sites in the Old City. The parrot is a great character & adds to the homely atmosphere. The staff welcomed & treated us like friends even though we only stayed 1 night. Wanted to stay for more. Tesekaur

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: nanikaprague
Reviews.Content: We felt at home staying at this hotel. Very friendly, and helpful staff, very warm and hospitable. Great location, at walking distance to all the major Istanbul historic sights. Very good and plentiful breakast, nice and clean rooms. Very nice relaxation facility - swimming pool, sauna. Good value for money. Hotel Sapphire is a hotel I highly recommend and will certainly choose for my future stay in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: judyanthony
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very pleasant surprise. We loved it! Great staff, delicious breakfast, perfect location, clean and reasonably priced. We will stsy here again and will recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: The success of our visit to Istanbul was built upon the quality of our stay at The Sapphire. Situated in the heart of Sultanahmet and within walking distance of the major sites, the hotel is on a pedestrian-only street which means that you are immune from the dangers and noise of traffic. The hotel's facilities are good and decoration is in the slightly over-blown, Eastern European style. Our room was clean and comfortable with efficient air-conditioning. Unfortunately, the roof terrace was being renovated during our stay. The breakfasts were very good with a large choice of cereals, breads and hot and cold food. Tea lovers might like to get their cuppas before it has stood too long in the urn as the longer it stood the stronger it became! The real strength of The Sapphire lies in its staff. From their initial bright and cheery welcome they could not have been more helpful or accommodating. Their bright and cheerful demeanor was always in evidence and we felt very well looked after at all times. The hotel is surrounded by restaurants. They are of variable quality but the one immediately opposite the entrance toThe Sapphire was our favourite. However, Istanbul is awash with restaurants and there is a particularly good selection in the streets behind the Blue Mosque. Our top tips would be: 1. Use Backpackers for transfers and tours - very reliable and reasonably priced. 2. Don't buy Bosphorous tours from anyone - use the ferries and create your own. It's much cheaper and more fun. 3. Make use of the excellent tram system - 1.5 lira flat rate for any journey and regular and efficient. 4. If there is no tram route where you want to go, take a taxi, they are also cheap. 5. Don't drink at the North Shield pub around the corner from the hotel - their prices are ruinous. 6. Don't put your fingers too far into the cage of the hotel parrot - its beak is strong and sharp! We enjoyed Istanbul and our stay at The Sapphire so much that we intend to return to the city and this hotel at the first opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Like home”
Reviews.Author: bittencourtfamily
Reviews.Content: IÂ´d like to congratulate Mr. Engin (manager) and his team for the excellent service provided during our stay. They are helpful, friendly and most of all, polite and happy. Denis helped us in many different ways and was always ready to assist. The hotel is very good, good value for everything that comes with, very well located in the old city, walking distance from tram, ayasophia, blue mosque, orient express trains station, exchange money office and the best of all, near to a Burguer King store. Not that we like much of junke food, but after a couple of weeks eating turkish food, we really need to eat something with a different taste. Finally, the only thing we though could be improved is the breakfast. Be a little more occidental, but I guess this is the same everywhere else we have stayed. Well, itÂ´s part of the trip, and once we had decided to go there, we shall respect their culture and habits. Grade 10 to them.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: pugcruiser
Reviews.Content: Everyone I met at the front desk and lobby bent over backwards to make my stay memorable. No question was too trivial and when my own plan to visit the Suliemaniye mosque fell through (under restoratiion and closed to the public), Deniz came up with an alternate plan to the Ayup Sultan mosque and other sites within that area to visit for the day. It was a fabulous locals only mosque (no tour buses, tourist groups, touts, etc.) with great people watching. Only later did I read in a guidebook that it is the third holiest shrine in Islam to visit as Ayup Sultan was the standard bearer for Mohammad. We were given restaurant recommendations, ideas for exploring the city, help in getting taxis, aid in finding a good Turkish bath (not the well known tourist spots) and even help in buying confections at Haci Bekir, a famous confectioner in Istanbul (help from the hotel manager, no less, who popped out of his office to write down a list of things to try). Whether it was the manager, concierge, night staff, day staff, window washer - everyone was gracious and helpful. Can't say enough about this hotel. After 3 days, we moved to a more "luxurious" hotel to join our tour and although the new accomodations were more luxurious, their staff in no way came up too snuff with the Sapphire staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sapphire a Heartwarming place to be”
Reviews.Author: amsterdam65
Reviews.Content: From the first footstep in the hotel till the last footstep out off the hotel, we felt very welcome and secured. The service of the reception staff is excellent ,many hotels in the world can take that as an example. Hotel room is good ,not so big but you have everything for a pleasant stay. Beds are good, and the best thing is the tastefull breakfast in the morning. Location in the center of istanbul is very attractive ,most things on walking distance. Many restaurants in front of the hotel ,so you do not have to walk far for a meal. (just 3 steps ) Check in - a welcome drink and ,a blue turkisch good luck eye. Check out - 2 glasses turkisch apple tea and a box of turkisch sweets, A very charming gesture of the hotel. I can highly recommand this hotel. It was an honour to stay with them.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Omar0
Reviews.Content: very helpful Staff and especially Denize, rich breakfast buffet with delicious foods, the location of the hotel is perfect, near the tramway station and just 5 minutes by walk to the Blue Mosk, Aya Sofia, and Topkapi Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: highflierSussex
Reviews.Content: The Sapphire hotel is ideally located for exploring Istanbul. We stayed in the hotel for 6 nights, and the reviews on Tripadvisor are perfectly accurate. The staff are friendly and helpful and the breakfast is extensive. A really nice play to stay.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: wanderer097
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on reviews on Tripadvisor and have to agree with the general consensus that this is a really well located hotel with friendly staff. The rooms aren't big but they are big enough as Istanbul is an extraordinary city which demands that you spend as much time as possible in its glorious mayhem. The staff were very helpful but also not pushy, and professional enough to read correctly the amount of engagement different guests required. The pool area is lovely and relaxing - a cool little oasis in a very busy city. The location is perfect, close to the major sights of Sultanamet, but also close enough to the Galata bridge that if you don't want to use the (excellent) tram system, you can walk across the bridge to Beyoglu. Istanbul is a fantastic city and this is a great little hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great value for money - you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: pinkyflowers
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on reviews and price, and am happy to say we were not disappointed. The location of the hotel is great - most sights are within walking distance, and it's close to the harbour if you want to catch the ferry to the Asian side or take a cruise on the Bosphorous. The tram stop is only a 2-minute walk and very cheap and easy to use (can get a bit cosy though when it's busy!), and the surrounding streets are full of restaurants, cafes etc, (we couldn't hear the street noise in the bedroom, which was great). The waiters in the side streets do hassle you to go into their restaurants which can get really irritating, but this is the same everywhere in Istanbul. The best thing about the hotel is the friendly and efficient attitude of all the staff - they really do go out of their way to make you welcome, and they answered all our questions and were very helpful throughout our stay. For example, on arrival we were given a twin bedded room but wanted a double, so because the hotel was full and they could not move us, they actually brought a double bed to our room and took the twin beds away! I was amazed. We booked transport to the airport through the hotel reception which was great - hassle free and a reasonable price. If you want a moderately priced hotel in a perfect location, then you won't be disappointed with the Hotel Sapphire.

Reviews.Title: “A Top-Notch Hotel that Makes you feel that You've Come Home to your Family”
Reviews.Author: Keltin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked in at the hotel quite late after arriving from an uncomfortable flight from Kayseri. We felt at home immediately when we were warmly greeted by the friendly reception staff. Our request for extra pillows was met almost instantly. What impressed us most were the efficient staff that really went out of their way to be genuinely helpful in little things as well as the usual services that one would expect from a boutique hotel. Although, they gave us 2 separate beds instead of a double bed, we didn't ask for a change of room as we were just glad to be able to sleep in a really clean and fresh-smelling room and to take our showers in a nice and modern bathroom. Believe me we had stayed at another hotel in Istanbul a couple of days earlier and it was not even half as nice as the Safir, but cost us 15 Euros more. Most of the staff there were not friendly at all save for one, but even he forgot to return my credit card after I had signed the slip when we were checking out on our last day. We had to go back there on our return to Istanbul from Ephesus, Pamukkale & Cappodocia late at night just to retrieve it. We stayed only for one night at the Safir (wish we could have stayed longer) because my wife had to fly home on her own and I was scheduled to take a flight to Hamburg for business. On the last day, the nice staff at the hotel even helped me to check the weather at my next destination on their computer at the front desk because for some reason, the Wi-Fi internet connection was not working properly in my room and I was not able to check it on my laptop. My wife, who had the whole day free to shop at the Grand Bazaar and the Egyptian Spice market after checking out, came back to the hotel utterly exhausted after many hours of shopping on her feet. While my wife was waiting at the lobby for a good 2 hours for the airport shuttle to pick her up, the hotel front desk staff showered her with a lot of care and attention. Despite my wife's polite decline, they still insisted on bringing her some hot Turkish apple tea, which happened to be her favorite drink throughout our trip in Turkey. What a great team of wonderful staff who understand the true meaning of hospitality! We wouldn't stay anywhere else but the Safir (Sapphire) Hotel when we should ever return to Istanbul again. We say this from the bottom of our hearts! Any downside? Sure... Just two irritating things that we can think of. Firstly, the street in front of the hotel is out of bounds to any vehicular traffic. Hence, if one has many heavy suitcases, it is a hassle to drag or lug them from/to the neighbouring streets about half a block away where the airport shuttle or taxi is waiting or dropping off. Plus, it isn't easy to wheel the suitcases since the street is cobble-stoned and not flat. Secondly, the street in front of the hotel can get pretty noisy due to the late night revellers dining and drinking at the many Turkish & Ottoman restaurants and bars surrounding the Safir. That's why the extra pillows we ordered came in most handy as reliable "ear plugs" to send us to dreamland quite effortlessly!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel location-- very good service”
Reviews.Author: licksmith
Reviews.Content: stayed 5 nights - booked based on this forums reviews-- great choice--did have to change rooms 1st night but only because we were given single beds-- no trouble with staff,no reminders needed, came back following day and our cases had been transfered -- breakfast far better than average--good choice for most tastes--fresh orange served at our table every morning--spotless display--staff very helpful-welcome drink on arrival-- free wifi with two computors on hand-- even lent me a small laptop one evening when both were being used--great way to check out the local resturants before you left the hotel on an evening--tried my best to teach the house parrott a feel expletives but he wasn't having any of it, he just kept wistleling the staff for attention with varing hellos--even gave each room a leaving thank you gift--can't say what it was because it'll spoil your surprise if you book here-- just that it was a nice jesture and a useful gift-- good location from all the sites-tram just arround the corner-- just one small black mark-one of the staff and i say one only because all the others were great fun and couldn't do enough for you ,had a very irretating habit ,that being when he recommended the hotel transport or a paticular resturant would offer to make a booking on a scrap of paper and if you than delined he made a big fuss and tore up the reservation into confetti "so you want to cancel this booking" totally unnessary as it was on a scrap of paper not been accepted anyway--he did it to us once and i saw him do it three other times --shame really but i would definetly recommend this hotel - great valve for money---great location and fabulous staff, well except for one irretating clown

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel -- location, staff, comfort, and cost can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: skwood
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the excellent TripAdvisor ratings and I'm now joining the chorus of enthusiasm. The hotel is a real find. My room was very clean and quite comfortable. Some reviewers and the hotel itself caution that the room are on the small side but I didn't find that (I was traveling alone). As noted by others, the breakfast buffet is extensive. The location was ideal for me -- on a quiet street but less than 5 minutes to walk to the tram or a short walk to Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, and the Blue Mosque. The staff is very welcoming and helpful -- thanks to all of you for a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: l0vet0travelt00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at this great hotel before taking a bus tour around Turkey. We booked this hotel because of the Tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. If you are looking for big chain hotel atmosphere and large rooms, don't come here. If you are looking for quaint (but clean and comfortable) and staff that make you feel completely at home, then this hotel would be perfect for you. On our tour we stayed in 4 and 5 star hotels around the country and we both agreed that none of them could compare to Hotel Sapphire. The location is fantastic! It is an easy walk to the Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace, Haghia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, etc. There are lots of restaurants close by. Our favourite was the Faro Restaurant, just around the corner. For a change from Turkish food, try their pizza. It was the best we have ever had. My husband and I found ourselves looking forward to it after eating gas station lunches and buffet dinners for two weeks. I would also recommend the Cappadocia stuffed veal. Delicious!! This hotel really helped make our stay in Istanbul a memorable experience. We would certainly recommend it and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming and friendly hotel, with great staff!”
Reviews.Author: PartyGirlScotland
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked to spend a few days in the Sapphire Hotel, which we thoroughly enjoyed! When our holiday was extended due to the volcanic eruption, however, the staff couldn't have been more helpful or sympathetic A potentially stressful time became, in fact, a real pleasure due to the empathy of Mr. Deniz and his colleagues at the hotel. We have told all our friends about the Sapphire Hotel, and would love to return ourselves one day. Happy, happy memories, The Golden Girls from Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KentCapricorn
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with other reviews, the staff at the Hotel Sapphire are what makes a stay here so special. They are so welcoming and hospitable it really feels like a home from home. The Hotel is very clean and well appointed and the location would be hard to beat. I highly recommend this Hotel and would book again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel for a citybreak”
Reviews.Author: Ann45_10
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. Good sized, clean rooms and wide ranging buffet breakfast included in room rate. Comfortable lounge with free internet access. Excellent location for visiting the sights of the old city and also close to the waterfront. Many good, reasonably priced restaurants near the hotel. Strongly recommend the use of 'Backpackers Travel' airport shuttle service for transfers; they were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely outstanding”
Reviews.Author: BootscooterCheshire
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just come back from our second stay at this fantastic hotel. This time we took along a couple of friends who were just as impressed as we are. As others have commented, the staff are absolutely top class, so helpful and friendly. The rooms are smallish, but well equipped and very clean. The breakfast buffet was superb and the location is perfect. Every major attraction in Istanbul is within a few minutes walking distance and there is a tram stop at the end of the road for travels further afield. The surrounding streets are filled with restaurants all of which seem to have the friendliest waiters on the planet and it was even warm enough to eat outside at the beginning of May which just added to the great atmosphere. Another bonus of the hotel is the swimming pool in the basement. Perfect to relax in after a hard days sightseeing. We recommend this hotel 100%.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Andrea_Fyfe
Reviews.Content: this hotel was really nice, great location just a few minutes walk from Topkapi palace and the tram system Ali, one of the guys at reception was really friendly and always willing to help The breakfast spread was amazing! so much food, the only problem is that it wasn't labelled so we have no idea what we were eating. stear away from the cerials though, they were pretty tasteless Our room was pretty small but the bathroom was bigger than we expected Definately a good place to stay, right in the center of almost everything

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Adamad
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in April. Every staff member went out of his or her way to make our stay memorable. The rooms were small, but very charming. The location can't be beat. We would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service. Located walking distance to attractions.”
Reviews.Author: NorthFloridaTraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay at the Hotel Sapphire. We would highly recommend that if you are going to Istanbul to stay at this hotel. The staff are very friendly and go out of their way to make your stay pleasant and also to help you with information, directions and whatever else you may need. Excellent location as it is walking distance to most of the major sites. If we ever return to Istanbul we would stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple & Lovely”
Reviews.Author: FairReview_10
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, close to all attractions and countless restaurants, good value for money. Very friendly staff, good breakfast, free wifi, small but very cosy rooms. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay very helpful staff, close to all attractions”
Reviews.Author: HolsRUSEngland
Reviews.Content: Fantastic value, free airport pickup (book direct with hotel), wonderful breakfast. Hotel close to Blue Mosque, Topkapi , Bosphorous cruise excursions. etc. Tram No 38 (stop around the corner) takes you to European Side go to Kabatas end of line then take funicular up to Taksim Square. Getting back to aiport take tram 38 to Zeytinburnu (other end of line) and link up with light railway all the way to airport only cost 3TL and in view of traffic jams you're sure to get there takes about 50mins from hotel. Will be returning to Hotel Sapphire no hesitation in recommending this hotel. Thank you to all the staff who were so helpful nothing was too much trouble for them.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: AUSTRALIATRAVELLER69
Reviews.Content: From the pickup at the airport to the greeting at the hotel - we felt very welcome. Yes the rooms were small - but spotless and quiet which was more important to us. The breakfast was a very big buffet, and the location was second to none. All in all we had a great stay and were very lucky to find this great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CarineGent_Belgium
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel in a prime location. A great extra is the indoor pool. The best feature of this place is the very friendly and helpfull people at the frontdesk. We even got presents when we left! A good price-quality rate. We recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding friendliness, location and facilities”
Reviews.Author: stepney
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights having originally booked for 4 and then getting caught up in all the flight disruption. The hotel is brilliantly located for all the major sites as they are within easy walking distance. It is also just a 10 minute walk from the main port and 5 minutes from the tram stop from where you can access other more distant parts of the city. Our double room was more than adequate in size and the hotel also has a small pool, sauna and turkish bath which are spotless and free to use. The breakfast is outstanding with hot food, a wide choice of salads, rolls, toast , cereals and fesh honey etc. The staff are brilliant. We needed prearranged access to some sites which they patiently and skilfully arranged for us and were very knowledgeable about the city. When caught up in our flight cancellation due to the volcanic eruption they were all so sympathetic and helpful. Engin, Deniz and Ali deserve special mention for their handling of the situation and always with a smile. We recommend this hotel highly and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, service, value and food.”
Reviews.Author: scamperoos
Reviews.Content: We visited in the wake of the flights ban & a number of "strandees" were still at he hotel. All were complimentry about the service they had received. Our experience echoed this. The level of service was outstanding. Ours was one of the first flights out after the flight ban was lifted & until the last minute we were unsure whether we would be able to go or not. The hotel kept in touch by e mail right up to flight time. From the moment we arrived the service was superb. The hotel has been renovated. It is modern, spotlessly clean and situated perfectly. As well as the "big 5" tourist sites being within 5 mins on foot, there is a convenient tram stop and the the ferry to the Asian side of the Bosphoros is again within 5 mins. We will definitely stay at The Sapphire again

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ankhsey
Reviews.Content: We three women went to Istanbul for a week, and this hotel made our holiday a real success. The hotel was comfortable and clean and all mod cons; the breakfast (included in the price) was sumptuous, and the fixed price dinner â‚¬10 was excellent value for money! Engin and his staff were friendly and helpful and nothing was a bother for them, and requests were quickly and efficiently dealt with. There were quite a few guests stuck there because of the flight chaos caused by Iceland's volcanic ash) and the staff went overboard to help arrange other travel as much as they could. The hotel is located right in the heart of the old city and all the main sites is just walking distance away. We couldn't have picked a better place to stay, and at the end of our week, we wished we could have stayed longer. next time I'm back in Istanbul, this is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best value hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Tracey R
Reviews.Content: We atayed at the Sapphire for four nights and were delighted with our choice. Location is ideal, in a pedestrianised street in the heart of the old city and two minutes walk from a tram stop. Our bedroom (no 215) was clean and well-equipped - even bathrobes were provided - and the beds extremely comfortable. It looked out onto a wall but this didn't bother us; it helped to keep it quiet and we slept extremely well. Breakfast buffet is extensive and included in the reasonable room rate (we paid 80 Euros per night via booking.com). The front desk staff, led by Ali, are fantastic - really friendly and helpful. At the end of our stay, we were stranded by the volcanic dust cloud from Iceland and, although the Sapphire was full, they found us another hotel nearby, took us to see the room and brought our luggage over when we decided to stay there. They even persuaded the new hotel to match the rate we had been paying. Just two small gripes - the lobby needs refurbishing and the roof terrace was closed, although they did offer to open it up briefly so that we could take photos of the view. Even so, we would definitely choose this hotel again. It offers excellent accommodation for the price, but it's the service that really makes the differenc.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect place to visit istanbul”
Reviews.Author: claudiaKiev
Reviews.Content: Very nice and helpful staff. very good breakfast with a lot of choices. Great location, walking distance to the most famous spots. Good to relax in the swimming pool after a busy day. Rooms are a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “BEST SERVICE EVER - Lamyaa Kl”
Reviews.Author: lamyaa_kl
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sapphire maybe a 4 star hotel but the staff gave a 100 Star service. Every need was met qukicly with no fuss and we were made to feel like we were family not guests. The hotel rooms are of decent size and are very clean. The buffet breakfast was amazing, and catered to everyones taste. The location of the hotel is ideal for those who want to visit the main attractions as everything is in walking distance. Will definatly be staying here again!!!!!!!! Lamyaa KL

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johanne_8
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Hotel Sapphire in Istanbul. The hotel is well situated in the sultanhamet area. 5 mins walk to the Blue Mosk, Topkapi palace and other important sites. The Grand bazzar and spice bazzar are about 15 mins walk . ideal situation. The hotel personnel is very nice helpful and polite. The hotel is situated on a pedestrian street so it is very quiet. The walls are a little bit thin but we can live with it. The breakfast is good and has a good selection. There is many good restaurants nearby. The only downside that I can find is that like many hotels, they do not turn on the air conditionned until late may and because the hotel is situated in a city we sleep the window close and the room may become very warm... I do not think that a good enough reason to go to Sapphire hotel. I do recommand that hotel for the price, the situation and the friendly atmosphere...

Reviews.Title: “Good location - great staff”
Reviews.Author: SherlockEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: loved this hotel in the old Sultanhamet region - 5 mins walk to Topkapi, Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque - staff were great and v. helpful. Clean and comfortable and the little pool and sauna are great to chill out in after a day on your feet

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly wonderful- again”
Reviews.Author: killemom
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel once before, and I was really curious if the good first impression was a coinsidence, or if this really was genuine good in all possible ways. It was!!! The staff is so helpful and serviceminded. I have never experienced something like it! The breakfast is great, rooms are small, but VERY nice and cosy. On a vacation like we had, we did not need more space anyway. You donÂ´t go to Istanbul to stay in your room... Thank you, espessially too Dennis and Selcuk, most kind staff ever :-) I look foreward to my nexy stay in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience.”
Reviews.Author: ONTHEBUMP
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in hundreds of hotels around the World-this must be one of the best due to the wonderful staff who really care, the first class faciities and the superb position of the hotel in relation to the "sights" of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Staff go out of their way to help you get the most out of your stay”
Reviews.Author: VVGough
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated for seeing the main sites of the city. In addition it is close to some excellent restaurants and bars. Breakfast choice is well presentaed and varied, catering for all tastes. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends who appreciate good service and an atmosphere that only exists in older areas of cities. Greta value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouthEastLondonDavid
Reviews.Content: My first solo trip and I was bit daunted, This hotel was well reviewed and reasonable priced so I booked mainly due to its location. I then got an email from them pointing out that their rooms were quite small and a bit of email traffic followed, mainly about the best way to get from Sabiha airport. When I arrived, they welcomed me with a little drink and showed me to my room, which I have to say I didn't think was small, but was very tidy, clean and perfectly comfortable and adequate. All the time, the staff was attentive but not over-bearing. They offered practical suggestions if requested and always had a smile. My only reservation, and of course it is nothing to do with them, is to avoid the restaurants near the hotel and they tried to over charge me.. A fabulous hotel in a brilliant location in a wonderful city.. Thank you...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sapphire exceeds expectation”
Reviews.Author: ChorleyD
Reviews.Content: A real gem of a hotel, suberbly situated within easy walking distance of the main attractions and ferries and surrounded by bars and restaurants. Perfect! This hotel provideseverything you need for an enjoyable stay........a huge choice at the breakfast buffet, clean rooms, a delightful lounge area complete with bar and fountain, a good sized pool, jacuzzi and sauna with the option of a Turkish bath after a hard day of sightseeing. Add to this the delightful friendly and helpful staff and you have found yourself a superb place to stay at tremendous value for money. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sapphire is excellent Istanbul tourist hotel from every aspect.”
Reviews.Author: pjmoorhouse
Reviews.Content: The staff are friendly and very helpful. The room was very clean and tidy. The continental breakfast was had enough choice to set you up for the day. The location of the hotel was such that most of the major tourist sites were in walking distance. If you wish to travel futher around Istanbul the ferry terminus and the efficient (and cheap) local tram system was also in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Your home away from home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Chyortnas
Reviews.Content: Super friendly, helpful staff, lovely room, pool, sauna, Turkish bath and more, a generous breakfast table, free transfer from the airport, a short walk to the key tourist sights, even a nice snack shop just next door where bottled water and munchies were available. Under the mountain of praise, only one small flaw (only heaven is perfect, right?), the toilet, while spotlessly clean, had a slight unpleasant odour. Well, that's nothing you say...you would be right. But with everything else pretty much everything you could expect, some of you might not believe how great a find/value this gem is if I didn't include at least one flaw. From arrival to departure (with gifts for us) we really felt like we had stayed with good friends...dare I say it? Almost like with family. A real home away from home. John Jason and grown-up design student daughter

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with great staff in great location”
Reviews.Author: ApontePR
Reviews.Content: I searched around for a bit to find an affordable hotel in Istanbul, only to end up choosing the Sapphire off of the TripAdvisor ratings and comments. It exceeded all of my expectations. The hotel is walking distance to everything, the people at the front desk were incredibly friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was delicious, and our overall stay was fantastic. We ended up going to Cairo afterwards and staying at a Novotel, only to keep on thinking how awesome the Sapphire was. Well done guys!!!

Reviews.Title: “Second time there, same good value as first time”
Reviews.Author: billabong97
Reviews.Content: Iâ€˜ve been in this hotel for the second time in the last two months, and I have found the same excellent level of service of the last time. All staff is very friendly and keen to help you whenever you need their help. Rooms are small but very clean and with good level of furniture and accessories. I didnâ€™t try yet the breakfast because I always take the first flight in the morning, but if you want they can prepare a box. A nice gift is given to all departing customers. Location is excellent, in a pedestrian road close to Aghia Sofia (10 min walk). Restaurants, bar and exchange booth all around the area. Only thing to check when you enter the room is the window closing: the second time wasnâ€™t perfect and inner yard noise wasnâ€™t filtered enough. Minibar items are reasonably priced compared to Hotel standards. Back again!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location in Sultanahmet. Friendly and helpful staff. Great value!”
Reviews.Author: robbiedigital
Reviews.Content: The location is just a 10 minute walk to the Hagia Sofia and other sights in Sultanahmet. It is located on a more quiet street with no car traffic so noise isn't much of an issue. The rooms are smaller than what you would get in a hotel in the new district but that is the norm in the old town. The rooms are clean with some modern touches. My room had new, tasteful furniture and a flat screen TV. It may vary room to room, though, like a lot of European hotels. The rooms are all non-smoking but the guest in the room next to us was a chainsmoker and non-stop talker. There was a vent in the closet that let all the smoke in his room circulate into ours The hotel staff were extremely helpful and moved us to another room. There is pool/jacuzzi, and sauna area 2 floors below the lobby and it is very relaxing after a long day of sightseeing. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to other travelers. Pro's: Ideal location Friendly and helpful staff, Ali was the staff member who helped us with everything. Low price. You get more than what you pay for in my opinion. Clean, comfortable rooms. Con's: The housekeeping staff can be a bit noisy, the closet for clean sheets is located on every floor and you can sometimes hear the closet doors open and close.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly hotel representing excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: morganmaadi
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Sapphire very comfortable and convenient. Location is excellent for major sights in Sultanahmet and the room was spotless and freshly-decorated. Enjoyed the lovely warm pool and found the free wireless internet access very useful. Good to have kettle and tea-making facilities. Rooms on the small side but perfectly adequate. The staff were unfailingly helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonLyncroft
Reviews.Content: Great location on the old side. Smallish room but as long as its clean and comfy which is was that's no problem. Don't spend too much time there anyway. Pool very warm, also a jacuzzi. Everyone very helpful. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Sapphire Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeDownton
Reviews.Content: The facilities, location, rooms and restaurant were all first class. But most of all the staff.from the manager, reception,waiters and waitresses and the ladies who cleaned our room each day, were without exception the very best we have come across in all our travels. The food was first class and plentiful. We both werea little concerned before we arrived, but Turkey, Istanbul and The Hotel changed our mind quickly. Everyone was so polite, friendly and happy,Istanbul is a wonderful city and the sapphire Hotel is amongst the best we ever stayed in. Thank You Turkey. and Thank you Sapphire.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Gombi63
Reviews.Content: The historical sights are within walking distance. The atmosphere of the hotel is very nice, modern and follows the local style at the same time. Wellnes area (sauna, swimming pool) also raises conveniences. Staff is helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel but not internet”
Reviews.Author: predino
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Sapphire for 6 days on January 2010. The location is really great but WARNING: DO NOT EAT ANYTHING in the old city.The people there are thefts. You can go to Taksim square where the service is really great. The rooms of Sapphire were amazing, the pool great after a tiring day and the staff was very warm. However the internet service was not existed. We had our own laptop but no connection available ( though they advertise free wi fi). Aster complains no answer was giver. Overall it was a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Fault It”
Reviews.Author: DeskSergeant
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay of 3 nights at the Hotel Sapphire. The staff were very welcoming, and couldn't have been more helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable, and the public areas were also very nice. The location was excellent - easy walking distance from the Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and other attractions of the Sultanahmet, the Galata Bridge, and bazaar areas, but away from the louder, more touristy streets. We found excellent restaurants locally, but the hotel reception staff were very helpful in suggesting good locations, too. Overall impression - a terrific find, and would certainly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and woderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Odnako
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - situated within walking distance from the main sights of the center of Istanbul and yet really quiet surroundings. Very friendly and helpful hotel staff. The rooms are nice and clean. There is absolutely nothing we would complain of - overall price/performance is just excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: seonad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located and has a great deal of character . It is spotlessly clean and the staff could not be more helpful or welcoming . From the greeting on arrival to until we left we were made to feel so welcome and we would defntiely go back again and recommend this place to anyone visiting Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value hotel in a fabulous city”
Reviews.Author: Ulsterwoman
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel just could not be beaten - a short walk to the spice bazaar in one direction and the Haghia Sophia/Blue Mosque/Topkapi Palace/Archeology Museum in the other. The tram stop was only around the corner too. The staff at reception (Ali especially) were welcoming, efficient and most helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable, and although renovations were going on in our corridor we were not inconvenienced, and they seemed to be progressing very quickly. Breakfast was good and when I requested fresh orange juice it was provided immediately. The internet access in the foyer was useful and when I needed help with a strange keyboard (qwerty but different) Ali sorted me out - the letter i was in a strange place and was replaced by a 1! The barman always offered me a cup of apple tea which was lovely - and there was a chatty parrot to talk to. The restaurant opposite, the Pasazade, was excellent; we ate there three times and were never disappointed. The smoked aubergine, lamb shish kebab and the baked halva... all yummy! I just wish that I had brought more turkish delight and baklava home with me.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: supacoo
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about our stay here. The car at the airport was great, even though our flight was delayed by more than three hours. No problems at all finding him, and he even took us on a little scenic drive on the way to the hotel even though it was midnight. The hotel front desk staff greeted us and gave us a complete low-down of what we needed to know - not just about the hotel but also about the city. The room was a little small but in good condition. Breakfast was gigantic, although a strange little assortment by US standards. Every time we left the building the front desk gave advice and information. The tram, Istanbul's public transportation line, runs about a block away, so the location can't be beat. All of the city is at your fingertips. And we loved the parrot in the lobby, too :) All in all, a very top-notch stay for the price. Hotel even has a Turkish bath in the basement that we didn't get to try out but it looked lovely!

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Kiz4
Reviews.Content: I've been a lot in Istanbul before and everytime i had another hotel. I Just came back from Istanbul again and wow, the hotel was perfect this time! The location is perfect, the staff is so friendly, the hotel is clean, the breakfast is nice. The pool, sauna and turkish bath are so nice and clean. Really this was the best hotel i've ever been to! Next time i go back to Istanbul (April 2010) i will get the same hotel! Greets, Steffi

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean , tidy and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: konatraveller
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms at this hotel during Feb. Very clean and tidy, with kettle and complimentary teas. There were even robes to use to go to the sauna. Bathrooms seemd to be fairly new. The walls are a little thin, one morning we were woken up by next doors small child laughing and running about, it wasnt to terrible but may have been annoying at an earlier hour of the morning. Breakfast was nice. Lots of choice and well stocked. Liked the way you just go in and sit anywhere, rather than wait for a table , sit down and then get up again to get your food! Fantastic location, 5-10 min walk to the main attractions and very close to the tram stop for places further away. Easy to use tram too. Lots of restaurants and bars nearby. Fantastic welcoming staff who were all very helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Girl_03000
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed at Hotel Sapphire and were pleasantly surprised by the service we received. Most of the hotel workers spoke English and all were available to answer questions, give site seeing suggestions, or just make us feel welcomed with pleasant conversations or complementary apple tea! Breakfast, the shuttle from the hotel, the pool/sauna, and internet were all included in the room rate, which was also an incredible value. The hotel is located in the center of the main attractions, including the Blue Mosque, Palace, Grand Bazaar, Spice Market, etc. If I make it back to Istanbul (I hope to soon), I will be sure to stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “I spend a fantastic week in your hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Peon1
Reviews.Content: Why... so... The weather was nice, place was beautiful and people were fantastic. The hotel there is near the most important buildings of Istanbul. The hotel service is very friendly. They always helped me, e.g. when I wanted to use sauna or swimming pool. Meal in your hotel was taste and variety. I had to admit that it was fantastic week.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff at reception”
Reviews.Author: LauraBucharest
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our time spent in Istanbul at Hotel Sapphire, located near all main attractions, with great breakfast and really helpfull staff at reception. Would recommend it anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a excellent stay in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: DebsenJope
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sapphire Hotel for 5 days, and enjoyed this very much. The hotel is comfortably situated on â€“ literally! - walking distance from all major tourist attractions, the tramway, yet it lies in a quiet street. The hotel itself is clean, well equipped and modern. But most of all we were struck by the warmth, service and always present attention and smiles of Deniz and his staff. Helpful with all questions and giving smart advice, he made our stay extra special. No question that this will be our hotel of choice when (not if, but when) we return to magnificent Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a fantastic location!!!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaMik
Reviews.Content: The best attribute of this hotel, by far, is the friendliness of the staff and the excellent service they provide. One member of staff in particular, named Ali, made our stay extremely comfortable and enjoyable. He was great in advising us on day trips and interesting parts of Istanbul to visit. Overall the â€˜Hotel Sapphireâ€™ is a lovely, well maintained hotel, in a fantastic location! Would definitely recommend. Emma & Mik

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: cpm19
