Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at the Hotel Sapphire. We chose it based on TripAdvisor reviews and were not disappointed. Very accurate reviews here about this hotel. The rooms are quite smaller than chain hotels, but it's manageable. Absolutely great location ... everything is either walking distance or public transportation is nearby. Just walk out and you're walking through streets full of stores & good restaurants. The staff is very helpful and attentive, service is with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: BostonBen
Reviews.Content: The service is the distinguishing point of the Hotel Sapphire (or Safir). The staff is extremely helpful from the moment you walk in and are handed your free welcome drink and Turkish Delight until the time you leave and are given your goodbye gifts. If you're staying 3 nights or more, they'll even get you at the airport for free. The location is also outstanding, a short walk to Topkapi Palace, the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque in the heart of the Old City. At the same time, the hotel neighborhood has nice little restaurants and cafes and is quiet late at night for sleeping. Early morning, however, the prayer calls are very loud, so you might be woken for a moment or two. The hotel facilities are generally nice, from the plush lobby to the pet parrot to the small indoor pool and spa. The rooms are fine, but small, and the single beds are small and not very comfortable. This is a great place for friendly staff and convenient service. If the size and comfort of your room is the most important factor for you, this might not be the right place.

Reviews.Title: “Totally deserves it's high ratings here!”
Reviews.Author: vickieseestheworld
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here in September 2009 for three nights before boarding a cruise ship. I seriously researched and took Trip Advisor's advice on this one - excellent choice. We booked ahead and arrived quite late at night, but were happily shown a couple of rooms before we made our choice. Clean, comfortable, modern updated bathroom and even though we were tired from a long travel day, because they knew it was our 30th wedding anniversary that day, there came a knock on the door and we were presented with a beautifully decorated whole cake! You don't get that kind of attention at most places. There was no way we could finish it all ourselves, so we took it down to the staff. To first hear the call to prayer before dawn the next morning was to be instantly immersed in the historical and exotic atmosphere of Istanbul. The pedestrian only street was loaded with restaurants with outdoor seating, lots of friendly Turks beckoning you in without being overbearing - just really friendly. Like your new best friend. And surprizingly, every one of them seems to have a friend in Canada! haha. Close to transit, but we walked everywhere to the historic sights of the area. Took a 1/2 day tour arranged through the front desk - great value and knowledgeable guide. Full Turkish style buffet breakfast included in our room price - certainly filled us up, despite some unusual items to choose from, but hey, it's Turkey. My hubby is a picky eater, but give him a few coldcuts and some cheese, plus a couple of pastries and he can survive. Visited the Turkish bath just around the corner - that was an experience!!! When we checked out, we were presented with a gift of Turkish tea and glasses to take home, as well as a box of Turkish delights! Would not hesitate to stay here again! Location Location Location - plus great caring staff and clean, comfortable rooms. Plus a bargain price. It doesn't get any better than that.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay at the same hotel when I visit again!”
Reviews.Author: DanyelRo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within walking distance from the main attractions in Sultanahmet area.The staff were very friendly and helpful.. Breakfast is excellent. Very nice hotel in a very convenient location. I would recomment it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, good room for the price.”
Reviews.Author: ThatGuy234
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for a good value a little bit away from super touristy Sukhanmet (but still very walkable to everything you want to see). Also right by a tram stop which makes it easy to see the other parts of the city. Room was small but nice (actually i thought the bed was very comfortable).

Reviews.Title: “The best choice for traveller!”
Reviews.Author: Zhannussi
Reviews.Content: Nice, good location, excellent staff, good price! I would be happy to stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to criticize with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: philFethiye_Turkey
Reviews.Content: From the time we were collected from the airport to the time we checked out we found nothing to criticize with this hotel. Ali and the staff were extremely helpful, the room was clean and the breakfast was very good. The hotel is positioned in the area of Sirkeci which meant that all the major sights were in short walking distance, if you wante to venture further afield the Tramway was only two minutes walk. After a long day out it was nice to come back to the heated pool and Sauna. If I return to Istanbul I would definately stay at this hotel and have already recommended it to friends. Phil and Pat, Fethiye, Turkey

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Staff, Great Location, Great Time”
Reviews.Author: WanderlusterLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were extremely welcoming, friendly and helpful. We only went for a long weekend but left wanting to stay for longer! The rooms were decent and very good value for the price we paid. We had twin beds and wanted a double but they had none free so they offered to move us to their sister hotel a couple of streets away but we decided not to go as we did not want to take the risk of the staff not being as good. We also wanted to use the spa facilties whilst there and they opened them up especially for us!! The location is excellent - close to all the major sights. We really enjoyed our time there and would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for Great Value, Great Staff, Great Location and a Great Time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet (Old Istanbul)”
Reviews.Author: rediamond
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Sultanahmet (Old Istanbul) in excellent position, at walking distance to all major attractions (Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Toptaki Palace, Grand Bazaar, etcâ€¦) and to the Eminonu harbor where cruises to the Bosphorus depart. The hotel is clean and nicely furnished, the staff kind and helpful and there's even a cute parrot saying hallo to you in the lobby! Our room was not that big but very clean and quiet, with a comfortable bed and satellite TV (that unfortunately did not work during our entire stay; we told the staff once but they did not fix it; anyway we did not care about that because we spent most of our time outside the room...). For breakfast there's a wide choice of food (local food, English breakfast and continental breakfast). There's also a free shuttle service from the airport to the hotel (for the return trip to Ataturk Airport we used the same service at the cost of 40 Turkish Lira) and a free (but slow) wi-fi connection. Guests can also relax in a fantastic swimming pool and sauna! Overall, an excellent value for money. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Worth recomandation”
Reviews.Author: irek1977
Reviews.Content: I have given Very Good instead of Excellent as we had 1st floor room which had some noisy water running in the pipe every time the toilet flush on any floor in the riser. However, could stand it and at night was not that bad. Hotel itself is great, location 5 min walk from main atractions, close to ferry/tram. Staf very kind and helpful. The swimming pool is very useful for lesuire time after all day long trips. I will recomend this hotel to anyone who is looking for Istanbul brake.

Reviews.Title: “All the staff in this hotel is friendly and warm hearted”
Reviews.Author: oscarchen
Reviews.Content: The hotel located in a small beautiful street, you can find some local food restaurants, stores, art gallery or sheesha just by going out of the door. The hotel also very nears the palace, cathedral and blue mosque. All the staff here can give you any help they can do and also the detail introduction. I love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for your upcoming Istanbul trip!”
Reviews.Author: osmaan86
Reviews.Content: Look no further. My friends and I (4 guys total, all of us in our 20's) stayed at Hotel Sapphire (or "Safir" in Turkish) this past week during our Thanksgiving break. I couldn't have asked for a better hotel! The location is perfect. It's situated in an area that gives you a good feel of what the narrow streets of Sultanahmet have to offer. Walking distance to everything. In two minutes, you're at the tram (bus/train fusion transportation system). In 10 minutes, you'll reach places like Ayasofya, Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque. Walking in the opposite direction, and also in 10 minutes, you'll find yourself in front of the impressive Yeni Camii (New Mosque) and Eminonu ferry port. The rooms are smaller than what you are used to, but any quick search will tell you that hotel rooms in Sultanahmet are generally on the smaller side to begin with. As small as they may be, you can't help but be impressed at the ornate, traditional Ottoman designs that adorn the ceilings and walls. Very cozy. To top things off, you'll be greeted at the airport with a driver to pick you up and take you to the hotel! This was a great help. They don't drive you back to the airport, but they do offer a van for 40 liras (no matter how many people are in your group). After you make your hotel reservation, the friendly manager (Engin) will send you an e-mail collecting your flight information so that a driver can be waiting for you. I'm telling you, the staff takes good care of you here! More on the helpful staff. One of my friend's power adapter/converter fused out, so the staff lent us two. They gave plenty of suggestions on where to go (even though we'd done our research). We went during Bayram (Eid al Adha) - a huge Muslim holiday (3-4 days long in Turkey); the staff gave us great tips on what to see and what crowd control would be like during our stay. They also offered to mail all of my postcards so that I could save a trip to the local post office. Another big plus was their free wifi and free breakfast!!! I booked directly from this website (I believe I ended up making the final purchase from booking.com), and I recommend you do the same!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzbond
Reviews.Content: This hotel is adequate but was below my expectations from what I read in the reviews. The breakfast was fine and the staff was friendly. Other than that, the lobby looked like an overstuffed furniture shop with little charm. The jacuzzi was cold (being part of the pool) but the sauna was great. We reserved our room for 7 nights. The room was dark and noisy with screaming seagulls outside the window. After 4 nights I asked if we could move to a higher floor and our sleep improved. The location is convenient to the historical part of the city which was good for the first few days. As we explored the city, we liked the Beygolu section better because it was livelier at night and more interesting shops. Also, the staff was helpful with the more commercial activities but didn't have any suggestions about other areas to visit. The hotel was functional but had little charm except for the parrot in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK - but think it's overrated”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi8888
Reviews.Content: The place was nice and clean. It's in a very touristy area and it does get a high ranking in Trip Adviser probably because they do give you small gifts at the end and tell people to log in and rate the hotel. Be careful with the airport transfers. They are only free if you stay 3 nights or more which is fine but you should be told. Also if you get an airport pick up it costs 20 Euro but when you want a transfer to the airport it's 40 TLira. Not a huge difference but it's annoying when you know they're playing with exchange rates to get an extra bit out of you if it was one of the other I would have been happy to pay but just to get an extra 4 Lira... come on guys! Also we were told that getting a taxi to the airport would be 50+ TL but later found out it was about 30 TL so we shouldn't have booked through the hotel. The room we got was tiny and we stayed in a comparable hotel very close to this one and the room was way bigger and much brighter and it was the same price. Other than that, the staff were effecient. The place was clean and when we left they were very friendly but believe it was linked to ensuring we gave a good review. We had other friends stay there and use the pool and sauna... apparently you should make time to check it out - this could have made our stay more enjoyable. If you're only staying for a short stay the place is fine but just a couple of little things bugged me.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: boruthedog
Reviews.Content: absolutely superb service - probably the most friendly hotel I have stayed in anywhere in the world - great location, great value - would thoroughly recommend to anyone who wants to visit this great city

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: FlyingHorses
Reviews.Content: Everything you would expect from a hotel: friendly staff, excellent selection of food for breakfast, clean and nicely presented rooms, centrally located, good facilities. The website doesn't do the hotel credit (I've already mentioned) this. We were presented with turkish delight and a drink on arrival, plus gifts on our departure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnMacclesfield
Reviews.Content: Good location and very friendly and helpful staff. The free transfer from the airport was a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND WONDERFUL PEOPLE”
Reviews.Author: LynLibertyville_IL
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly, helpful, and attentive. Any requests were handled immediately and efficiently.. The hotel is in a GREAT central location with all the major sites within an easy walking distance. It is also just a block away from the tram and very close to the Galata Bridge. It is on a pedestrian walkway with many restaurants right outside the door. There was an extensive breakfast and the food was fresh and nicely presented. The rooms were small but clean and the beds comfortable. The transfer to the airport was organized and handled efficiently. We could not have asked for anything more. Our only wish was that we could have stayed a little longer. We enjoyed having an extended conversation with Eng and learned about his family, country, and culture. Everyone was warm and welcoming. It was almost like leaving family. Istanbul is a wonderful city, we loved it! For the $$$ it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location helpful and friendly service are the hallmarks of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: QCBloom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally situated in the Old City and near the main tourist attractions. There is also an efficient regular tramline nearby. Restaurants abound in the vicinity so be prepared to be hassled for business by the managers as you run the gauntlet to and from the hotel. The rooms are fairly small but represent excellent value for the price. We would recommend that you pay the extra for the premium rooms which are well appointed and have very comfortable beds. The staff arte at all times helpful froendly and courteous.. The breakfast is is substantial and served buffet style.

Reviews.Title: “A good central hotel excellent for women on their own”
Reviews.Author: gillgm
Reviews.Content: It was good value, the breakfast buffet was extensive and fairly good. The rooms with tea making kit were excellent. Bathrooms worked. Going out alone at night to eat was not a problem as several restaurants were in the pedestrian road outside the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaBooklady
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a two-night stay at the Sapphire, following a two-week Insight tour of Turkey. We were cautioned ahead by Sapphire management that this was not the Hilton and that the rooms were considerably smaller. (We actually moved from the Conrad to experience the historic district for our final nights in IST. We knew that we were booking a tourist/boutique hotel rather than the Hilton luxury brand which we stayed in on many nights of our tour.) On arrival at 10AM, we were given a welcome drink and shown our room early; we were also shown another room with a different layout, which would be ready a bit later on, if we desired it. My husband settled on the first room since it was already available; we were quite comfortable and cozy throughout our stay. The rooms are small but everything was there that we needed at night...we were out and about by day. Breakfast was very nice and much more than expected as far as variety and quantity. There are good restaurants/sidewalk cafes on the same small pedestian street where the hotel is situated. The hotel is close to the major sites and we either walked or took the tram everywhere. The desk staff gave very helpful directions, called cabs, etc. When it was time to leave, a transfer was organized and appeared right on time in the early AM to take us to Ataturk Airport. We could not have asked anything more from our stay....very pleasant, gracious hosts and we actually found this to be the case throughout Turkey. We would definitely return to IST and the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Top service in nice interior”
Reviews.Author: HappyknitterSkien
Reviews.Content: We had a warm wellcome at the hotel after, for us , a long night and were very happy to be met at the airport by the pick-up service. Kindly we got a room imediately so we could rest a little before desireing what to do. It is nice to be met so friendly when two ladies are travelling alone in a, for us, a new country. The room was little, but nice, and we only used it for resting now and then, we were also very comfortable in the lobby. We stayed for 3 nights and got all the help we needed.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT”
Reviews.Author: glenaskin
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful city Istanbul. This hotel is perfect for a city break. Staff are most helpful & accommodating, sorted out airport pick-ups for us. Hotel street is pedestrionised & tram stop just a street away. Within walking distance to most sights, pool & sauna included. Would not hesitate to use this hotel again. Thank you to all the staff for making our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful and clean hotel with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: JDJDNewbury
Reviews.Content: Had to change travel arrangements due to my husband not being able to come with us and was met with a no problem attitude upon arrival at this hotel. Nothing was too much trouble and they changed our room to a double from a triple reducing our costs significantly without asking. The rooms are small but clean , neat and with all mod cons and they dont try to hide the size so thats fair. The location is great, quiet and near all main sites. Plenty of restaurants in near vicinity (dont ignore the handsome guy outside the hotel, the food is really pretty good there). Lovely staff always service with a smile. Would definately go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loxley55
Reviews.Content: Complimentary pick-up from airport was perfect start. At the hotel, the staff were always very friendly and helpful, and when we arrived, one of them took the trouble to show us a map, tell us which sights were open on which days, and advise us about public transport. The room was on the small side but fine, since we were out sightseeing for most of the day. Beds comfortable, although the sheets and towels were getting to the stage where they needed replacing. The room was quiet, despite overlooking the (traffic-free) street. There was an extensive breakfast buffet which worked well. The location is perfect for getting around the city on foot. One of the very efficient tram lines runs very close by. Any requests during our stay were instantly and efficiently dealt with. We would certainly recommend this hotel to our friends - in fact, that's how we discovered it in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, brilliant location and very friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: LightkeeperU
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Sapphire in October 2009 with two friends - all of us female and all over 60. We had three single rooms. It is in an extremely good position - near to a tram stop at Gulhane and within easy walking distance of both the Old City and the Galata Bridge. The staff are very friendly and helpful, especially Ali and Deniz who were at the reception desk to welcome us when we arrived. I lost my e-ticket for the return flight and they immediately offered to let me use the manager's computer and print a new one off. (There is a computer in the lobby for the use of guests but it has no printer.) One of my friends left her glasses in the taxi to the Chora Church (which the hotel had ordered, at our request) and when Reception was contacted, they immediately phoned the taxi company and the glasses were delivered to the hotel very quickly. All very efficient - we were not made to feel we were being a nuisance. The rooms are fine - not the Ritz but comforatable, clean and with double glazing, air conditioning and tea and coffee making facilities. Mine - at the front on the second floor - was rather noisy on the first night (jollity from nearby restaurants as it was a warm evening and people were eating and drinking outside, then I think the bins being collected). The next morning I asked for a room higher up and at the back of the hotel and was allocated one with no fuss. Just two small niggles - the pillows were very hard and there was no plug for the bath. To be fair, I didn't mention the pillows (made do with a cushion, which was fine) and they produced a plug when I asked. The breakfast is really good - lots of choice and all nice and fresh. One tip - the Turquoise restaurant right outside the hotel is really good - we only discovered it on our last two nights! Good food (a cut above the usual kebabs) and friendly service and once they get to know you you can get a good deal on a bottle of wine. A warning - one of my friends was the subject of a scam at the ATMs in Sultanahmet, between Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque (just round the corner from the underground sistern). A Turkish guy told her the ATM she was about to use was broken and she could use the one he'd just been at. He'd obviously doctored it as her card would not go in properly. He pretended to help her and said the only way she could either get money out or her card back was to put in her pin number. Despite covering the pad with her guide book, he obviously read the pin number and then miraculously the card was 'eaten up' and he disappeared into the crowds. Of course, he had taken the card. She rang her bank very quickly on the lost cards number but he had already taken out money and ordered several things off the internet in the first ten minutes. The staff at the Sapphire were very sympathetic but had obviously heard the tale before. Better to get money from the ATMs that are in banks or outside banks and not in crowded areas, preferably with someone you know behind you and looking out for trouble. Apart from this, our week in Istanbul was amazing and the Sapphire was perfect. While we were in the city, we did check out various other similar hotels to find out their prices and the Sapphire was the best value by far.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly positioned, quiet, very enjoyable, recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Amazon-61
Reviews.Content: Perfectly and centrally position hotel with no traffic bearing road directly outside on any side, so nice and quiet. Staff were very good, friendly, helpful and approachable. Rooms are a bit on the small side but considering most of us are there to get out and sightsee this really does not matter. However they are clean, nicely furnished and comfortable. The only critisism is I found the bed and pillows a little firm. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced - Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: brionnotbrian
Reviews.Content: Good points - staff very friendly and great location in the old town. Bad points - Tiny rooms even the superior ones. Sheets were dirty and the previous occupant had left clothes in the room that hadnt be cleaned up. Towels were dirty also. We asked for a double bed but got a twin room. Breakfast was bland and in a basement. The style of the hotel is dark and horrible. Some older couples may like(I mean plus 60) but otherwise avoid. If they halfed the price it wouldnt be bad for it is far too expensive for what it is. Upon booking you get an email from the hotel telling you that their rooms arent that big as other hotels because they are in the old town. And when leaving they give you a present which is nice if a little tacky. When I checked my emails the next day after getting home I found an email from the hotel asking me to give them the best review possible, etc. I work in the online travel industry and this is a completely unacceptable thing for the hotel to do.

Reviews.Title: “My fevorite hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: nomadeKrakow
Reviews.Content: I appraciate the hospitality of hotel staff! Perfect location in the heart of Istanbul, nice atmosphere, clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “Good value - Nice clean hotel in a great area of town on a lovely street with a nice staff”
Reviews.Author: cerininy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and a great value for what we paid. The staff was helpful and friendly, There was a pool, spa, business center and extensive complimentary breakfast. The rooms were on the small side and the bed a bit stiff but was ok and clean. The bathroom too was a little small. Overall we were very happy with the hotel and loved the street it was on which was walking distance to most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobertoEastSussex
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights in this charming Hotel. The manager and staff could not have been more helpful, and our room was very comfortable and well equipped. The inclusive breakfast was also excellent. The Hotel is perfectly located for the major attractions in the city. Value for money, The Sapphire would be very hard to beat. Robin Howden

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Ariadna_Bag
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Friendy and helpful staff. I strongly recommend this hotel. Perfect balance in price and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: CoHoToronto
Reviews.Content: My partner and I only stayed in this hotel for one night on our way back home, but we were thoroughly satisfied with the staff, the room and the location! Very clean room with helpful staff available at all times, and a great breakfast as well. Walking distance to Galata bridge and Sultanahmet. Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TatianaAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: The location is really great. The hotel is ok, not a 4 star but a small, clean 3 star hotel. The staff was nice, breakfast ok.

Reviews.Title: “The World is a book, and those who do not travel read only a page”
Reviews.Author: Destiny_Au
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Sopphire for three days. Nothing could compare with the spotless accommodations, fabulous food, and congenial hosts. The rooms were perfect and included spectacular views of the old buildings. Breakfast was an experience not to be missed. Fresh fruits, Turkish tea,scones, breads and breakfasts to order were too wonderful to describe. I was welcomed by the Engin and his staff who were most helpful in every aspect of my stay, from recommendations for restaurants, pubs, places to see and even driving directions. The location was perfect as it was central to all the venues and attractions. I can't imagine that there could possibly be a finer place to stay than Hotel Sopphire

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamRob
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are excellent. The service was friendly, helpful and professional at all times. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble for them. The room, although, slightly small was very comfortable (and you don't visit Istanbul to stay in a hotel room). In terms of location, I couldn't imagine a better position. The major attractions are really only a walk away. A very enjoyable experience in a very interesting city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and kind, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: iskandar339
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, in a pedestrain street only few minutes walk from Hayasofya, Topkapi Museum and from the Golden Horn. The hotel is nice, with tasty furniture and all comforts, including dining room, swimming pool and sauna. The staff is very kind and do all that they can to make your stay likeable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: DublinLismorelass
Reviews.Content: The service that we received from the moment that we entered the lobby until we left 5 days later was superb. The staff were so friendly, kind and thoughtful. It was my husband's birthday and they came to the room with a lovely cake with candles on - such a lovely idea! This was compliments of the hotel and I hope that they would continue to keep these personalised gestures. whilst we were informed before booking that the rooms were small because of the location of the hotel in the old town, they were certainly adequate, even for 5 days. The buffet breakfast was good, the leisure facilities also. They had a pool, turkish bath and jacuzzi which my husband and two adult daughters used. The location of the hotel is wonderful in that it is near all sights and restaurants, and the use of the internet free was an added bonus. The only negative has nothing to do with the hotel itself, but the restaurant owners outside were too pushy for our liking - I know different cultures demand different things but they could be off-putting! Full marks to the hotel for its facilities and excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, friendly staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_in_Madrid20
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend for three nights in September 2009. We found the place very clean and the room, although a bit small, totally comfortable and well equiped. The breakfast buffet is nice and varied and the hotel is really conveniently located at walking distance from the biggest touristic attractions but also in a really touristy area. The decoration is a little bit over the top and too much for my own taste but some might find it beautiful. I think that it was good value for Istanbul but if you are looking for a more Turkish experience I would recommend staying in the Beyoglu neighbourhood closer to the good nightlife and the good restaurants. At least this is were I'll stay next time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: susanJerusalem
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with the hotel which is within walking distance from all the major sites. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and the breakfast was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great price !”
Reviews.Author: waltergiacomo
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is lovely with a great foyer lounge area including a charming parrot that keeps everyone amused. There is a free internet terminal (and wireless). The hotel is clean and the breakfasts are great. The reception staff - Deniz in particular - are wonderful - always friendly and helpful - their advice was spot on. My son and I enjoyed a daily sauna and swim in the pool to relax after a day's touring. The hotel is well placed equidistant (10 min walk ) to the Grand bazaar, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Spice Bazaar, the bridge and ferry. Topkapi palace was a few minutes walk. There are plenty of restaurants around for those not wanting to venture far for meals. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: GermanicusBerlin
Reviews.Content: The Sapphire is a welcoming hotel and has a pleasant atmosphere. Reception staff were helpful and on the whole, friendly. The rooms are a perfectly adequate size and are comfortable, although the walls are a bit thin. My room looked out onto a building site - but it wasn't too noisy. My partner's room had rather a strangely organised bathroom - but it was OK. The location is a real plus point - in a traffic-free street, although a bit lively at times from all the restaurants. Most of the major tourist sites are within 10 minutes walk and the very useful and efficient trams are only 2 minutes away. We were collected from the airport, which is good when you arrive in Istanbul for the first time - but the return journey on our steam was equally easy - and cheap! I used the swimming pool a couple of times - another plus point. The breakfast buffet is quite large and tasty. I would certainly stay here again and hope that next time the roof restaurant is open - the views are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the middle of the old city section of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: iconpyro
Reviews.Content: 1) They were very friendly at arrival. They provided us with Turkish Delights and a glass of orange juice. 2) The receptionist spoke good english, and could explain to us each of the areas of where the tourist mostly visit. He offered up us tour groups that visited specific areas of Istanbul. 3) The location was EXCELLENT. A five minute walk to Aya Sophia/Basilica Cistern/Blue Mosque. It is also 2 minutes walk from the Light Rail System. This is great if you want to visit the other side of Istanbul. We took it after our second day to see the Beyoglu and Besiktas areas in which fewer tourists go (but the food is way better). The Grand Bazaar and Sulimanye Mosques are also relatively close, about 15 minutes (but Sulimanye is under major construction). 4) They picked us up from the airport which was very nice. Though we had to pay for the trip to the airport for departure, which was 45 Turkish Lira, which is about 30 dollars, I still consider this a deal since they picked us up for free! 5) They were always attentive, when I asked some questions in English and they could not understand, they would get someone to answer my questions. 6) Several times we asked for extra bars of soap/towels/shampoo, and we were quickly taken care of. 7) Breakfast is included and consists of breads, meats, juice, fruits, and cereal. 8) The rooms are a little bit smaller, but we were warned of this, its equivalent to a larger room in NYC hotels (which are smaller and cost a LOT more). AC worked fine and there are safes provided in the room, along with a minibar. My girlfriend who accompanied me, loved this hotel - mostly because of the service they provide. I loved the location and thought it was a great deal for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price.”
Reviews.Author: Catherine010
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay in Istanbul's old city and our best hotel. While the rooms are small they are clean and everything works. This hotel is great value at 69 Euro a night and free taxi from the airport because we stayed 3 nights. Also the wireless internet is free - great. The fruit and vegies at breakfast are not top quality - but fine.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely delightful”
Reviews.Author: carolnz7
Reviews.Content: We totally loved Hotel Sapphire. From the minute we arrived (complimentary cocktail and turkish delight), to the delightful, Ottoman decorated room (smallish, but had everything we needed). The location couldn't be better - Topkapi Palace, 5 minute walk, everything else just another couple of minutes. We walked everywhere. Heaps of restaurants in the same street (great that it was a pedestrian street, no cars). The views at night from their rooftop terrace were incredible - of the Bosphorus, the mosques with the minarets lit up. It was absolutely brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “the best chice for sightseeing tour”
Reviews.Author: aldaMoscow
Reviews.Content: very good location and excellent service. Rooms is small but very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “It's a GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: cruzedro
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times in this hotel, it's like a second home for me. They have friendly staff, nice & clean Hotel.It's located central so you can walk to the most recommended places. So mine opinion about this hotel is super.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: family_travellor
Reviews.Content: This is a good quality hotel in a fabulous location. As other reviews make clear, the rooms are smallish. this isn't a problem as there is ample space in the downstairs lounges etc. The free airport pick up is a bonus and great help. Breakfast was good, lots of choice. Service was helpful though not all the staff talk English. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mayka55a
Reviews.Content: I loved Istanbul and loved to be in this hotel. The staff is nice, friendly and did everything to make our stay more comfortable and happy as possible. The location is very,very good,and near the main historical places (around 10 minutes walking). IÂ´ve been there with my daughter (20 y.o.), for the last 5 days of a 40 days travel through Europe; it was awesome!!! I recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Careful of the reviews - they are emailing people asking them to rate them well”
Reviews.Author: Yam52
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the great reviews. But then as I left the hotel I was emailed by them asking me to rate them well (as they were in a "race" with other hotels) ... to be honest this hotel was just ok - but certainly doesn't deserve the top spot on trip advisor. If people are coming on here to "help" them well ... the reviews aren't really accurate are they? The goods... - Friendly hotel staff - Great location - Great breakfast The bads ... - Waited for an hour or so after we arrived at Istanbul airport before we were taken to our hotel. No explanation as to why - Bed sheets were scratchy and uncomfortable. Mine were stained. - Room furnishings were tacky so it made it feel unclean. - Tv wasn't working properly - blurred and didn't show some colours. I know this doesn't really matter for holidays - but if you are going to offer a tv ... - The toilet smelt funny.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, just not sure if it deserves being nr 2 of all in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: mostad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good hotel for the price, i payed appr 40â‚¬. It is very close to everything, so the location is grate. The staff is friendly and speak fairly well english! Breakfast is ok, not the best, but ok. Rooms are very small, but seems to be clean! It is quite close to a mosque so you will wake up to prayers at 5 in the morning ;) hehe. I would recommend this hotel if you are on vacation and want to sights around Istanbul. And tell the parrot at the front desk i said "hi", we got to be good friends. ;)

Reviews.Title: “The best holiday ever in Hotel Sapphire, Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Hermiona_Granger
Reviews.Content: We spent our holiday in Hotel Sapphire, Istanbul. It's a charming place right in the heart of historic Istanbul, situated in a walking-distance from all the known historic monuments as Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace or Grand Bazaar. The staff is very very kind and friendly. Rooms are rather not so big, but very comfortable and cosy furnished. Wireless internet connection is available free of charge and is infallible. There is also a swimming pool with jacuzzi and sauna. Breakfast are very varied, so everybody can choose. And - not to forget - there is a cute and very talkative African Grey Parrot called "Jano" (which means "My Love") in the lobby :-) ABSOLUTELY RECOMMENDED!!! Wonderful place for spending holiday in Istanbul!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Babz20
Reviews.Content: This place was great. Friendly staff, nice clean room and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, although there are some "buts"...”
Reviews.Author: CanarioViajero
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good located, on a side street and very close to the tourist major attractions (Topkapi Palace is right next door, Santa Sofia is 5 min wal away, etc.). However, the area where the hotel is located is very, very touristy (in fact, the street where the hotel is is crowded with restaurants and shops for tourists only). One really positive thing about the hotel is that they organize a free transfer (one way only) from the airport to the hotel. Therefore, you need to forget about wandering around the city and trying to find the hotel, or feeling that you are ripped off by some weird taxi driver. The main hall of the hotel is a bit disappointing and dull, and the rooms are quite small. Take into account that there are two types of rooms: (a) superior rooms; and (b) normal rooms. Take the superior rooms, as they have free coffee making facilities. Breakfast is very Turkish, with olives (!) and plenty of Turkish delicacies. However, breakfast is served in the basement, and this is a bit disappointing. The service at the reception desk is just ok. We felt as we were not really welcome at the hotel, and, for example, when we asked whether we could get suggestions for a "non-tourist" restaurant, we were looked at as we were crazy. In general, the reception workers seemed not to want to spend a whole lot of time with us and answering our questions. One really bad thing is that you have to pay for the maps of the city, and only the very small map the hotel provides you with (with some blocks of the area where the hotel is located) is free. Finally, and something which absolutely suprised us, was that the reception workers tried to "bribe" us giving us, at check-out, some boxes Turkish delights (is a kind of Turkish sweets) to take home and requesting to write a good review of the hotel (both at Tripadvisor and at w------------m, where we made the reservation). This was really surprising and not a very "ethic" way of obtaining positive reviews at Tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming stay in a ideal location”
Reviews.Author: brisou
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation on the strength of the TA reviews and was not disappointed. The hotel met all my expectations and more, especially the wonderfully welcoming staff. Prior to my stay, the on-line booking manager reached out to me in a couple of emails to confirm my stay and also to offer his assistance in answering any questions. Upon my arrival after an exhaustive all-night bus ride, the front desk welcomed me with open arms. When they learned that I was a first-time visitor, they presented me with an evil eye bead. They then invited me to breakfast while they readied my room. It was a nice welcome. Now the nuts and bolts: the room itself was very comfortable, clean, and quiet; the breakfast was ample and readily replenished by the staff; the wireless connection was fast and readily accessible in the lobby, breakfast room, and my room; and the location was excellent and convenient for short strolls to all sights in the old town. I have no complaints about my stay at the Sapphire. I've stayed in much more expensive hotels that didn't come close to the attentiveness and welcoming attitude of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: RossandLizAUS
Reviews.Content: small but well appointed rooms (ask for renovated room), fantastic and friendly staff on front desk, good breakfast (variety), great location in old city - no more than 10 mins walk to main sights, good cafes/bars nearby, a very lucky find

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, friendliness, professionalism”
Reviews.Author: cattermole
Reviews.Content: A superb central location though quiet at night and well air-conditioned. Deniz, the Reception Manager was particularly helpful with everything requested. Very close also, to a good selection of restaurants serving local ethnic specialities. I'd thoroughly reommend Hotel Sapphire to everybody - top marks to Mr Evsen, the Proprietor and his team. (Basement swimming pool and sauna a bonus !!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellency with proffesionalism”
Reviews.Author: Hassonty
Reviews.Content: The area of the sapphire Hotel is very nice and safe, the hotel persanals are very frindly and allways meet you with a nice smile. the hotel food is very good, despite the languhe barier of some hotel staff we were understanding each other .The hotel is very close to many of sight seeing areas and old bazars . we recommended to any one

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at an excellent price”
Reviews.Author: IWIWW
Reviews.Content: My family-3x 16 year olds and my wife and I stayed here for 4 nights. Points of excellence: - perfectly situated for the major sites, - very helpful reception staff - excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCouple007
Reviews.Content: We like to stay at a hotel that is in an excellent location, is clean, friendly, and a great value. We thought that Hotel Sapphire was perfect. Rooms/bathrooms were nice. Good breakfast. For an inexpensive hotel in a big city - it was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean and super helpful staffed hotel.”
Reviews.Author: travelling_koala
Reviews.Content: Attentive and helpful from the beginning up until the end of our stay, we were taken very good care of by the Sapphire Hotel staff. The room was very nice and clean. The beds very comfortable. Close to most of the top ten sights to "see", and very close to the tramway, I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Istanbul. Jano (the talented parrot) will keep you entertained as you check your emails in the lobby :) Please say hello to Murat and Deniz for us!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Roro-de-Bab
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel with relatively well spaced rooms (compared to other hotels in the same area). Clean rooms and bathrooms. Some minor problems: TV English and French channels did not function, a cheap and not toasted breakfast with a horrible fruit juice. Fortunatly, the service is perfect with a special mention to M. Harun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to Enjoy Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: CPA52
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights pre cruise departure. We arrived at hotel via the complimentary airport shuttle at 8.30am after our flight had been delayed and were able to check into our room. During our stay all staff were friendly and helpful with suggestions on places to eating and what to see while in Istanbul.Breakfast was very good with a wide choice of food. Location is great as you are able to walk everywhere. Plenty of restaurants along the strip. We can recommend Turquoise Pub/ Restaurant directly across from the entrance for excellent food and service. We would stay again at Sapphire when next in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly service. Very good value”
Reviews.Author: trvellingpigeon
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided to stay there on the strength of the reviews we read in tripadvisor. We were welcomed with a cool drink with after a long journey was much appreciated. The twin room was small but perfectly adequate, clean, with plenty of light and so was the shower room. There was a basket with sachets for making tea/coffee also very welcomed. However we had to ask for more the next day as the basket had not been replenished. Breakfast was varied to cater for different tastes, it would have been nice to have some fresh fruit. Everybody was pleasant and generous with their time. When we booked we noticed that we could ask to be collected from the airport which they did but we had to wait a little while for the driver to find us at the airport and then then drive us back. Overall we had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TatjanaE
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel very nice and stylish! Beds were really comfortable. Top quality. Everything is new and nicely decorated with taste. I bought as souvenirs many things I saw in the hotel :) The staff was very gentle. They did all to make us feel comfortable. We had a 3 beds room which was quite large. There was no large views from the window but the location of the hotel is great. On one side you can walk to all main sites of the old town (like Haya Sophia and the Blue Mosque) on the other you can catch a very nice tram just from the street in front. The sea is also very close (walking distance) as well as Kapali Charsi which is the Grand Bazar and Spice Bazar. I recommend people to go a bit arround the area in the first day to get to know it and find very nice places to visit and where to eat. All in all: Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and excellent location, service with a smile !”
Reviews.Author: LJB1958
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family at the Sapphire in May 09 for a long weekend. Started with free shuttle service, very convenient and fast way of getting into the old Istanbul. Friendly and helpfull staff, good room for 3 persons. Excellent location allowing you to reach all major attractions by foot, adding to the intensity of the Istanbul experience. Also advisable is walk over to ferry to Asian side and crossing the Golden Horn to go shopping at the other side, direction Taksim, enough to do ! Hotel features nice breakfast buffet with good variety and nice mix of east/west flavors. Nice extra is the swimming pool (indoor) with sauna. Would recommend and will stay again when coming to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great value great service and great location”
Reviews.Author: TexasMagyar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. Located close to major attractions and close to the metro line for places farther out. It is a very quaint, clean, and roomy hotel. The hotel staff are available at all hours to help with all kinds of advice and recommendations. And all this for a very fair price.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Alcron
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Istanbul, was made memorable by our stay at Hotel Sapphire. We stayed 4 nights at Hotel Sapphire and received the complimentary airport shuttle which took all the pressure off our arrival after a very long flight from Australia. (36 hrs). Although we arrived at 8am we were warmly welcomed and accommodated immediaitely. The staff were friendly and helpful. Fantastic location, We were able to walk everywhere, and if needed the tram was very close. Our room was a little small but comfortable, bathroom large with great shower, everything was spotlessly clean. Tea and Coffee making in room, air conditioning and fridge. There was an indoor heated pool and breakfast was traditional, although sometimes I was unsure of what I was eating. We would definantely stay their again and recommend it to everyone. It was great receiving a little gift of sweets and tea on our departure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and service with very nice location”
Reviews.Author: Heidituulia
Reviews.Content: There is a good atmosphere in this hotel, very good service and exremely nice staff. Breakfast buffet was very tasteful. Room was clean, very well equipped and air conditioned. There was surtainly enough space for one person. Location of hotel is perfect, all historical sights on walking distance. Hotel is surrounded by nice little restaurants, lovely people and whole neighbourhood is very peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in the old city of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: 7mary4
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on travel via govoyage.com. Airfare and hotel from Paris for less than 400 euros for 5 days and 4 nights. I went to travelocity to choose the hotel and this one sounded great. It certainly did not dissapoint. The location, service, and ambiance were wonderful. I would certainly return. Its not far from the metro or train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Geologist_9
Reviews.Content: The minute I arrived at the Hotel Sapphire the staff was friendly and very helpful. The hotel is located near the ferries, Spice Market, Blue Mosque etc. The hotel is on a street that is closed to automobile traffic and is very quiet. The rooms and the entire hotel is very clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that is going to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Juliadrusilla
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Sapphire for three nights. The room was not very large, but clean and well equipped (airco, possibility to make tea or coffee) with a large bathroom with bath and shower. The location is perfect for visiting all important sights (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia etc.) but also only a 10 minute walk from the quayside at EminÃ¶nu where all the ferries leave (a trip on the Bosporus is an absolute must when you visit Istanbul). Restaurants and bars are also close. They have an airport shuttle and the pickup at the airport is free, nice if you are new to the city. The return trip to the airport must be paid for, but was not expensive. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location in excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: SusanManlyNSW
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights at Sapphire hotel in mid June and it was perfect from pick up at airport to swift check in by reception. The room on 4th floor at the back was quite or as quite as you can get in Istanbull. We opted for a twin as we find beds more reliable. We had adequate room to move around and house our luggage. tThe room had a tea kettle which was very much appreciated. The hotel has been recently renovated and this obviously included our room which was spotless and tastefully decorated. as was the reception areas with the roomy couches. The bathroom was again clean and plentiful towels and supplies. Breakfast as mentioned in numerous reviews was more than you could want with an excellent spread to set you up for a busy day. Everyone in reception was helpful and friendly giving good tips for restaurants and suggesting for best ways to get around.. the free internet in reception for guests was a bonus. I have absolutely no hesitation in recommending the Hotel Sapphire to anyone and in fact could not see why anyone would select one of the International chain hotels- over the Sapphire.. It has atmosphere , comfort, location and the service to make for a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NM52
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayend at the hotel for seven nights and i can say that it was the highlight of our trip. The rooms are reasonably sizes and the breakfast was superb.The staff were great and gave us all the help we needed with the sightseeing. The location is excellent and i would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Arguably one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Onelifeliveit
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from spending a week in Istanbul and I have nothing to say but great things - Istanbul is like a huge outdoor museum but it is the fantastic service at Sapphire Hotel that would make me return again and again. The staff at Sapphire know about customer care, they know about providing excellent service without being overbearing and intimidating. No request is too difficult to accommadate and when I couldn't understand the satellite t.v, the staff were more than willing to help me. The FREE pick up car from the airport was so appreciated. Any traveller will tell you that getting from the airport to your destination can be a daunting process especially when dealing with foreign currency. The buffet breakfast was very sustaining and the breakfast room was decorated nicely. Other guests have commented on the size of the room but ours definitely was not small. Clean fluffy towels changed daily and hot piping water was available all the time. Satellite t.v with many arabic channels as well as English. A safe for valuables, a mini bar and a kettle with teabags !!! What more could you ask for and at such great prices. Especially when you are handed a gift at the end of your stay. I cannot say enough great things about this hotel and would NEVER go anywhere else if I ever return to Istanbul. The hotel is surrounded by restaurants all catering to tourists but I can highly recommend Turquoise Pub/Restaurant which is directly in front of the hotel. The atmosphere, decor and attention to detail with their meals is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaMike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights in June. We had read and taken on board the reviews on trip advisor and were very happy with our decision to stay. The location is very good, rooms very clean and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. Suggest you ensure you are clear if you want a double room rather than a twin as we were initially given a twin which was a little cramped. However when I asked to change the staff were very accomodating and moved all our gear to the new room which was bigger and much more comfortable. I think the sign of a good operation is how quickly they fix a problem, and so I am happy to recommend this hotel for good service at a very affordable price

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price!!”
Reviews.Author: Drica_from_Brazil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sapphire hotel for 3 days in June. The rooms were very clean, cozy and well equipped with TV, air conditioning and a good bathroom. The location is excellent, close to most of main attractions in a nice neighborhood. The staff was very nice and helpful giving us all the necessary touristic information, booking the transfers and keeping our luggage. The breakfast was ok, lots of things to eat but no information about them making impossible to identify some of the items. It is definitely worth it to stay in Sapphire hotel. If I ever go back to Istanbul Iâ€™ll stay there for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Well maintained hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MortUSA_Polska
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Istanbul and actually split my stay at two places, both of which were outstanding. I have nothing bad to say about the Sapphire, they were very efficient and kind at check in. The rooms are small, but well decorated and clean. I loved the location, it is surrounded by restaurants that are cheaper than those on Akbiyik Caddesi and are pleasant to sit at. I received Turkish tea and candy at check-out which was very pleasant. I would definitely stay again the Sapphire. I do not hesitate to recommend it wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: JenniferVancouver
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff and great location for walking to all major sites. Loads of good restaurants right outside the door. Skip the Bosphorus cruise - not good value - take a ferry ride instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: PeterVarna
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, good location, friendly staff, excellent breakfast

Reviews.Title: “A small hotel in an excellent setting and with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Barbara985
Reviews.Content: I picked the hotel because of ithe indicated price, location, ammenities offered and internet reviews. We were very satisfied as it lived up to our hopes. It is located in a very colorful section of Istanbul, with lovely outside restaurants within very close proximity.The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the metro is within a block, so travel within the city of Istanbul was very easy, fast, and economical. Our room, though relatively small, was very clean, and quiet, and the beds were very comfortable. We felt we got a very good value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice!”
Reviews.Author: panasia
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 4 nights at the hotel. It is close to all main tourist places to visit and to Gulhane tram station:going to Taksim square or to Kumkapi for fish restaurants is therefore a 5 minute walk to the station . We got a free airport pickup by the hotel. We received a a very warm welcome with drinks and candy. The hotel offered a room change immediately from a two single bed room to a double bed room as we gave our preference. The room is newly renovated with dark wooden floating floor, nicely decorated with Ottoman paintings, golden molding, very well equipped: safe, hair dryer, fridge, kettle with tea, coffee, chocolate provided, LCD TV, free plug-in interner and free wi-fi. Wall thermosrtat controls AC which is fairly quiet. Firm mattress. This hotel is fully sprinklered. A large dining room in the basement serves a decent buffet breakfast with reasonable number of choices. A newly renovated pool and sauna are a very welcome feature after an all day long excursion. Staff are very friendly and helpful in booking hotel-airport transportation (40 L) or in advising about restaurants, hamam or in setting up internet connection. A small souvenir from Istanbul was offered by the hotel at the end of our stay. All in all it is a very good hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sapphire is a friendy hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: miyu_princess
Reviews.Content: To sum it up, Hotel Sapphire was a great place to stay and we enjoyed it. The hotel offered a free pick-up from the airport, and also organized a ride back to the airport for 40TL for 3. I stayed 4 nights with two friends in a triple room. The room was of decent size, not big but not too small either. The beds were very comfy, although 2 of the 3 pillows were very thick and lumpy. The bathroom was nice and clean with a bathtub and a shower with good water pressure and enough hot water. The full carpet in the room was a bit stained (must be hard to keep clean, allergic people heads up!) and the air-con was dripping some water on it too at night so we decided to sleep without the air-con as the June nights were still cool enough to do that. The hotel itself was very quiet, but there were some noises from the street. Hotel Sapphire was definitely not a completely "stainless" place, but because the price of the room was extremely good, the service always friendly, the breakfast buffet was awesome and the location in Sultanahmet area just superb for sightseeing, I am going to recommend this hotel fully and for the price it deserves all 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with location”
Reviews.Author: westcoasteagleperth
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were great to us on our stay at the hotel,the location was also a plus great eating places nearby. The breakfasts were plentiful and good quality but could have some variation none the less value for money. It was our first time to Turkey but we were made very welcome and would stay at this hotel again. Thanks again for our very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: LondonHDL
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel and value for money. Clean, small but comfortable. Free wi-fi very useful. Good recommendations at the front desk. We visited Devali a great restaurant on the sea front (Ask Reception). Loved Istanbul - although double check the opening times of sights as they seem to change often. Getting around is very easy.

Reviews.Title: “perfect situation and good services”
Reviews.Author: VeroniqueStrasbourg
Reviews.Content: very good location to start a visit of Istanbul by foot. very close to major cultural sites of the city. staff is pretty helpful and nice. wonderful choice for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “really, really good (as well as really good value for money!)”
Reviews.Author: potomacWashington
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exceptionally good value for the money. Cheerful, helpful service, great pool, rooms small but very comfortable, wonderful location. Friends staying in other "luxury" hotels all said that next time they would book at the Sapphire.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sapphire lived up to everything we expected”
Reviews.Author: Peter027
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a five days stay at the Hotel Sapphire (Hotel Safir in turkish) in June. For me it was my first time in Istanbul, whereas my wife had lived for a few years in the city, though that was over 20 years ago. We chose Hotel Sapphire because of the excellence of its reviews in Trip Adviser and our expectations were fully fulfilled. If you are looking for a hotel that has character, is located conveniently for all of the usual tourist sites (it's roughly halfway between the Blue Mosque and the Galata Bridge) and does everything within its power to look after and assist its guests then this is the hotel for you. We cannot fault its cleanliness and the quality and variety of the food that it offered. But best of all were the ever friendly, helpful and courteous staff. All of our requests for assistance regarding the booking of a restaurant (we went to Rami whose rooftop restaurant overlooks the Blue Mosque), a performance by the "Whirling Dervishes" and a Bosphorous boat tour were met with infectious enthusiasm. Istanbul doesn't need our praises to persuade you to go there. Would we go again - yes. Would we return to the Hotel Sapphire - yes. Would I recommend the hotel to friends and family and to the wider public - yes without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “The City of Dreams and Minarets”
Reviews.Author: pinkflorentina
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on a Friday morning having completed the journey from England by seven trains (add to your list of things to do before you die) via three nights in Vienna. The staff were extremely welcoming as we had arrived two hours before a room would normally be free. No trouble to the staff - sit down, have a cup of tea and we'll get you a room ASAP. And they did! We did turn the first room down as the window faced a building wall, again not a problem to the staff. Another cup of tea and before we knew it a room was ready. The hotel goes to great length to state that their rooms are not as big as other hotels - why? I don't know as the room was perfectly fine. Lovely Bathroom/Shower with toiletries. Fresh towels and Linen every day makes it feel very special. Yes I know not very green but we did save carbon miles by going via train Buffet breakfast very good but don't get caught out by the ten am finish - we and others did. Tips - Its a lovely area around the hotel, good restaurants, cafes, quiet back streets and the esential laundry. Turn right out of the hotel, first right again and go 50 yards on your right for the best laundry service you will ever get. Located well for the main attractions, we used the tram occasionally (excellent service) but walked mainly so that we could absorb this beautiful city. Also took the Bosphorus trip (FAB) and the ferry to the Asian side Uskadar - don't miss that one. Change your money when you get there. Its true they give a MUCH better rate than at home Avoid main sights in the morning unless you want to run the gauntlet with tour parties - and there are lots!!!!!!!!!!!!! Visit mosques later in the day when you will be able to appreciate the true splendour and peacefulness And finally we learnt some essential Turkish before arriving. Is it necessary, perhaps not but when you do make the effort the lovely Turkish people engage with you on a completely different level and we ended up teaching each other our respective languages. So would we go back - YES for sure. In fact we are planning a return trip

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Conte126
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel, nice and clean rooms, friendly personnel. Excellent location. Highly recommend it to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Jesse1551
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Sapphire. The staff were polite and attentive, and the room was very comfortable. Breakfast was good, with a fairly wide selection, though it was slightly manic with so many people. Still, a very enjoyable stay and great value for money. Likes Room Location Free internet Dislikes Breakfast was slightly hectic

Reviews.Title: “Perfect as a base to Explore”
Reviews.Author: ABC23
Reviews.Content: Simply a very nice, friendly, and clean hotel. The staff are helpful and the location is perfect. When we go back to Istanbulwe will stay there again, without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robytravel
Reviews.Content: Very happy hotel with good services. Professional and friendly staff. Excellent location close to major places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky choice for stay in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: Angelus61
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel just browsing internet and reading reviews as we have never been in Istambul before. To be honest we were lucky as all our expectations were met. Hotel is in the heart of Istambul but 5 minutes apart from favourite tourist streets what gave us quiet and peaceful atmosphere whereever we wanted round the clock. Room was not big but cozy enough to spent nights and to have a rest. Exellent service at recepcion and real interest from stuff to help with any issue.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel ideal location”
Reviews.Author: harryjodie
Reviews.Content: we were picked up from the airport by one of the hotel employees and dropped off as close to the hotel as possible (no cars on the street of the hotel )the driver helped with our luggage and it was only a short walk to the hotel .My first impression was of joy ,the little side streets were full of character and i couldn't wait for the morning to explore We were greated warmly at reception and was offered a non acholic drink and turkish delight.Check-in was easy and quick ,a butler offered to take our luggage up to our rooms which were elegantly decorated and clean.The rooms are on the small side but nice and cozy we were on the 3rd floor and because there is no traffic it was nice and peaceful there are lots of resturantsa to choose from on the same street as the hotel all offering a good selection .We ate a lot at pub Salute a few doors up from the hotel which was reasonably priced with large portions Blue Mosque,Topkapi Palace and Saint Sofia are 10minutes walks away and the tram runs past at the end of the street .In other words it is ideal location for everything The buffet breakfast is excellent with plenty of choice .Top tip have a bowl of natural yogurt every morning to keep away dodgy tummys (it really works) There is a little shop next door selling water, cigerettes etc Oh and how could I forget the parrot who sits in reception .He's delightful and imitates whistling ,phone ringing etc I was chuffed to bits when he let me tickle his head on my 5th day (after lots of chastising ) There is pool in the basement which is clean with a sauna and turkish bath room and plans are under way for a roof top terrace .The staff will happily take you up there to show you what the terrace will be like I would definetly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Very, very good choice”
Reviews.Author: georgianaro
Reviews.Content: Sapphire is a cozy hotel right in the heart of the old Istanbul. Located between Sirkeci and Gulhane tram stops, 5 minutes walking to Topkapi Saray and 10 minutes walking to Sultanahmet, Hagia Sofia or Basilica Cistern. We were pleased to find a clean hotel with small but comfortable rooms. The staff is absolutely genial. They would everything they could to help you. Internet wirless is for free. They clean the rooms everyday, changing towels and sheets. The parrot in the lobby is very funny. He uses to whistle all day long especially when you try to comunicate with him/she. The only thing I could recommend to them is to change breakfast hours and make it to 11 am. Not everyone (especialy young ones) could wake up early in the morning ready to eat. Moreover if you use to stay late in the night at the terraces in front of the hotel, smoking narghile (water pipes) :).

Reviews.Title: “A classy hotel with helpful, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lunaloni
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Safir (this is the Turkish term) Hotel. The hotel exuded as sense of elegance, without being ostentatious. The bathrooms are modern with a separate tub and shower and lots of hot water, unlike some of the hotels I stayed at in other parts of Turkey. Soap and shampoo are provided and the wake-up service is reliable. The breakfast buffet offered a full range of items, including eggs, toast, sliced meats, yogourt, preserves, fruits, vegetables, and coffee and tea. The food was fresh and attractively displayed. There is also a swimming pool and a Turkish bath and massage facilities in the basement. Plus the hotel is in the tourist part of Istanbul and close to many excellent restaurants and key sights, such as the Blue Mosque. Safir Hotel was one of the high points of my trip and I would go back in a flash. I travelled on my own and am a woman in my 50's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: afiskness
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Sapphire for three nights. We loved the hotel it was gerat to be so cloase to so many of the major attractions and to be close to so many good restaurants. The room was on the small side, however it was very clean and modern. The bathrooms was great as it was obvisously recently updated and very clean. We really liked being able to spend the day going to all of the sites and then being able to come back to the hotel to use the pool and sauna to relax before going to bed. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “excellent pied-a-terre in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: benfromsf
Reviews.Content: The location offers the perfect location to major sights, to ferries, to tram, to restaurants, to park. So convenient. The breakfast buffet is very good (I stayed in Turkey for a total of 25 days and only one hotel surpassed Hotel Sapphire). The room is very good other than the radiant floor heater in the bathroom that I never figured out how to turn it off, but it was not a major concern so I didn't bring it to attention. I definitely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in terms of service, location and value!”
Reviews.Author: interlachen
Reviews.Content: New hotel located in the heart of historic Istanbul. Hotel staff is very accommodating and friendly from the moment you arrive to the moment you leave- a true four star hotel. Additionally, they have a very nice lap pool and sauna dowstairs. Many of the great tourist spots such as the Blue Mosque are convenient by taking the nearby tram or by a nice walk. The hotel is located on a pedestrian street with many restaurants, shops and convenience stores located in the immediate area. However, noise was not a problem because you can close the windows if needed and the AC actually works all the time! Truly a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sapphire and Istanbul: a perfect combination.”
Reviews.Author: groenlo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sapphire is excellent situated in the heart of old Istanbul, the perfect start to enjoy fascinating Istanbul.The staff is very kind and helpfull, the rooms are well decorated and clean. The breakfast is very good. In a few words: a hotel to recommend to friends and we hope te come back in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location; Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: clstern
Reviews.Content: Mr. Harun at the front desk was an excellent host, offering us tea and candies, helping with tours and taking care of all our needs and questions. The hotel room was quite small, but immaculate and beautifully appointed. It is on a quiet street that had no access to cars at the time (taxis stop a block away and walk to get you). We felt the cost was high. WIFI was spotty; you could get it in the hallway on the second floor. The location was perfect, within walking distance to all the sights in the old city. We even took several long walks along the shore to the fish market and nearby restaurants. We would highly recommend the Sapphire!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: sofialili8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at a perfect spot, next to everything! The tram passes a minute away. The rooms are very clean and well decorated, breakfast is very good, and the staff is friendly and most helpful. I highly recommend it, and would certainly go back. Sofia, Greece

Reviews.Title: “the worst room”
Reviews.Author: ana_momu
Reviews.Content: We were one wek in Istanbul, hotel good located, however the room was not as good as we spected, it was so small for two people. Besides short bedsheets. Bathtub was broken, taken a shower the water went out from the bottom of the bathtub, and there was screen.

Reviews.Title: “5 STAR SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Hamid-Moaref
Reviews.Content: I stayed in safir hotel for 3 days and had wonderul time there. lovation is absolutly ideal. the rooms are very clean andthe most important the fantastic staff. they can do better with the breakfast but apart from that i give 5 star rating for this hotel. UMIT was a fantastic member of staff and helped me alot within my stay. I strongly recommend this hotel to whos after best historic location of Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBazell
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel after reading the excellent reviews in trip advisor and really enjoyed our stay. its biggest advantage is its location within walking distance of most of the principal sites of this amazing city. The staff were very friendly. The hotel pick service to and from the airport was also very efficient unfortunately during our stay the roof terrace which we were looking forward to using was out of action and on the day we wanted to use it the swimming pool was out of order so for these two small problems we couldnt rate it 5 stars

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay very much. Very friendly staff, nice breakfast and very good location.”
Reviews.Author: AAJ5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really worth a recommandation. We even got the option to stay in their new Hotel which is located just around the corner, Hotel Maewood and that is so beautiful!!! We had a lovely room, very warmly decorated and the personel were all very helpful. For us their was only one minor point. After our very late arrival we found it early to be able to have breakfast only until 10 am. There is a fantastic `Spa`area with a lovely Hamman, Sauna and Swimming/Pool. If we go back to Istanbul we will definitely stay at the Sapphire or the Maewood Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE "Sapphire Hotel", We LOVE Istanbul ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: Aekaterina
Reviews.Content: Last February, we had the great opportunity to spend a few days in the Hotel Sapphire, in beautiful Istanbul ! ! ! That was such a wonderful experience!!!.. We only have good words and comments to say first of all about the location (very close to the most important sights of Istanbul, so we could visit them by just walking!), then about the personnel hospitality and politeness, their excellent service and their warm friendly manners. We really enjoyed our comfortable room and every morning the delicious breakfast they were serving to us..
