By the way, when we came back to Greece, we started the good habit of having such a healthy breakfast every day and we owe this to Istanbul and to one of its best Hotels, the Hotel Sapphire ! Lastly, our congratulations, warm thanks and best regards to Mr. Deniz Guner, this wonderful gentleman in the Reception of the Hotel, who did his best to make our stay unforgettable ! ! ! THANK YOU ! ! !

Reviews.Title: “Great service - a pleasure to stay at”
Reviews.Author: Marce915
Reviews.Content: Everything was fantastic - the price, staff, room, location, breakfast, etc. Istanbul is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - would return in an instant.”
Reviews.Author: Stu
Reviews.Content: From the welcome drink to the farewell gift of tea, this hotel was a delight. The room was comfortable and clean, although smallish. The public areas were clean and smart, and the location was right where you would wish to be for the impressive sights that Istanbul has to offer. I have only two gripes, both minor. The good news is that tea and coffee making facilities are in your room, the less good was that I had to ring daily for them to be replenished. Secondly, as mentioned eldewhere on here, the breakfast was only so-so. There was plenty of choice, but for me, there was an over-abundance of sugary items. Very minor points though, and I would be happy to suggest this hotel to my friends. One tip - check out your room price in Euros as compared to Turkish Lira. My bill was about Â£20 cheaper if I paid in the local currency on departure. Have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “More than excellent”
Reviews.Author: Chrisanne
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Sapphire for 7 nights. I found it very comfortable, excellent location, excellent value. The swimming pool great! On my arrival I was met at the airport by the hotel transport which was great. Unfortunately I became quite ill during my stay and the hotel staff could not do enough for me, including going to the pharmacy for some medicine and then organising me to go to the hospital where I spent a day on a drip. All the staff were absolutely terrific including the housekeeping staff. I recovered and was able to return home on my booked flight but I cannot wait for the opportunity to return to Istanbul and I will certainly stay at the Sapphire Hotel (if they'll have me!) Chris,Dublin

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Traveler227
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sapphire is a great choice for sightseeing in Istanbul. It was within a 10 minute walk to both the Blue Mosque and the Galata Bridge. There were also numerous restaurants and shops surrounding the hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the buffet breakfast was an added bonus. In all, this is a great hotel for the price range, especially considering the location and the included one-way airport transfer. My only request would be for complimentary bottled water in the rooms since you can't drink the water in the hotel. I would definitely recommend the Sapphire Hotel for a stay in Instabul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean, comfortable, friendly - recommended”
Reviews.Author: KarlJordan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Sapphire Hotel in late March having found the hotel through Trip Advisor. I found that all the positive reviews were accurate, and the hotel certainly lived up to it's excellent billing. The rooms were clean and modern, not huge, but fine. I stayed for three nights with my elderly mother - the hotel was ideally located for walking access to all the old town attractions - St. Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, Bosporus waterfront - we walked everywhere (slowly!). Some nice restaurants in the immediate vicinity - tram was one street away. Staff were friendly, polite but not overbearing. Nice touches were offer of a piece of Turkish Delight and cocktail to welcome us on check-in, and gifts of Apple Tea, two tea glasses and a small box of Turkish Delight at checkout. Breakfast buffet was great, various pastries, breads, toast, cereals, meats, eggs, dried fruits, figs, olives, honeycomb honey - a great start to the day - just don't expect conventional English or American fried breakfast - you're in Turkey after all - be adventurous! Free collection from the airport, return trip 40TKL with hotel car. Would certainly recommend to anyone visiting old town Istanbul, and will hopefully be back myself.

Reviews.Title: “Our excellent trip”
Reviews.Author: Tory_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sapphire hotel for 2 nights and we were very pleased by it. Everything was excellent, clean rooms, a kindly stuff, transfer from the airport, the location, a good breakfast, and certainly , a good value)) We went to the Istambul to spend my husband's birhday, and we spent these days very well! I recommend Sapphire hotel everybody! PS. Sorry for my english)))

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, but so-so breakfast”
Reviews.Author: timorg
Reviews.Content: We spent a week for holiday in Istanbul in early March. We stayed 6 nights at Hotel Sapphire based on the recommendation from Trip Advisor. The hotel is very centrally located, close to a tram stop (Gulhane) and within 5-10 min walking distance to all major attractions â€“ Topkapi Palace, Haghia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Hippodrome, Galata Bridge and waterfront. The hotel is located on a pedestrian-only street, hence quiet in the evenings. Although currently (March 2009) there is some on-going construction work at a nearby building and we had one noisy night during our stay. There is a small supermarket (BIM) nearby so it is easy to get bottled water â€“ the water in Istanbul smells strong Chlorine, hence not drinkable. There are a wide variety of choices for the breakfast there â€“ the Turkish ones are nice, but the cereals taste a bit stale, and the fruits do not look fresh. We were allocated a Superior Room which is clean and nicely furnished. The bathroom is a decent size, but there is a tile missing above the bath, showing the pipes behind â€“ my guess is that an extractor fan used to be there. We used the hotelâ€™s free airport pickup service on arrival and paid 40TRL for hotelâ€™s taxis service to the airport. On checking out, the staff gave us a box of Turkish delight and a box of Apple Tea with cups and saucers as presents, which is nice. A very nice restaurant â€“ Pasazade â€“ is just opposite Hotel Sapphire. We walked in the restaurant on the night of arrival by chance, but ate there during our entire stay in Istanbul â€“ 6 suppers plus 1 lunch. The restaurant specialises in Ottoman Cuisine which is delicious and the price is very reasonable: 6-17 TRL for main and 5 TRL for starter or dessert. The menu has a picture for each dish, and Staff are very friendly and attentative. We really liked the meals there and found the Food & Drink section in the Lonely Planet â€“ Turkey book very useful. Ross and Annie from Britain

Reviews.Title: “Great value!!”
Reviews.Author: g_papadak
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect! the rooms beautiful and clean, hotel personnel kind and helpful, breakfast really good ad the hotel itself is ideally located-walking distance from Topkapi, Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque and the Egypt market! I wish i could stay there for more days, but i will definitely do whenever i get back to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staf and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: HansMarina
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights. Central location within walking distance to Blue Mosque, Haya Sofia and Grand Bazaar. The hotel has a swimming pool, sauna. Strongly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We were like special guests”
Reviews.Author: AyshaR
Reviews.Content: Wow! An excellant, clean, friendly hotel and staff. we stayed 9 nights at this hotel with my elderly mother and teenage son.there was always someone cleaning something somewhere at the hotel. the hotel is in an excellant location near a tram stop and all major sites, i already have and will recomend this to family and friends and will definately stay here again. Umit on the desk was always very helpfull with advice and suggestions. breakfast was fresh and always well presented and plenty of choice for everyone. If you get a chance ask the chef to cook you a meal in the evening, we had our last meal there but wish we had many more.. excellant cuisine for the price..

Reviews.Title: “Berry berry berry berry good”
Reviews.Author: Brains69
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive before i got to the hotel, it sounded too good to be true. A good hotel, near all the sights, for so cheap? It ended up being pefect for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and affordable too”
Reviews.Author: ConstanceStrongarm
Reviews.Content: Free pickup from the airport when we arrived. Free wireless internet. Central location within walking distance to Blue Mosque and grand bazaar. Also close to the tram which covers major sights and the airport and the ferries that cross the Bosporus. Room was very comfortable and clean. Staff were very helpful with directions and advice. Strongly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing atmosphere, wonderful sauna and swimingpool, I will advise this hotel to my friends! hope to be back there again!”
Reviews.Author: Aggy_angel
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed out stay in this hotel. it was wonderfull time-too bad it seemed too short. stuff - exelent! they were ready to help us in any single thing. one off stuff guys came wtih us to show where exatly is port becouse we wanted to go to Bosphorus and we couldnt find trip station, (thanks to this guy, too bad i dont know his name). stuff guys let us swim in swimming pool even in the late night when we came from our night life. they didnt feel disturbed of this. and they always were very polite and kindly answered to all our questions! hotel is perfectly located and it is as a litte heart in centr of Istanbul greatest places. Breakfast was exelent (i didnt try everything becouse simply it was nost possible coz table was as big as one wall.....so long)!!!! i really liked there.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms & swimmingpool, Awful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ulanbatur
Reviews.Content: Do recommend the rooms and the pool but eat breakfast somewere else! DonÂ´t be silly enough to pay that much for just toast and tea. Almost all other things at the breakfast table was unfresh!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: apeliothes
Reviews.Content: It was a perfect hotel for a trip to Istanbul. The hotel is located in the heart of Old- Istanbul - perfect to visit the famous places of Istanbul. The service is excellent and rooms are clean. What do you need more for a city trip??

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sapphire Def a Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: RashLondon
Reviews.Content: What can i say ... This hotel was fab. As sson as we got there they upgraded our rooms to the new superior rooms. The rooms on this floor have recently been redecorated and in excellent kitchen. The bathrroms are spotless and something that you would expect to find in a 4* hotel in europe. The staff are very nice and always attentive and will try and help. Communication with them is sometimes diffcult as not all of them speak english however the manager and the recpetion staff peak perfect english. The location is very good with you beeing within 5-6 minutes to the nearest tram line. You will be able to walk to all the major sttaractions within 10-12 minues. If someone has a disability that effect their walking or in a wheel chair then getting up the hill might be a bit of a struggle without help. We took our 1 yr old daughter in a buggy and at times that was a struggle to manage. Aya sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and the Bhosprous is all within 10-15 minutes leisurly walk. The grnad bazar is a little bit further but you can get a tram there in 6-8 minutes. If you stay at this hotel you will not need to get a taxi at all. The hotel has a nice size pool which is brand new. A small sauner and small hammam. Breakie is normal for this part of the world which is cheese, savory stuff and lots of cold meats. Not my vup of tea but when its free you cant go wrong. we traveled with our 1 yr old and the hotel provided a cot free of charge. We really enjoyed our stay. Th only 2 downpoints - 1. The hotel is siuated 1 road away from the main road where no cars can acess although our lagage was carried for us both on arrval and departure. 2. The views in the room are of a derelict site. No worls are going on at the mo. apart from these minor points this is a excellent hotel which is great value. BTW try and book with the hotel direct they will more than likely do you a deal. PS. we got apple tea and a set of glasses as a departure pressie.

Reviews.Title: “Even the parrot was friendly”
Reviews.Author: Winter2urist
Reviews.Content: Warm welcome, excellent staff: helpful, humorous, informative, nice dialouges, fantastic breakfast, nice and clean room, good bed. First choice next time in Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: nfcnez
Reviews.Content: Before going to Istanbul, we were sceptical about the reviews of Hotel Sapphire on TA. Like many others, we thought that the hotel was too good to be true, but at less than Â£90 for three nights we booked it anyway. I am glad to say that the hotel is worthy of the reviews that we read. On arrival at the hotel (after a nightmare taxi drive), we were given an orange juice cocktail and some turkish delight by the hotel. We were shown to our room which was a twin room - not a double as we had booked. We called reception and asked for a double room and they politely sent the bell boy up. However, once we were shown our double room (Room 305), we were dissapointed as it was nowhere near as nice as the twin room. It obviously was one of the non-refurbished ones as reviews had previously stated, and the bathroom was worn and the shower door was broken. Therefore we called for a second time, and despite our fussiness they took us back to the original twin room (Room 113). The room was on the small side, but very clean and had an LCD tv which impressed my OH... The bathroom was nice and modern with a very powerful shower. As we were in Istanbul in late January, the hotel was very quiet with only a few tables at breakfast. The breakfast was ok. There was a wide variety of things, but all were very turkish - cheeses, meats, olives, hummous etc. The pool and sauna area surprised us as they were really nice. We used them on two occasions and both times we were the only ones down there. The location of the hotel is perfect - all of the main sites are within a 5/10 minute walk and the tram station is just round the corner. There are quite a few bars and restaurants on the road of the hotel, which we mainly decided to avoid as they hassled us quite a lot. I would recommend walking to the Galata bridge at Eminou and trying one of the fish sandwiches at Aruna cafe - they were delicious! When we checked out at the end of our stay we were asked where we heard about the hotel, to which we told them trip advisor. They then asked us to write a good review on here giving us apple tea and a box of turkish delight. All in all, for the money we paid we were impressed by the hotel, the room, the facilities and the service. We would definately go back to Hotel Sapphire if we were to go back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: skrotnisse99
Reviews.Content: At check-out the staff asks the satisfied guests to visit "tripadvisor.com" and give a good review; this could be the reason why it has got the high points. Nevertheless, its a decent hotel. The rooms are clean, the staff is always friendly and there is a nice sauna and a pool which is included in room price. Even if it was a bit cold outside, the heating in the hotel was satisfying. The interior is however as uninspiring as seen on the homepage and the breakfast buffet in the basement had some weak points, for instance the mandatory orange juice was replaced by a sugarfilled lemonade. My aim with this review is to tell you that the hotel is reasonable, but probably over-rated on this webpage. Unfortunately, it doesnÂ´t have "that extra". Later we stayed in a hotel nearby which was much cheaper but offered the same service and a better breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: puxadoraz
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Sapphire Hotel and was impressed by its grand interior. Plush sofas lined the lobby area and it was tastefully decorated. We arrived at 8am and the staff allowed us early check-in and invited us for breakfast while the check-in process was being carried out. The buffet area was impressive with a wide array of choices. Free internet services are available and the toilet and room are clean and very comfortable. I will definately stay again. Mr Harun, the staff member who attended to us was very attentive and made our stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Rest in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SHVMoscow
Reviews.Content: Moscow, 27/jan/2009 The hotel was pleasant. Cosy and purely. A convenient arrangement, near to the basic sights. Is in foot street in number silently. There is no transport noise. Round hotel it is a lot of cafe and restaurants. The affable personnel. I recommend to visit this hotel

Reviews.Title: “a great time in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: janklaasblomme
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel in the middle of the old city. Every place of intrest is within walking distance. The staff is very friendly, they helped us so much. We even had a free airport shuttle, we could swim in the hotel swimminpool and have a sauna whenever we asked. This is a hotel you must visit! It's the best!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Madeleine7
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sapphire is perfectly located in the old town (Sultanahmet) of Istanbul. It's on walking distance of all the main touristic hightlights like the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, etc. and all the restaurants. The hotel staff is super friendly, the rooms and spacious enough, clean and modern. There's free wireless internet which is a nice added feature and the price of the accommodation is very acceptable as well. I'd like to recommend Hotel Sapphire to anybody wanting to explore Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: addom
Reviews.Content: Great location for walking to the main sights. Very friendly and helpful staff. Comfortable rooms. Really good buffet breakfast with lots of choice and good quality. The staff are obviously proud of their Hotel and want their guests to have the best possible stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sapphire... a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Smart
Reviews.Content: You could not find a better location for staying in Istanbul, it is very convenient for Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar etc etc etc. The spice Bazaar is a mere 5 mins leisurely walk. There are lots of local restaurants, shops, bars and the tram stop is 2mins walk. When we arrived the hotel staff were very hospitable offering us drinks and Turkish Delight. We stayed in one of the refurbished rooms with very nice furnishings and fittings. The ensuite bathroom was large with marble fixtures and a very large and powerful shower! The pool and sauna were very nice and we had them all to ourselves most of the time. The breakfast was lovely, lots of choice and once again the staff were very polite and helpful. Lovely fresh food served every morning! The room was meticulously cleaned and re-stocked with tea/ coffee fresh linen and towels every day! I would recommend this hotel highly if you want to absorb the culture and atmosphere of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sapphire a gem in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: mrmundo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have recently returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. We selected it through trip advisor as like most of our holidays. Once again we were not dissapointed. The hotel is set in a brilliant position so most of your sightseeing can easily be done on foot, i.e Blue Mosque 5 mins, Grand Bazaar 10 mins, not to mention the others close by. If you cannot walk very well then the local tramstop is just around the corner. The hotel is very clean and althought they said the room would be small as it was in the old town we did not find it that way at all. Plenty of room for the two of us, bathroom fine aswell. Breakfast had a vast array of items you could choose from so there is something for everyone. All the staff were more than helpfull and i would certainly return. There is a pool in the basement together with a sauna, both free of charge. We used this facility one afternoon and it was a good way to relax your leg muscles, Our room was 69 euros a night which we thought was good value. You could also get an set course evening meal for only 10 euro per person at the hotel which was fine. All in all, this is a great hotel to use as a base in Istanbul which is amazing. We only scratched the surface so have a good excuse to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very good hotel. Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: bakuleva
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, with excellent staff and beautyful lobby. I like it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality for little money”
Reviews.Author: yury98
Reviews.Content: Pros: We pay only 32 euro per night per double room. Perfect location at the center of Sultanahmet. 100 m to tram station, 400 m to Aya Sophia, 500 m to Galata bridge. Good breakfast. Good staff. Good swimming pool and sauna. Free Wi-Fi. Safe and electric kettle at room. Cons: Bad noise insulation (we live at room 503). We listen all conversations at near room, noise from bath, noise from tram outside.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: Dutchies-2008
Reviews.Content: We agree with other writers: We stayed at this hotel based on comments from other visitors to the hotel, I was dissapointed in the quality of the bathroom. It was nowhere near as nice as those shown in the photos taken by other travellers. I can only summise that some rooms have been renovated, others not. Our bathroom was pretty grotty and the room itself was tiny but good enough. The worst thing was the temperature in the room - it was boiling and there was no way to regulate it. But they are working on this as we speak! However, I would agree with other reviewers that the front desk staff are very helpful and the location couldn't be better. Everything is really close, the best atractions, the public transport etc. And the taxi can reach the front door!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Rachcbs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a package booked with Easyjet. Based on comments from other visitors to the hotel, I was really dissapointed in the quality of the room. We stayed in room 508 and it was nowhere near as nice as those shown in the photos taken by other travellers. I can only summise that some rooms have been renovated, others not. Our bathroom was pretty grotty and the room itself was tiny, the carpet really badly damaged and the furniture very shabby. The worst thing was the temperature in the room - it was boiling and there was no way to regulate it. However, I would agree with other reviewers that the front desk staff are very helpful and the location couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “loved sapphire & Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: zillybilly14
Reviews.Content: Our experience was of Exceptionally helpful service and cleanliness.Tiny problems rectified immediately.Superb location though Taxi cant get to the door itself.Overall excellent value for money if you are given superior rooms otherwise not too bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely days in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Magrafit
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location in the middle of the old town (Sulthanamed) 10 min walk to the Grand Bazar. Very friendly staff, clean room. Excellent cost effectiveness. Next time we will book into Hotel Sappire again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy064
Reviews.Content: I booked a triple room with my two children of 8 and 6, and we were completely delighted. All the staff in the hotel were fantastic, really friendly and went above the call of duty to ensure we were happy and comfortable. A senior member of staff even came to collect us from the airport at the last minute, when the friend who was trying to pick us up got stuck in traffic and couldn't make it in time! The room was clean, comfortable and everything worked perfectly - the shower was great! The location was perfect - close to all the best tourist sights as well as shops and restaurants. The indoor pool was a real bonus as the weather was wet on a couple of days. I recommend this for families on a budget and people who want to be in the heart of the tourist attractions in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic family hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrAlpen
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for our family of four because it was good value and in the middle of the old city. To be honest we didn't expect all that much, but we were so pleasantly surprised. From the warm welcome to the newly-installed swimming pool and sauna. The staff were courteous and helpful, and the location is perfect for visiting Istanbul. We stayed for ten nights and could happily have stayed another ten. I can not recommend this hotel too highly - fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, great value, wonderful staff, clean rooms,”
Reviews.Author: ftlauderdalenative
Reviews.Content: After reading TRIP ADVISOR reviews we booked this hotel online direct with the hotel. And we were not disappointed! Efficient & friendly booking service - great rates, very helpful front desk, great breakfast, nice clean rooms. Plus a free pick up at the airport made this a perfect visit. It's walking distance to lots of 'must see' spots as well as many restaurants. It is not a 5 star hotel, but rather a small intimate one, with 5 star service. We'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and efficient service at the Hotel Sapphire, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Sultana1504
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Istanbul staying at the Hotel Sapphire, which was superbly located within very easy walking distance to the main cultural venues of Haghia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Bazaar Quarter. It was also ideally located for the railway station, ferry ports and the Galata bridge to Beyoglu. It is set in a quiet, romantic little street, close to which are plenty of good restaurants and bars. The staff are so friendly and efficient - we were even provided with transport from the hotel upon arrival at the airport. They were always ready to give advice on tours etc. and help with these arrangements. The rooms were very comfortable and the breakfasts very good, hot and cold choices catering to a wide range of tastes (the honey from the honeycomb was superb!). The immaculate salon had plenty of luxurious seating and was a wonderful place to relax in whilst waiting for friends etc. The internet was readily available in the lobby at no extra charge. All in all, we had a wonderful experience here and we definitely would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: DShahnov
Reviews.Content: Everybody and everything is perfect - staff, placement, quality of food, room service. Thank you very much. See you in next time.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bowie22
Reviews.Content: Had a very comfortable stay here 20th-24th November.All staff very friendly.Breakfast choice excellent.Pool area lovely but unfortunately didn't have time to try it out.We were too busy.View from rooftop panorama stunning.

Reviews.Title: “A breakfast buffet that kept us going all day”
Reviews.Author: Alan_Dinnie
Reviews.Content: This wonderful hotel and the friendly and helpful staff (especially Engin) helped make our stay in Istanbul thoroughly enjoyable. However it could have been much worse; no thanks to EasyJet and their hotel affiliations. Originally we were booked into another hotel, booked via EasyJet, which we were told was central to everything in Istanbul, but was actually miles away as we discovered after researching. Trying to organise accommodation with the hotel from Australia was a nightmare. You couldn't complain about their service, there wasn't any. And we were just trying to alter a check-in day. Eventually after experiencing their appalling service, we were told that we had to cancel via EasyJet. Their attempt at 'service' was also appalling. Eventually we had to cancel the hotel and the flight (with penalties) then rebook the flight (which we missed at Luton, London by 30 seconds due to traffic jams and road works - but that is another story). In the meantime I had researched hotels in Istanbul, which brought me to the tripadvisor site. (If I had to go overseas or travel again I would not book anything until I had spent time on tripadvisor reading the comments of other travellers). I came across the Hotel Sapphire and after reading other reviews I contacted the hotel directly and booked in. From the initial point of contact in Australia and until the time we left we were thoroughly impressed with the Hotel Sapphire. As a person who has managed hotels for many years I would have no hesitation in employing all the staff. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone looking for exceptional value for money. It's not the Hilton but its not far off, and for a lot less money. I encourage potential travellers to read the other reviews on this wonderful hotel and then experience their level of service yourself. Enjoy your stay in Istanbul. It is a fascinating and lively city. Regards Alan Dinnie and Jacqueline Stenhouse. Bunbury, Western Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: Sr1992
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to fault this hotel, I booked direct and got a fantastic price for our weekend in Istanbul. (make sure you book direct with the hotel to get the best price, and to take advantage of the Airport pick up which is avaialble for stays of 2 nights or more) Friendly and helpful staff catered to our every need, and nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast spread was excellent, with a great selection of both traditional and more western tastes. Beds were particularly comfortable, with what felt like a memory foam matteress! Very centrally located close to Resturants, Train Station, and old town tourist attractions. The only minor problem I found, and this is mostly because Im a Very light sleeper, was that it was possible to hear people in the adjacent rooms if they are noisy, this was easily rectified with ear plugs, which I always take everywhere. Many thanks to the Hotel Sapphire staff for making our Istanbul weekend break very enjoyable, I will see you there again sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: tamerlano77
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sapphire is one of the best hotels I've been stayed in and one of only a few hotels where I've been treated like VIP. I've booked directly e-mailing to the hotel and they've sent their driver to pick me up on the Ataturk Airport (included). On the arrival in a hotel, we have been received with warmth and Umit, the receptionist, after offering us the coctail, spent a half an hour to introduce us in the main things to see in Istanbul and giving us all the information on the transports, restaurants and a hotel services. During our stay in hotel, the entire hotel staff was very kind, friendly and gave their best to answer to all our requests. The rooms are super clean, ordinate, with all modern conforts: Tv sattelite, air conditioning, mini-bar, telephone, hair dryer, all well designed and comfortable. The breakfast buffet offered the international food, all delicious and served with style. I loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At Sapphire Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TGusa
Reviews.Content: Sapphire Hotel Istanbul Turkey, We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, Nov. 08 We were ending a cruise in Istanbul. I booked this hotel after reading comments, from others. Well, it work out just great' The hotel is in a great location.You could walk to all the major sights. The metro is one block away. The hotel is locatated on a pedestrian street.So you will have to walk, from where the taxi "lets you out ",or the metro stops.A half block at the most. The staff, were always there to help. The room was quite adequate, shower had great,water pressure.We were on the go right after breakfast,. The breakfast was quite good!. We had a map from the hotel .Engin Evsen the Manager,and his staff "pointed out the sites" and how to get there,all walking distance for the ones that we wanted to see. The price of the room were just right for us. We would stay here again and recommend it to family and friends. We are in our mid 60s and had no problems here. We had a Great stay. Tom & Gerry U.S.A. Rocklin Calif.

Reviews.Title: “Too good to be true”
Reviews.Author: Shaitan777
Reviews.Content: Can hardly imagine there is any hotel on that level in Istanbul !!!! TOO GOOD TO BE TRUE Go there and you will not have even a moment of feeling that anything went wrong. It is just 100% dream voyage if you stay at that hotel. Came to Hotel in November and had a problem finding motorbike which is almost impossible in Istanbul. Denis at the reception helped me a lot to find vehicle and explain all the sightseeings and places to go depending on what I needed. Most friendly atmosphere I ever saw, hotel has no disadvantages , stuff, rooms, food, disposition, appearance, and so on and so forth. Well done guys. Everything is at AAA+++ level.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again when we come back to beautiful Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: RDjetsetter
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet, and reasonably priced too for a 4-star. The location is great -- it's a 2 minute walk to the Gulhane station, a 5-10 minute walk to Topkapi Palace, Haghia Sophia and Blue Mosque, and there are several good restaurants surrounding it. It has a Turkish bath and heated swimming pool, and the free breakfast was a feast! They also provide free shuttle service to/from Ataturk Airport and free WIFI. The hotel itself is well maintained, the rooms were quaint and immaculately clean, the lobby was elegant and comfortable. But the best part is the staff -- everyone was accommodating and friendly -- including their pet parrot who greets you when you come in. They even provide you with free cocktails while you wait for reception to check you in. We were travelling with a baby, and they set up a crib for him to sleep in. We loved Istanbul, and this hotel is definitely one of the many reasons why we'd love to come back to this beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it”
Reviews.Author: harpoh
Reviews.Content: At the end of October 2008 I stayed 7 days at the Sapphire. I have never regretted my decision. So, here are some details. LOCATION: As everyone says, you're in the center of many of the main attractions. The hotel is wonderfully located between EminÃ¶nÃ¼ (harbour) and Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosk etc. You have easy access to the tram, 200m to the stop, which makes it also very easy to get to the airport in around 1 hour. STAFF: Every member of the staff was very polite and friendly, as are the Istanbulers in general. More important, they are real 'professionals'. The reservation, the e-mail contact, the pick-up service from the airport: everything worked out fine. The higher staff members speak good English, at least one of them even German! ROOM: I recommend to ask for one the renovated rooms (mine was 318, single), where I found nothing to complain about, as in fact other people in this forum did. The room was very clean (albeit a little too small) with useful equipment like safe, refrigerator (i.e. mini bar), tea/coffee facility (which wasn't refilled) and sat tv (lousy picture). The bathroom was large, especially the shower. As already stated for the tv, the technical equipment didn't work too well, which didn't cause any problems for me. E.g. the roll mounting for the toilet paper came of the wall, the hairdryer's tube wouldn't stay in its mounting (could use it, though) and twice the keycard had to be recharged, which obviously happens at odd times. All but minor problems really. An annoyance might occur (but in my case didn't) because of the badly soundproofed walls. BREAKFAST: The room is large enough and very comfortable. I really cannot see the point in many of the complaints about the breakfast, which I found to be very good indeed, especially when considering that this is a mediterranean country. In fact, there was a good variety of food for most tastes - healthy stuff alongside fat makers. Important for me: they have good and fresh bread, as indeed throughout Istanbul. The coffee from the machine is horrible, so take my advice and ask for nescoffee, which they will get for you from the kitchen and which is alright - enough for getting kickstarted in the morning. CONCLUSION: To be sure, this is not a 4 star hotel, but one is getting good value for money (I paid â‚¬ 65,- per day). There were no bad surprises at all and I had nothing to worry about. This hotel is a good choice and for me returning to Istanbul means returning to the Sapphire!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Tahar_8
Reviews.Content: We especially liked the friendliness of chief receptionist. He has been very helpful in all ways (general advice, restaurant reservations, directions...). Good to note that my credit card (left in the room) has been given back to me immediately after checkout. Main thing about the hotel is location: walking distance from most of the tourist attractions and easy to get a taxi (or ferry) to or from it.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SaraandBrian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sapphire in early October for 3 nights and again mid-October for 1 night before flying back to the US. Overall, the hotel was good. The location was very close to the historical sites (although nightlife seemed a bit better near Taksim so maybe better to stay in that district if staying out very late). The tram was only $1.40 and the stop was just down the street from the hotel so very convenient if getting home before midnight (when the trams stop). The staff was nice but not overly welcoming (example: they gave Turkisk delight upon arrival but you had to pay $5 for a map). In general, I'd say it's a good budget option. We had a noisy room the first stay and after emailing the hotel, they put us in a much nicer room for our 1 night stopover. The website doesnt list a cost for an upgrade but I'd ask about a "superior room" because it was much nicer and may be worth the additional cost.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in de old centre of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Claus5
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sapphire is a nice hotel with good and clean rooms with kind and helpfull staff. Breakfast is very well: you can choose it yourself. When leaving the hotel we forgot something that was still in the safetybox. The staff found it and sent it to us in Holland. The room was cleaned intensively every day. Also outside the rooms the hotel was good looking and clean. On the street in front of the hotel there is no traffic possible and so there is no traffic noise in your room. You only hear people walking and chatting. We felt at home in the hotel. In five minutes you are walking in the park near Topkapi and in eight minutes you are standing between the Aya Sophia and the blue mosque. When you walk in the opposite direction you are on the Galatabridge in ten minutes. In short we were walking nearly all the time. We had a very good time in Istanbul. Klaas A. Bakker

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Everetttraveler
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Sapphire. It was on a narrow street with no cars but lots of restaurants nearby. It was an easy walk to anyplace in the old city. The trolley stop was one street away. They had cards at the desk to show taxi drivers where to go which was very handy since many taxi drivers we found did not speak English or Russian. Most taxi drivers knew the Aya Sophia and could be guided in from there or it is an easy walk. The thing we really liked was how easy the hotel staff made everything, from setting up guided tours, to picking a hamman and even showing the route to a restaurant I wanted to try. They recommended an excellent store for leather coats that turned out better than ones we found previously. The breakfast was a really handy way to start the day although a few days when weren't early the yogurt was finished but, there were plenty of other choices. Our room was very nice, clean and well decorated. The thing that really made this special was the sauna and pool which we had to ourselves most nights and was a nice way to finish the day of being tourists. The view from the roof is very nice especially at night although when we were there it was cool so all the furniture was put away. We were amazed at the large number of people we met in Istanbul that spoke English or Russian which made communicating so easy for us. We really enjoyed Istanbul and when we come back we will stay at Hotel Sapphire again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, good location”
Reviews.Author: Hoofddorp-tourist
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel with friendly and helpfull staff. Location ideal for the top tourist attractions such as Topkapi palace, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, train station and Bosporus ferries. Quiet street and lounge opportunities within 100 mtrs. Dutch tourist, Hoofddorp, Holland.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice people”
Reviews.Author: aworldtoknowmore
Reviews.Content: Idealy situated near historic centre and tramway station Quiet street (pedestrian) near restaurants Kind staff in any situation Good price to quality ratio Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Top Place - Clean - Friendly - Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: indexcheck
Reviews.Content: Couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough - when I had a problem they went out of their way to make sure it came to a resolution. The facilities are excellent , the location supurb (perhaps not if you're driving). The staff friendly, an excellent choice of breakfast (tip - sit to the left of the lift at breakfast - it is much less crowded) Great value

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidaymaker_39
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sapphire at the end of August and we had two rooms: a single and a twin one. Positives: Very convenient and quiet location in Sultanahmet area (on a pedestrian street), between 10 to 15 minutes walk to Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. Pretty and clean rooms with nice modern bathrooms. The rooms were small (smaller than I expected) but still adequate in size. Nice indoor swimming pool (with a spa area) and a sauna, which are rare for hotels of this range in such central location. We used it every day after our trips around Istanbul and always enjoyed it! Free one-way transfer from Ataturk airport if booked directly from the hotel, which we did. Helpful staff on the reception and also helpful maids and breakfast staff. Free wireless Internet. Some negatives (not big ones): My first room was at the back of the hotel on the 4th floor. I liked it from the minute I saw it. Unfortunately, there was some wall on the right side a few metres away (I think it was the neighbouring building) and there were lots of air conditioners on this wall, which made some noise at night. Probably it wouldn't bother people who sleep with windows shut, but I like to keep the windows open instead of running aircon for a whole night, and we live in a quiet area at home, so this noise a bit disturbed my sleep that night. In the morning I asked the reception to change my room and they did it without any problems. The room I moved in was on the 1st floor on the front of the building and, again, it was a very nice room. The only problem was a slight sewage smell in the bathroom. I mentioned it to the maid and she tried to do something while we were out, but it didn't make much difference. I didn't want to change my room again because I really liked my room otherwise, so I didn't bother mentioning it again. One person on the reception made me feel like I was a bit hassling him every time when I was asking or requesting something. He probably didn't mean to do it but still did. They have a very nice parrot in a lobby, but the cage is too small for its size, so I felt sorry for this parrot. I hope they will buy it a bigger cage. Wireless Internet didn't work properly most of the time while we were there, but I only mentioned it to the reception staff on our last day, so they were probably unaware of the problem. We ordered a transfer to the airport from the hotel and had to curry our bags to the next street, as the street where the hotel is located is pedestrian. They spared us one member of staff to help with bags, but we didn't want to be unfare to him and didn't give him more than one suitcase (so had to curry 2 other suitcases ourselves). But, I suppose, they didn't have to help us with the bags, so to spare anyone to help was already good. On the whole, it was a very comfortable stay in a very convenient location and we enjoyed staying at this hotel. We would stay there again and would definitely recommend it to everyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: kissmeiamitalian
Reviews.Content: To be sincere, if you want to visit Istanbul as a first time the location is perfect. You can walk to most museums and historical places without taking any taxi. Moreover the staff is really great, everybody is nice and ready to help and find any kind of solution. If you will contact them directly ask for Harun, he is definitely customer oriented and speaks english perfectly. Last but not least rates are really good considering above, rooms are clean and free wireless connection !!! A good choice, believe me Ciao Alexis

Reviews.Title: “a nice Hotel but nothing more!”
Reviews.Author: eWorld_traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights with my wife and my child (12 yrs old) The hotel's place was excellent (all the best sights are very near) but it's Impossible to go there by your car ( I travel to Istanbul by my car). There isn't auto road near the hotel. You must to leave your car one road far to check in. There is Parking Place (you must to give the keys of your car) about 400m far. The hotel's lobby is wonderful, but only this! The breakfast room there is a floor under lobby. This is a typical old breakfast room for 2,5 stars hotel. The breakfast is POOR! The coffee service is terrible. (terrible cappuchino which served in 20 minutes) The rooms are old. The beds are old! The cleanliness is average. The bathroom was terrible! There is a small but nice pool. The staff was friendly. A nice hotel to stay , no 4 stars ( i believe that it's 2,5 stars) but very expensive!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring Istanbul with children”
Reviews.Author: robinandwillow
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly but not terribly good at telling us how to get around town. The room was small with all single beds. It was very well cleaned each day. The hotel is nicely located near some good cafes where the children could lounge on cushions while eating. The hotel itself has a restaurant but for some reason we couldn't eat there. The airconditioning was not overly flash and the pool was nice once we got in - it was not open for quite some time. The breakfast was nice enough. Some lovely honey on the comb, fresh yoghurt and fruit as well as some traditional syrups for the yoghurt. The tea was nice. There is some building work going on in the building opposite, which can be a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and supportive poeple”
Reviews.Author: HDAD2008
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel and very nice poeple.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel, Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: Nicola120205
Reviews.Content: We based our decision to stay at Hotel Sapphire on the reports on TripAdvisor are were thrilled to arrive at nightfall, with the tinkling restaurants lights illuminating the alley leading to the hotel. The hotel is lovely - exquisitely decorated, and the service was phenomenal! We arrived to Turkish Delights and Orange Juice and were given some brief information on our location, surroundings, local etiquette and were escorted to our room on the second floor. The room was tastefully decorated, very clean and modern, tv (not that we had time to watch it!), bar fridge and the hotel had also set up a camp cot for our toddler. Throughout our stay the staff were friendly and efficient. When we checked out, the hotel gave us a small gift of Turkish Tea, Turkish Delights and two tea glasses - such a heartfelt gesture and we left feeling incredibly in love with the place! Will certainly recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: chalifert
Reviews.Content: We are a retired french couple and just come back from this hotel. The stay was very pleasant, the staff was extremely welcoming and efficient, particularly mr umit gul from the reception desk. The room was clean and very quiet, which is very important for us. the hotel was very well located close to the important sightseeings. We will surely come back to this hotel next time we go to istanboul Mr and Mrs Charlier

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Sapphire
HotelInfo.Address: Ibni Kemal caddesi no:14 Sirkeci, Istanbul 34410, Turkey
